text:
2016 version. 
Brownish beer with a quickly disappearing cream coloured head.

Aroma: roasted malts, some liquorice, dark fruits.

Taste: pretty much the same as the aroma but with some sourness in there. 

Not a lot of carbonation with a medium mouthfeel.

2013 Edition. From 0.33 L bottle; pours dark brown, nearly black with a very small, light brown head. Very malty aroma, red dried fruits, dark bread. Taste follows the aroma with a light sweetness and yeasty taste, heavy malty taste and also dried fruit. Sweet and very long, slightly yeasty finish. Full mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very good!
Bottle, 2015. Color: Very dark ruby, thin beige head. Taste: Mostly sweet, prunes, hints of brown sugar and alcohol. Soft carbonation, full body. Lightly bitter hints. Well balanced.
Ciemne. Obfita piana szybko znika sycząc i pryskają. W aromacie suszone owoce, wiśnie i czekolada. Znakomicie ukryty alkohol. Gładkie i treściwe. Słodkie ale nie wyklejające.

Pours black with brown-ish head. Strong hints of coffee, spices and dried prunes. 
Good masked alcohol with a very slight bitter taste. Lasting aftertaste. 
One of my favourites so far.
butelka 2015 przyprawowe, ciastka, rodzynki troche czekolady alkohol fajnie ukryty w ogole nie czuc tych 10%. lux

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 Birra dal colore marrone scuro. Schiuma quasi inesistente. Al naso sentori di caramello, malto tostato, toffe e caffè. Al palato si presenta con un corpo che unge la bocca, molto stucchevole e dolce. Richiama molto la rochefort 10 ma molto più liquorosa. Tutto sommato una buona birra da bere con parsimonia.
33cl bottle. Great beer, but for some reason not my cup of tea. the aftertaste is a bit too much for me.
Pannepot 2016. Almost black with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel, grapes and burnt sugar. Taste is bread, prunes and caramel

Bottle at Brussels. Deep amber with no head. The aroma has notes of dark bread, yeasts, cookies, some roastiness and chocolate. Sweet flavor, alcoholic, some roastiness, chocolate, dark bread, sourish, oily, dried fruits, raisin, very complex. Full-bodied.

Bottle, 2015. Hazy amber brown with a beige head. Aroma of prunes, raisins, caramel, molasses, chocolate, spices and dark bread. Moderately sweet, dark fruits, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, prunes, chocolate. Full-bodied, slightly dry finish. Complex and rich. Great.
超級立體而強
Apples, dried fruit, yeast, spices, sugary, medium to high sweet. Texture and body somehow resembles cider or sparkling wine. Very complex and unique, great brew.
Butelka rocznik 2015. Aromat śliwka, karmel, cukier trzcinowy, w smaku do tego dochodzi troche czekolady i kawy, papryczki rozgrzewają na równi z alkoholem na finiszu. Dobre

Aromat - śliwki, czekolada, wiśnie, pumpernikiel, karmel, szlachetny alkohol
Piana - prawie brak, redukuje się do obrączki, ale i ta po chwili znika.
Ciało średnie. Lekka kwaskowość. Rodzynki, karmel i w zasadzie tyle. Dość pusto.

Bottle. Vintage 2015. Deep brown with light brown, frothy head, Moderate malty aroma - spices, dried fruits, licorice, coffee, brown sugar, some ginger, caramel, chocolate, clear booziness, yeasty. Taste is semi-sweet to sweet, Mouthful is thick and creamy, body is oily and sticky, carbonation is soft, finish is sweet, spicy and creamy. In overall very complex, smooth and creamy. Great brew.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 330ml bottle from Beershop.com.ua. Vintage 2015. Pours a very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, some oak. Taste is sweet, slightly tart with lots of dark fruits notes and cherries in chocolate. Similar taste with some boozy and chocolate notes. Good stuff.

2016 330ml bottle pours deep opaque brown with almost no head. Subtle aromas of dark chocolate, dark fruits and oak. Earthy flavours of cocoa, ash, stone fruit, sour grape, white wine vinegar and herbal characters. Any sweetness is veiled by the fruity tartness that lingers through the finish. Low carbonation (almost flat), but the alcohol is reasonable well disguised. The sourness is a little dominating in this vintage.

Pannepot 2015, poured from the bottle. Some sournss, dark grapes, molasses, burnt sugar in the nose. The carbonation is quiet low for a quadrupel as the head is medium and quickly diminishes, however this is a classic carbonation for a strong ale (like ris etc.). In taste there are some dark fruity notes, dark bread, burnt sugar, its more sweet and less sour than in the aroma, but there is this strong tart note that makes it akin to wine and sour beers. Quiet interesting and complex, but I would prefer more quadrupel like and less sour version.

From 330ml bottle. Pours black with no head and soft carbonation. Aroma of dark fruits and raisins. Taste is slightly complex with prune, raisin, dandelion and burdock, spice and caramel. Alcohol is very evident at 10% do one to sip and savour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat : słodki, ciężki i mocny. Są w nim karmel, suszone owoce, rodzynki, figi.
Wygląd: kolor bardzo ciemnej miedzi, piana jasnobrązowa na centymetr, średniopęcherzykowa, jasnobrązowa, później praktycznie zanika.
Smak: słodycz, ale bardziej od jasnych, świeżych, słodkich owoców niż czekoladowa. Gładkie, treściwe i rozgrzewające. W smaku mamy wpierw świeże brzoskwinie, morele, gruszki, później wchodzą suszone owoce-śliwki, figi, rodzynki, karmel i trochę czekolady. Słodycz nie jest przytłaczająca, lekka kwaskowatość na finiszu, uczucie lekkiego ściągania na języku, pewnie od alkoholu, ale nie jest to nieprzyjemne, trochę drzewnych klimatów. Wydaje się dosyć lekkie jak na swą moc. Dobre
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark amber with an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are dried fruit, vanilla, caramel. and spices.

Almost black. A complex beast, Pannepot offers malty flavours, phenolic spice, fruity notes, and burnt caramel. It opens with a powerful and sweet taste, and ends with a dry, alcoholic and lightly bitter finish, where the many flavours linger. Full body. Overall, a truly great belgian strong ale. It is very rich and complex, yet harmonic. It does get a bit heavy towards the end, though.

Kicsi, nem túl tartós hab, feketébe hajló szín. Csokis, kávés, aszalt gyümölcsös illat. Kissé édeskés, aszalt gyümölcsös, csokis, enyhén karamelles ízvilág, határozott, de nem túl tolakodó hordós aromákkal. Testes, közepesen szénsavas, enyhén keserű. Nagyon finom, jó egyensúllyal és arányokkal rendelkező sör.

33 cl bottle 2015 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ in Trappist [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 9 degrees C. Pours almost black with a small off white head with good retention, clotting and lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, a little tar, dark, dried fruits and a hint of dark chocolate. Surprised at the taste at first. Is this a variation of an Imperial Stout? More roasted malt, more tar and heavy sweetness, but as the beer opens up, it begins to distinguish itself and a little yeasty sourness takes it away from the stout, adding notes of vanilla and other spizes. Alcohol present, adding depth and warmth, but not dominating. Long, lingering aftertaste again more like stout, but with more complexity and spizyness. A complex class beer for a cold winter day, but leaning towards being too heavy for my taste.

Aroma: dried fruits, raisins, figs, vanilla, spices and light chocolate notes. Taste: dried fruits, chocolate, vanilla, light burbon notes, spices and classy alcohol. Small, quickly disappearing head, average lacing and low to medium carbonation.
Barwa brunatna, piana ładna. Aromat suszone owoce, wanilia, burbon, karmel, przyprawy, rodzynki. W smaku podobnie, team słodyczka po suszonemu. No jest dobrze, bardzo dobry, mocny BSA.
Superb strong beer to savour slowly. Roasted malts balance well with fruity notes.

W aromacie rodzynki i figi, po pewnym czasie wychodzi lekki rozpuszczalnik. W smaku również rodzynki i figi do tego dochodzą karmelizowane owoce, Alko lekko grzeje. Było smaczne ale chyba delikatnie za świeże.
No head and light carbonation, sticky texture. Red brown colour. Lots of dark fruits and caramel, slightly alcoholic.

Bottle (Pannepot 2015). Hazy brown colour, small beige head. Aroma of prunes, dried fruits, spices, caramel, molasses - very rich and harmonious. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, light bitter, very light tart: caramel, molasses, brown sugar, prunes, dried fruits, spices, some chocolate, sherry, light vinous - deep and complex, with sweetness nicely balanced by yeast and light fruity tartness. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. High drinkability for the ABV. Outstanding beer!
true strong belgian ale. strongly recommend this beer for someone looking for an ale with a little kick.

13/20 weird beer. Like an imperial stout with a weird vinegar taste. Prefer an imp stout but it's interesting 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Bottle (Vintage 2016). Dark brown, with tiny tanned head. Aroma of caramel, wet wood, yeast, hints of smoke and sourness. The taste was a surprise based on the aroma. More sourness, vinegar, caramel, fruty, gooseberry, the ending has some dryness. Medium carbonation. 

Good beer and different in the style. 

UPDATE:

Tried another one from 2015. Sourness was less dominant, which was a positive thing for me and the body was more oily, which i also loved - great mouthfeel. so the new rating is based on the 2015, so I raised the palate from 4 - 5 and the taste from 8 - 9.

Bottle. It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of dark malts, bread, dried fruits and spices. The taste was similar to the aroma with more dark malts, bread, dried fruits, spices and some alcohol. It had light carbonation and a dry aftertaste. Really tasty.
W aromacie śliwka, owoce kandyzowane, czekolada, wanila. W smaku wiśniowo, trochę kawy i karmelu, finisz ciut alkoholowy, ale w bardzo przyjemny sposób. No świetne piwo.

33 cl. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: not very intense aromas of toasted and roasted malts, dark fruits, prunes, raisins, hints of dark chocolate, liquorice, spices, some alcohol, maybe sherry, coffee.
Appearance: dark brown color with beige head. Under average head thickness made of big bubbles. Very dark but it seems to have some hazyness. Low retention. No Brussels lacing.
Taste: medium-to-high sweetness, low bitterness, no sourness. Intense flavors of toasted and roasted malts, hints of dark chocolate, coffee, cane sugar, dark fruits, raisins, prunes. The high alcohol level is not very much noticeable. 
Palate: medium-to-full body, oily texture, silky-sticky, very low carbonation, not very long sweet finish of dark fruits, prunes, raisins, some dark chocolate, toasted and roasted malts, spices, hints of alcohol.
Overall: very good flavors and aromas of dark fruits, raisins, prunes, toasted and roasted malts, some alcohol, coffee and dark chocolate. Very pleasant and complex. Well hidden alcohol. To enjoy slowly. Very good beer.
Just not my thing. I can see how this might be a fan favorite but it didnt really float my boat.

33cl bottle bought at De Roemer, Groningen. Appearance: dark reddish brown with medium beige head. Aroma: sweet with notes of butterscotch, plums, caramel, dried red fruits, sweet spices and a trace of coconut. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of butterscotch, dried fruits, caramel, berries and chocolate. Alcohol is well hidden. Palate: medium to full bodied, creamy to sticky texture and medium carbonation.

Botella Vintage 2016 en 99Cervezas.
Vierte en color castaño oscuro ligeramente turbio. Espuma ligeramente tintada, escasa y bastante fugaz, Sin apenas adherencia. Porque carbonatación. 
Indudablemente intensa nariz, con fuertes notas de ciruela pasa. Bastante licorosa en nariz y con un punto de pegamento. Complejidad media. 
Centros sabores destaca el dulce, con una primera entrada en boca francamente sorprendente. Y aparece también un punto de acidez muy suave que equilibra muy bien el dulce. 
Con la evolución en boca aparece un amargor muy tenue, y a pesar de ser el dulce el sabor principal, el final en boca no resulta en la absoluto empalagoso. Más bien al contrario. La sensación de estar tomando algo parecido a un licor de frutas es notable. 
Peso medio en boca y textura casi aterciopelada. A pesar de ser una cerveza licorosa, no se sienten en absoluto los 10° de alcohol que tiene. En este sentido está muy bien equilibrada. Persistencia en boca baja. 
Una cerveza agradable para tomar como copa, aunque poco apta si lo que buscas es una cerveza refrescante. Hay que saber lo que se está tomando antes de abrir una Pannepot Vintage. Personalmente siento que se queda a medias y no redondea como es debido el concepto de cerveza como copa, aunque es sin duda una cerveza que siempre vale la pena beber.

Bottle. Brown with a medium beige head. Complex and funky aroma of dark malts, dried fruits, toffee and brett. Medium sweetness followed by light funky sournes and a touch of bitterness. Smooth velvetty body. A rich and complex sipper, one of my favorites.

Bottle, vintage 2014. Pours very dark brown, with a creamy, mocha head. Aroma is wooden yeast and dark roasted malts, with bread, raisins, tobacco, tannins and vanilla, 
Medium body, with average carbonation. Flavour is wooden yeast and roasted malts, with bread, kandi, leather, prunes and wooden barrels, as well as earthy spices and some notes of coffee.

Consumed for Drink It Now day, hosted by GenDV138. Poured a dark, opaque brown color, light brown head. Aroma was dark fruits, caramel. Roasted toffee. Flavor was nice rich dark fruits, toffee comes through. Slightly dry finish. Alcohol is pretty well hidden. Not bad.

Bottle shared for Allagashs Drink It Now Day. Thanks David! Dark brown with beige head. Aromas of dark fruit, caramel, toffee. Tastes of caramel, dark fruit, toffee, spice. Medium body with a dry finish.

Bottle. Dark Brown with Reddish tinge. Very, very malty; lots and lots of dark chocolate, roasty malts, caramel, toffee, demerara sugar. Fruits; dark fruits, raisins, dark cherries. Spicy; cinnamon, nutmeg. Yeasty. Smooth, rich. Alcohol warming but well disguised for ABV. Sweet malty, fruity, spicy beer. Top class! Fantastic beer! (2008)

Bottle. Pours dark brown to black, with a foamy, brown head. Raisins, dates, fruit, cellar and tobacco, tiny alcohol sting, some wine and balsamic vinegar. Mostly sweet. A bit dry, slightly tart actually. Quite full body. A bit too soft carbonation. Good, but the flavours are a bit flat in my opinion. Maybe my expectations were too high.

Bottle at Dulle Grier. Dark black color with an off white head. Malt cherry chocolate aroma. Chocolate sweet cherry flavour. Heavy body. Very smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flesje thuis gedronken. Diep donkerbruin helder bier met weinig schuim. Aroma van donker fruit. Smaak van fruit, koffie, chocolade en hout. In de nasmaak komt de koffie en chocolade ook naar boven.

2015 version. Pours dark brown with a minimal beige head. The aroma contains coffee, chocolate, licorice, dry fruits, spices and butterscotch. It tastes medium sweet and light bitter. Long, sweet spicy and light sour finish. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. The alcohol is very well hidden and becomes warming. Great in all aspects.

Medium taste spectrum and medium after taste with malty berries.Pa: Medium/Strong body with low carbonation.Ovr: Overall, high quality but too sour for the style.Earlier Rating: 2/11/2017 Total Score: 4.5Vintage 2015. Ar: Strong, bold taste with sweet and sour, slightly buttery aroma with bit overaged fruits like cherry and plum. Also chocolate and a hint of butter cookies.Ap: Dark brown/black color with small lighter beige head.
Ta: Strong, balanced taste with slightly dry, bit overaged dark fruits, licorice and some spices. Sweetish malts can be detected. Also softening nuances like butter cookies. Wide taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with sweeter malts.
Pa: Strong, oily body with light carbonation.
Ov: Overall, a superb product with distinctive character. A hint of alcohol is coming trough. Could have a bit more malts.

Bottle 0,33.
Dark brown color, hazy, small head. Aroma: roasted malts, caramel, oak. Taste: sweet-bitterish, wood, toffee, liquorice. Nice beer!
Acheter au Vermont, pris dans une dégustation chez moi. Bière très bonne, avec pleins de saveurs. Jai apprécié chaque goûte.

Mahogany brown pour. Very little head, and it dissipates quickly. Not at all viscous. Flavours of liquorice, dates, white peach, cocoa, caramel and chewing toffee. Surprisingly smooth, soft finish. Hides the alcohol content very well.

bottle @ home (2015)
clear brown, brown head quickly disappearing
peach juice, light ashy, liquor, coffee, rich roasted malts. Dry roasted malts, marsala, light alcohol, roasted caramel, coffee notes. Quite thick palate.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 W aromacie nuty czekoladowe, owocowe w stylu wiśni i śliwki, lekkie fenole, nuty waniliowe. W wyglądzie bordowe wpadające w czerń, lekka obrączka piany. W smaku drożdżowe, czerwone owoce, wiśnie, śliwki, lekko słodkie, lekko kwaskowate, do tego nieco nut kawowych, nieco zbliżone do wytrawnego wina. Przyjemnie rozgrzewa, ładnie ułożone. Niezłe, ale spodziewałem się więcej, nieco zaniepokoiła też mnie ta kwaskowatość

330ml bottle from Systembolaget, vintage 2015. Pours clear black with a medium size brown head, leaving some lacing. Fruity aroma, sweet dried fruit, tart apples, cherries, roasted malt, caramel and mild spices. Full-bodied, medium to high carbonation, silky and chewy mouthfeel. The taste is fruity with chocolate and roasted barley, figs, cherries, toffee, earthy, mild spicy, cinnamon and anise. Complex taste with depth without being heavy to drink, the alcohol is well hidden and the finish is mild sweet and pleasantly roasted with a mild warming sensation. Quality stuff!

(vintage 2015) Aroma with home red wine with a medium sourness, apple juice, well fermented fruits, some spices. Sweetly and slightly sour taste, with cinnamon, vanilla and a bit of pepper (not spicy), sweet fruits (apple, pear, some grape) a bit fermented, white wine must, some yeast. Good and well balanced!

Vintage 2016. Very strong aroma: lots of alcohol, smoked oak, rum. Strong taste: heavy smoked malts, oak, nuts, toasted caramel, lots of alcohol. Light sweet, light bitter, rather complex. I would say alcohol should be hidden better. By its rich taste I could even consider this beer as a quadruple. Certainly worth drinking, but its not easy.
Flaska systembolaget. Svart vätska. Vinös doft. Druva, torkad frukt, kryddor, vörtbröd och sirap. Mustig och djup smak. Russin, knäck, jäst och portvin. Diskret sötma och värmande alkohol
bottle 33cl. i know it is famous and reputable, but i think its taste is slightly thin for its rating.

Vintage 2006. Pours a clear, warm amber golden with a dense, beige head leaving some lacework. Very complex, vinous aroma with notes of raisins in rum. Sweet and full body with flavours of dried fruit, vanilla and brown sugar - and again a touch of rum. Not overly sweet and the alcohol is surprisingly well hidden in spite of the total lack of bitterness. The mouthfeel is extremely smooth and soft.
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 Koffie en sigaar in de neus. Drop, koffie en zurige frisheid (mede door koolzuur) in de smaak. Prachtige complexe afdronk.

Bottle at home. 2013 vintage. Dried fruits, liquorice, fudge, cookies, black berries and hints of port wine.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Deep ruby color with tiny head. Aroma - Dried fruits, r-malts, caramel, spice. Taste - Heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, berries, milk choc, cocoa, caramel.

Bottle from Brewcraft at home. Nearly opaque dark brown pour. Thin tan head. Aroma is dark fruit, leather, a bit of soy umami but not in a bad way, grassy bitter, nice. Taste is fruity in a quadrupel sort of way, but brighter, dark fruit and molasses, some background bitterness, boozy warmth. Rich palate that sticks a bit to the lips. Very nice.

Bottle from Brewcraft, drank at home poured into a tulip glass. Opaque brown-black with thin tan fizzy head and watery legs. Smells of cola, bready biscuit, biscotti, light almond, dark fruit, dry but sweet sugars, light marshmallow, lots of booze, some raisin, faint soy sauce, moderate grassy bitterness. Taste is nutty spicy brown malt, light grass and yeast and plum. Body is medium, fizzy lively carbonation, medium, heavier sweetish finish. Great aroma. Big but complex and refined.

Appearance: beige head, clear dark brown color. Aroma: chocolate, vanilla, prunes, alcohol. Taste: caramel, chocolate, soy sauce, licorice, oily, light bitterness at start with sweet a bit sour finish. Medium body, long finish, low to medium on gas, very drinkable for this level of alcohol.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
2010
Bottle. High end new brews of historical beer styles. a lots of molases and fry fruits. great choice.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 Bottle. Pours dark ruby. Nose: young wine, summer fruit, sour cherries. Tastes like malts and fruit. Oak and brown cane sugar. Delicious.
@ PINT tasting - Light opaque dark ruby, small tanned foam ring remaining. Sour aroma and taste, quite nice, great beer. (Arnhem 201612)

Vintage 2016. Dark ruby with a bit of brown head that goes away in seconds. Aroma is incredible. Red fruits, caramel, oak soaked in red wine. Taste starts tart cherries and gradually leaves room to umami notes of soy sauce, red wine dryness, caramel malts, molasses. Heavy body, vinous mouthfeel, dry finish. Amazing beer.

Pours dark with a brown frothy head. Odour of roasted malt and caramel. Lively mouthfeel of chocolate malt and heavy fruits including cherry. Thick and chewy, so much in there its difficult to make it all out. Probably best as a winter warmer type of thing.

Vintage 2014er Edition. Wow. Hart und outstanding SOUR. Angefunkt und malzig verspielt. Pfaume, Kirsche und die spritzige Zitrone. Oh ja, alle schauen mal rein. Holy Brown Sour Ale. Der Abgang lang und angewürzt. Yepp. What a long long love...:). 0,33/Ca.5Euro. Aus einem Kiosk in Kopenhagen. Bottle.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
A very rich dark fruits combination with a lot of molasses and brown sugar.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Definicja quadrupla. Sporo ciała, alkohol dobrze ukryty. Ogrom melasy, ciemnych owoców (figi, śliwki), kandyzowany cukier, delikatna owocowa kwasowość, a nawet i delikatne nuty kawy, czekolady.
Fantastic red wine smells not overly sweet great beerwith a long last taste on the pallette

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Advent Calendar day 9. Very deep ruby to black colour, with a thin off white head. Fruity berry and soft fruit aroma with light toffee. Taste mid sweet, certainly not over sweet. Thick and sticky body.

Bottle, 2016 Vintage. Pours real dark, like red wine with a bit of black ink. Heads small, diminished to nothing in seconds. Aromas lovely, its burnt caramel, red fruits, both dried and soaked in red wine, rather dominant black cherries, woody. Tastes of overripe or almost gone off red fruits, woody, red wine tannins and dryness... not too good to be honest. Harsh, kinda acidic and on top of that very dry on the palate. Seems overrated, at least this batch here and/or this young, it just doesnt grab me, doesnt impress in any way. Aromas the best part. It probably gets better when as it ages.
How: bottle Appearance: almost blsck, tiny khaki head. _Aroma: blackberries, ripe cherries, raisins, chocolate, plums, Palate: full body, low carbonation.

Pannepot when brewed correctly is a good beer. Now and then I open one, an all round classic. The last three Pannepots I have had over the course of the past few months have all been infected into a nasty sour mess. I dont remember the what a good Pannepot is supposed to taste like anymore. All I know is this vinegary, light bodied, sour thing called Pannepot, a beer I used to like. I hope to try a good one again some day, until then I sadly have to lower my score.

Black colour, minimal head. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, roasted malt, chocolate, spices, rye bread. Sweet dry taste with light bitterness in finish and aftertaste. Medium to full body and average carbonation. Nice dark ale with strong fruity notes.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 2015 edition 1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam, during De Struise Brouwers tap takeover. Nose is dried fruits. Body is very dark brown, head is small, beige, frothy, average lasting, fair lacing. Aroma is dark berries, dried fruits, milk chocolate, roasted malt. Medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity chocolate medium sourish bittersweet. Full body, oily texture, nearly flat carbonation. Bit heavy dessert beer, rich flavor, good balance, nice one.

0,33l bottle from Firmabier. Pours dark brown almost black colour with slight head. Aroma of roasted malts, yeast, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, cocoa, spices, oak, tartness. Sweet taste, medium body, slightly bitter and a bit alcoholy.

33cl-fles bij Restaurant t Hommelhof te Watou. U: Bijna zwart met een dunn beige schuimkraag. G: Chocolade, geroosterde mout, vineus en gedroogd fruit. S: Zoet met een licht bittertje en een licht zuurtje, karamel, pure chocolade, donker fruit. Zeer complex. M: Volmondig met lichte koolzuurprikkel. Licht sticky.
Color oscuro, mucho cuerpo, mucho caramelo, chocolate, una cerveza para masticarla y sobre todo, disfrutarla, muy muy buena

2014 batch, on tap at York River Landing. A beer so good that its almost its own style category. It straddles the line between stout and Belgian dark ale, and its unsurprisingly phenomenal. The flavor is "chocolate-covered raisins" -- a mix of cocoa from the dark malts and stone fruits from the caramel malts. In a class by itself.

Pannepot Old Fisherman Ale 2014. Excelente BDSA. Comparando com a Grand Reserva, fico com a última, mas ainda assim uma breja espetacular! 4.25/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Der Struise Pannepot von 2015 zeigt sich dunkelbraun, fast schwarz mit beigem Schaum. Der Geruch ist stark malzig, leicht süßlich mit wunderbaren Aromen von getrockneten dunklen Früchten, dunkler Schokolade und Gewürzbrot. Der Antrunk ist eine Offenbarung: Schwer wie Öl füllt das Bier den Mund aus und weiß mit einer tollen und komplexen Aromenvielfalt zu begeistern. Der wuchtige Malzkörper erinnert neben den bereits genannten Aromen auch an angebrannten Zucker und starkem Lakritz. Die Röstbittere passt hier hervorragend.
Von mir eine absolute Empfehlung!

2016/10/22 - Pours a cloudy dark brown amber colour with a thin, khaki head that quickly dissipates and leaves no lacing. Aroma is dried dark fruits (prunes, dates, raisins, doughy yeast, burnt caramel and dark bread. Taste is candi sugar, burnt caramel, prune, dates, bread and spices. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with low carbonation and a sweet, drying finish. Hides the ABV exceptionally well. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piana szybciutko znika. W aromacie suszone owoce, czerwone owoce, alkohol lekko podbija te doznania. Jest intensywnie. W smaku dalej susz, sporo wiśni objawia się w nieco kwaskowaty sposób. Wysokie wysycenie. Leciutki alkohol na finiszu nie przeszkadza, a w fajny sposób dopełnia kompozycje. Wytrawny finisz, jak na rasowego belga przystało. Świetne, szkoda, że to tylko butelka na pół:(

0,33l bottle @ Tuulensuu during the OKS Oktoberfest. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts with burnt caramel. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, burnt caramel, alcohol and some hops. Great.
Some plums and malts in the aroma. mahogany colour, with some off white head. taste is medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Finish is soft sweet, medium body, velvet feel. Good easy drinking beer,

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Bottle 33cl. Bière quasi noire avec une magnifique mousse très foncée ... qui retombe aussi vite. Le nez : le chocolat, les fruits (pruneau, raisin ...), le caramel, lalcool (rhum?), les épices ... La bouche : explosion de saveurs avec café en entrée, caramel, sucre candi, alcool, fruits noirs (cerise aussi). Larrière-bouche est légèrement amère et épicée. Bière très complexe et équilibrée -comme déjà dit ici dans toutes les langues. Quelle est bonne ! Et elle pourrait être servie en pousse-café.

Un verre Maredsous nous fait apparaître une belle robe dun brun foncé avec des reflets rouge carmin.La mousse est très fine et éphémère.Le nez nous offre des arômes de pruneaux,dattes...La bouche nous amène sur des gouts déjà bien sentis initialement avec une petite pointe de café,chocolat et porto.... en fin de bouche.Cette bière nous laisse sur une bonne amertume mêlée à tout cet ensemble très riche!Une très grande bière qui donne envie dy revenir.....

Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Température de début environ 9°
Robe chocolat noir avec reflets rouges, mousse beige qui disparaît très vite et carbonatation intense.
Nez très complexe et subtil : chocolat, vieux porto, épices ... et mille autres arômes à découvrir lors de futures dégustations.
Goût à la fois puissant et velouté ; notes délicates de fruits secs, de cacao, de pruneau et de café le tout dans un équilibre miraculeux.
La finale est longue,très douce et donne envie de revisiter ce chef-doeuvre.
Extraordinaire!!!

Color dorado oscuro, algo anaranjado y cobrizo. La corona de espuma es muy abundante, de un blanco pulcro, especialmente densa y bastante duradera. En nariz es dulzona, afrutada (cítricos y manzanas verdes), sobre la que destaca de Cerveza fuerte de estilo belga homenaje a los pescadores belgas que capitaneaban las pannepot o buques de pesca de bajura. Imprescindible y con una gran capacidad de envejecer. El olor es dulce, a maltas y especias, muy complejo, con notas tostadas, toffe, licorosas, afrutadas, a azúcar moreno. En boca es igualmente dulce, y vuelven sabores a caramelo, café, frutas y especias. Es una cerveza intensa, como de navidad y que hay que beber a media temperatura y en copa pequeña.forma clara y notable el lúpulo y matices herbáceos. En boca al principio es dulzona con matices afrutados (a cítricos como la naranja), y claramente especiados (como el coriandro). Del dulzor inicial se pasa al amargor explosivo del lúpulo para terminar con una notable acidez y un matiz metálico resultando un tanto terrosa y herbácea. El regusto resulta especialmente seco y muy prolongado.

330ml bottle. Black with a half finger beige head. Aroma of rich dark malts, slightly sweet black bread, dried fruits, fighs and complex spices with cardamon clearly distinguishable. Taste is mixed dark malts, dried fruits, mixed spices (cardamon, bitter orange, cloves etc), crisp bread and a light touch of alcohol. Smooth yet filling mouthfeel, light carbonation and dry aftertaste of sweet brown bread and mixed bread spices.

Bottle 0.33L, labeled 2015.
Dark brown body with an average, frothy, tan head, mostly diminishing with some nice lacing, though.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (caramel, toasted) aroma with notes of red (cherries liqueur) and dark (prunes) fruits, spices, coffee, licorice and some raisins.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet and moderate bitter flavour; long-lasting sweet finish with light bitter notes.
Full body with creamy texture; soft carbonation: light alcoholic warming in the finish.
Dunkelbraun bis schwarz mit reichlich hellbraunem Schaum. Reichlich malzig, Röstaromen, Karamell, dunkle Schokolade, Kaffee, süßlich, fruchtig, Waldbeeren, Pflaumen.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! 2014 bottle poured into a snifter showing rusty rims, dark brown centers and no head. 

The nose shows a dessert mix of plums and caramel malts. 

The palate is fully carbonated and medium bodied. Flavors of plums, raisins, and caramel with a light sweetness.

(330ml 2015 bottle from Systembolaget) Pours dark cola brown with a small off white head that fades quickly. Aroma of plum, raisin, candied apple, caramel, toasted grain. Flavour is quite sweet but with a tart fruitiness to it as well, lots of plum, fresh figs, red grape, black currant, caramel, dark and slightly bready malt, herbs, light toast. Finish is medium sweet with a little bit of drying provided by alcohol and the subtle herbal/spicy notes, chocolate and roast. Medium-full, slightly syrupy body with soft carbonation. A classic that I somehow havent rated. Sweet like many of the style but with much going on rather than just dark sugars, and a fruity balance that makes it stand out. Class act.

Pitch black body with medium sized brown head. Aroma of alcohol, lots of chocolate and cocoa. Taste is liquorice, chocolate, wonderful bitter cocoa finish with some brown sugar and little bit of dried fruit. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Great!

Z butelki pachnie suszonymi owocami, w szkle te wrażenia się wzmagają, uzupełnione przez świeże owoce, nuty chlebowe, delikatny, jakby kwaśny alkohol.
Piana po chwili opada do kilkumilimetrowej obrączki. Piwo jest ciemnobrązowe, miejscami przejrzyste. W ustach daje wrażenie pełnego, ale nie oleistego. wysycenie minimalne, ale wyczuwalne. W smaku dosyć słodkie (brązowy cukier, ciasto drożdżowe, karmel), chlebowe, nadal delikatnie alkoholowe. Rocznikowi 2015 dałbym 3.8, ale pamiętam, że 2012 był wyśmienity, dlatego podwyższam. Piwo fantastycznie nadaje się do leżakowania.

Aroma: malt sweetness, alcohol, caramel, prune.
Appearance: dark brown color, with small head.
Taste: malt sweetness, caramel, a bit bitterness, dry finish.
Palate: alcohol warmth, middle body.

Very dark brown with light brown head. Dark fruit, chocolate, coffe and caramel. Sweet with a bit of roasty bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. 2104 edition. Dark brown with a beige persistent head. Complex, with pronounced vinous character (more strong in this 2014 version than the previous)  with notes of raisins fruit, spices, molasses, chocolate, toffee, caramel and, maybe, nuts. Final a little liqueur, with alcohol very well inserted. Excellent.
2015 bottle. Brown with creamy tan head. Malt, yeast aroma, dried fruits, coffee hints. Sweet caramel flavour, malt, dried fruits, alcohol. Perfectly balanced

Trap (AleBrowar, Wroclaw). Barwa brunatna, wpadajaca w czarna, rubinowa pod swiatlo. Piana bezowa, niezbyt obfita ale cienki kozuszek utrzymuje sie calkiem dlugo. Aromat intensywny z nutami owocow, suszonych owocow, slodowy z subtelnymi nutami slodow ciemnych, mega przyjemny. Ciemne slody, owoce i subtelny kwasek na finiszu to smaki przewodnie. Poza tym suszone owoce, ciut karmelu to bogactwo smaku podkreslone subtelna nutka alkoholu. Piwo jest stosunkowo gladkie a przy tej mocy calkiem pijalne.
ottima,storica birra dedi rfagazzi di de struise ,maturata in botte ,forti aromi torrefatti ,speziata ,gradazione alcolica elevata ,un verro mito

Svartbrun med ett stort skum. Torkad frukt, söt värmande alkohol. Lite som kan jang men gott

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is sweet malty with raisins, plums and nuts. Taste is brown sugar sweetness, raisins, syrup. A bit spicey and fruits with nuts going on in here.

11.2 oz. bottle. 2013 edition. Pours a dark brown color with a short-lived beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, dark fruits, apple, spice and alcohol. Taste is malt, caramel, dark fruits, plum, and spice. Finish is somewhat sweet and very warming. To be sipped and contemplated...

brown close to black. spongy foam café au lait good retention being an edge to the surface without leaving a trace of lace too. powerful and complex aroma. notes typical style as dark and sweet fruit like plums, figs and raisins. notes also appear in the background of chocolate, roasted malt, hazelnuts, vanilla and spices like cinnamon. Alcohol appears hopelessly nose but not displeasing. In widening mouth of aromatic sensations, lots of dark fruit, candy, cake, vanilla and spices. Very bodied and creamy, which fills the mouth with easy entry aided by a moderate carbon atypical style.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 Color marrón muy oscuro casi negro con capa de espuma marrón mínima. No mucha carbonatación. Aroma de licor, alcohólico, pero agradable (y no suelo decir esto). Presencia de frutas, levadura y algo tostado (notas lejanas de café). Sabor muy complejo y robusto. Frutal, se nota algo de café (no sé si es cosa mía o no, pero hay algún elemento en el trago y en el aroma que me remite a maltas tostadas de cerveza negra); se nota el alcohol (más que nada en la garganta y el estómago, pues quema; en boca está pero no es tan remarcado). Hay mucho en cada trago de esta cerveza. Un acierto.
Bottle at Moeder Fonteinas. 2015 vintage. Simply awesome stuff, feels like a smooth jagermeister-in-a-brew, loving it... until it starts hitting me hard on the back of the neck :)

Smells of alcohol, fruit, herbs and spices. Completely black with barely any head. Taste is sweet with a lot of fruits, but this is nicely balanced out by the tones of herbs and roasted malts. Aftertaste is liquorice and herbs. Somewhat thick body.
Not the best version of this beer, but still amazing.

Aroma: heavily sweet with boozy, wine notes; Appearance: dark red-brown with thin, white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: follows nose; very rich and complex, not too boozy; delicious; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: excellent example of a belgian; would definitely buy again when I can get it.

330 mL bottle shared with ebone1988. Got this one in a trade with Eddie. The pour is a darker brown/light black with a thicker and creamy light tan head that falls down to a thicker ring. The aroma is surprisingly fruity. There is a heavy grape and ripe fig but to it with minimal malts. Its a bit winey, and interesting. Definitely not what I was expecting here. The flavor is really deep and complex. There is a good maltiness up front that produces bits of sweet toffee and light chocolate. The figs hold their own and offer a strong darkness to it. The grapes fade from bright and fruity to more of a dark and dry wine addition. Its complex and good. The mouth feel is a little light and the carbonation is well done. There is a hint of wine on the back end, but the sweet malts and a light roast really balance out the dry finish. This isnt as good as I was hoping. Overall, its not bad.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. 2011 vintage. Finally. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, grapes, dark fruit, booze, spices, great. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head, viscous. Taste is fruity, caramel, chocolate, dark fruit, wine maybe, dry, sweet, good stuff. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, dry dark fruit aftertaste. Overall, this is really quite good.

2010: PE 24.9.2016. Vaahtoaa hieman ja jättää aavistuksen beigeä vaahtoa oluen pinnalle pitkäksi aikaa. Syvän tummanruskea olut, ei jätä pitsiä. Tuoksu karamellisen maltainen, tumman hedelmäinen ja luumuinen, vaniljainen, suklainen, todella viettelevän houkutteleva. Maku on yhtä lailla balanssissa huikean tuoksun kanssa. Makean maltainen, tumman hedelmäinen, suklainen, aavistuksen salmiakkinen ja mausteinen. Täyteläinen ja makea suutuntuma, paahteinen jälkipuolisko. Aavistuksen karkeampi varsinkin jälkimaun puolelta kuin Reserva 2009. Loistava! Keskenään vertailtuna (2009 Reserva & 2010 normaali) jälkimmäiselle piste enemmän ulkonäöstä vaahdon takia, Reservalle taas piste enemmän pehmeytensä ansiosta.

Bottle 2010. Pours dark brown with tight tan head. Aroma has overripe and dried fruits like fig, date, prune, plum and vanilla snd some roasted notes and caramel. Taste is complex with dried fruits, like prune, dates, figs and some dustiness from the ageing. Alcohol well hidden and balanced sweetness. Very good beer!
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma of raisen, dates and other dark fruits. Sweet and spicy taste. A little bit thinner than I expected. Nice.

Bottle - Hazy dark brown colour, medium and durable beige head with fine lacing. Fruity and toffee aromas with some cherries, raisins, caramel and some bread. Very sweet taste with some cherries, vanilla, raspberries and caramel. Full body, moderate carbonation, oily mouthfeel, sweet and complex finish. Nice strong ale with fruity notes and well disguised alcohol.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are dark fruit, brown sugar, and spices.

Bottle, bottled 19.10.15. Pours dark, with ruby reflexes, and small beige head. Aromas of sweet dried fruits, some sour cherries, hints of chocolate. Taste is sweet, with fruity aftertaste. Full body, lively carbonated. Very complex and interesting.

Brown, clear, brown head. Aroma: cherries, toffee, spices. Full body, medium to heavy sweetness opposed by ester fruity sour. Cane sugar, chocolate, dark fruits. Some alcohol and black malts on finish.

Brown color, large brown head. Brown sugar aromas, fruits and spices. Taste is a lot of spices, cinnamon, dried fruits, brown sugar, yeast. Complex and well balanced. Warming finish with a touch of alcohol.

From lacasadelacerveza. In Teku glass. Playing Tomb Raider 2015. Big dissapointment. Weak body and an unpleasant sourness that makes me wonder if it was in good state... To repeat to be sure of its state
Red brown thin head solvent brandy cherry on the nose taste slightly sour cherrys cloves mouth watering nice mouthfeel sweet candy finish

33 cl bottle @ home, 2010 edition. Not the first time Im having this by far, but... Murky dark brown color. Beige head with a thin layer retention. Aromas: raisin, light port, sweet, dried fruit. Retronasal: sweet, fruit, toffee, dark malts, dark sugar. Flavor is moderate to full sweet, with some fruity sourness. Medium to full bodied. Long finish with light bitterness.

Very complex beer
Aroma of raisins, spices, cloves, caramel, bread, a little bit of solvent.
Rather sweet, but not cloying. Leaves nice, sweet bready-chocolatey aftertaste.
Almost flat

Dark red brown, mahagoni with almost no head. Aroma is syrup, brown sugar, many nuts, toffee, clove, really complex. Spicy taste, sweet and boozy. Oily mouthfeel almost too heavy. Overall great. 
I also have an 11 year old version here: It is undrinkably sweet. With additional aroma of tires. Has a honey like mouthfeel due to the missing carbonation. Recent version is better.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is hazy dark brown to black colored and has a creamy head, with nice carbonation. 
The aroma is very malty and soft spicy with also notes of dried fruits and caramel and some cacao is noticable. 
The taste is sweet with hints of caramel, dried fruits and cane sugar and changes into a light bitterness with notes of spices, refreshing hops and coffee.
The finish is light bitter and long and leaves a nice warming alcohol note. 
Wow, this is just excellent.
Bottle. Pours a red brown with a tan head and aroma of dried fruits, caramel, and spices. Taste is complex, of spices, yeast, caramel, chocolate, dried fruits, vanilla, and rum notes into the finish

Pours a dark cherry brown pour with an ephemeral beige head. Nose is fruity and floral with subtle hints of cocoa and mocha . Taste is sweet with chocolate and dark fruits. Finish is sweet and ends on the same sweet dark fruity notes. Very drinkable and delicious, very well balanced ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

Bottle(2015) at Broer & Zus, Beverwijk. Pours dark almost without a head. Aroma of dark fruits, alcohol, caramel, vinous, wood. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter, dark fruits, alcohol, caramel, alcohol, light hoppy bitterness, dark fruits and lots of alcohol in the aftertaste. Nice, but better when aged.

Dark brown colour. Thin white head which disappears quite quickly. Dark fruits, hints of berries, hints of coffee, hints of barley, notes of caramel in the aroma. Rich! Hints of dark fruits, hints of red wine, hints of chocolate, hints of coffee, nice crispiness in the middle. Slightly sour, liqeury, mild finish. Extremely well balanced. Very enjoyable beer. Would not say it is heavy bodied. A masterpiece.

Bottle, 33cl. Opaque dark brown with a frothy light brown head. Complex aromas of dried fruits, roasted malts, alcohol. Full bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Thick and oily. Medium to heavy sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Superior beer.

Bottle, 330ml. A dark beer with minimal brown head. Aroma is of dried fruits, alcohol, wood and nuts. Taste is sweet with a strong dried fruit character. Medium bodied, smooth and with faint carbonation. Rich and complex character, perfectly balanced, full of true Belgiam character.

Aroma: spicy, ginger , dark fruits, figs, some coffee and chocolate notes
Taste: medium sweet, dark fruits, figs, caramel, alcohol, spicy, nuts
Bubblegum and fruit in the nose. Not eccentric or outstanding in that way but very enjoyable to drink unlike some of the belgians.

2015 bottle. Pitch black with a thin lasting foamy beige head. Aroma is of dark fruits, nuts, figs, coffee, chocolate, some spice. Taste is of nuts, figs, dark fruits, blackcurrant, winter spices, warming signs of the alcohol on the finish. Really smooth, soft foamy to oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A pitch black beer with a medium beige foamy head ; medium retention. Roast, dried fruits, light chocolate, prune. Light to medium sweet, round, light to medium dry bitter warming ; balanced. Medium to full body, elegant, average texture, average carbonation, fruity warming finish. Overall, a really good dark belgian roasty ale ; lack of texture and "wingspan" to be awesome.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2017 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruit, liquorice, chocolate and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown beer with slight yeast and with a slight/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruit liquorice and chocolate; ends s;ightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Just like every good Belgian beer, it is so hard to say anything else here. The beer could have had a better head however. Had a old one that was not very balanced, but just had a fresh one and it definitely had some roasted malts to balance that sweetness.


Also had a 2015-red label bottle that was infected, and I must admit that was easily a top 50 Sour red/brown for me. The aroma almost completely vanished thanks to it though.

Cerveja excelente. Coloração escura com colarinho bege. Aroma adocicado. Alcool presente e bem inserido. Gosto de frutas escuras secas oresente e persistente. Retrogosto levemente alcoólico e adocicado

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Dark, dark amber with a medium offwhite head. Aroma of belgian yeast, caramel, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste reflects the aroma, but here I feel the spices and it give me a perfume-like feeling. Medium bodied. Low bitterness. And medium carbonation.

2015 Edition. 
ABV: 10% 
Serving temperature 13C (55F) - A little bit to cold, I think.

Dark mahogny, brown/red beer with a tiny beige-brown head. No lacing stays on the glass. 

Nose: Nuts, roasted malt, coffee, brownie, caramel malt, prune, raisin, cola and candied sugar. 
The nose grows as the beer heats up. 
Taste: Sweet caramel, licorice, espresso, roasted malt, maple syrup, raisin, orange, brown sugar and molasses. 
Mouth: Full body. Complex texture. Medium carbonation with tiny bubbles. Sweet ending with a light, dry tone. 

Oh! This is so good! 

Im looking forward to cellar this and try a bottle in a few years from now :)

There are beer and wonders. The first time I tried pannepot, years ago I discovered that there was life beyond the Trappist. Pannepot The only problem is that there are issues that are not wonderful, just wonderful!

Kolor: brunatny, zmętniony.
Piana: średnio obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: ciemne owoce,wiśnie śliwki, trochę melanoidyn,aromatów opiekanych, lekki alkohol, 
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, spora słodycz, nuty ciemnych owoców, jak w aromacie, nuty słodowe, karmelowe, melanoidynowe, delikatnie taniniczne, goryczka w kierunku niskiej.
Wysycenie: w butelce wysokie, wychodzi z butelki, w szkle już średnie.
Ogólnie: piwo mocno przegazowane, wychodzi z butelki, co negatywnie wpływa na ogólną ocenę piwa.

Pours cola like dark brown colour with a small beige head gives no lacing but lasts long. There are toffee, raisin, licorice and spicy Belgian yeast aroma on nose. Taste is brown sugar sweetness and spicy upfront. After that, a light tartness reminds me of raisin. The finishing is slightly roasted malt and nuttiness along with hint of alcohol. This Belgian ale is complex yet perfectly balanced featuring a solid structure.
Pours dark brown almost black with a frothy tan foam that quickly disappears. Chocolate, spice, plenty of alcohol... not as good as I was hoping given the great reviews.

Huge thanks to lern for sharing this. Deep brown. Opaque., tan moderate head. Average retention. Modest lacing. Rich malty aroma of candy, prune, brandy, belgian yeast. Medium to full body. Cratmy mouthfeel. Rich malty flavour with notes of brandy, prunes, some roast, light bitterness. Excellent balance. A classic of highest quality without its unique point nevertheless.

2014 
Marrom quase negra, totalmente turva, espuma marrom de boa formação e persistência. Aroma carregado de maltes, licor de chocolate, passas, cereja em conserva, torrado em segundo plano, complexa. Paladar de dulçor intenso, leve amargor torrado. Corpo denso/licoroso, leve/média carbonatação. Final de longa duração mantém o forte maltado, frutado de leve acidez, dulçor e torrado em ótimas proporções. Com o tempo de copo mantém a acidez frutada e trás notas mais achocolatadas.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 Vintage 2011. Pours hazy brown with a large frothy khaki head with excellent retention and slowly fades leaving behind a thick cap maintained by moderate carbonation. AROMA: malty, cinnamon, peppermint, molasses, brown sugar, peppercorns, dried stone fruit, licorice, herbal hops, hazelnut, alcohol, basement aromas, herbs, raisins, floral, light yeast esters, earthy, smoky, rubbery and dry tomato paste. TASTE: malty, cinnamon, peppermint, molasses, brown sugar, toffee, peppercorns, dried stone fruit, licorice, faint hop spice/bitterness, slight rye, slightly woody, bittersweet, creamy, hazelnut, boozy, basement aromas, herbs, raisins, floral, earthy, smoky, rubbery and slight dark bitter chocolate. AFTER TASTE: malty, spices, molasses and dry dark stone fruit with a creamy spices bittersweet smoky finish.
Maravilhosa. Nem se nota o álcool. Dá pra tomar várias. Muito saborosa. Está dentre as melhores do estilo que bebi até hoje.

2014 vintage. Pours black with a creamy golden brown foam. Rich aroma of brown sugar, dark fruit, yeast and some licorice. Full body, creamy feel, soft/avg carbonation. Complex and roasted taste with toffee, wood and licorice. Long lasting smoky finish.
Small glass of 2004 vintage on tap at De Struise. Great essential beer....

Pours viscous dark brown with creamy brown head. Aroma plums, raisins, candy sugar, toffee, wood, spices. Taste is bitter and sweet, toasted malts, caramel, cinnamon, wooden. Full bodied, soft carbonation, sticky, alcohol warms but well inserted. Fantastic ale, full of character.
Bottle. Black colour, small brown head. Aroma is much dark chocolate and raising, some warming alcohol. Thick, smooth. Superb.

F: pale brown, not long lasting, average.
C: dark, opaque.
A: malty, molasses, dark cherries, plums, dark fruits, yeast, chocolate, brown sugar.
T: malty, dark fruits, cherries, molasses, brown sugar, cocoa, chocolate, caramel, tangerine, light bready, cognac, spicy, liquorice, oily mouthfeel, lingering bitter sweet fruits on the palate, full body, low carbonation, 0,33l bottle from De Caigny near Essen, one of the best BSA, what to say more, try it.

2013 vintage. 2 finger tan head, black body. Nose: Pumpernickel-bread, brown-sugar and dates. Aroma: Pumpernickel-bread, roasted malts, dates, muscovado-sugar and chocolate. Semi-long ending with low bitterness.
Bottle bought at Geers in Oostakker. Pours dark brown with a medium beige head. Notes of roasted malts, coffee, caramel, dried fruits and a warm alcoholic feeling. Nice balanced beer! Great one!

02-Apr-2016-0,33L Flasche-2014. Dunkelbraun, hellbrauner Schaum. Aroma: Karamell, Feige, Trockenpflaume, Pfirsich. Antrunk Malz, Portwein, Laktritz, Trockenpflaume, Rosine. Hell of a beer - nicht mein erstes/ auch nicht mein letztes :-)
2014 bottle->tulip. Deep brown with moderate tan head. A: dark fruit, candied malt, spice, yeast. Nice. T: dark fruit, caramel, toffee, candy, yeast. Really good.

0,33l Flasche. Dunkles fast schwarzes Bier mit schöner brauner Schaumkrone. Intensiver Geruch nach Bitterschokolade. Vollmundiger Geschmack nach Bitterschokolade, im Abgang kommen Nuancen von Portwein hinzu. Genial!

Aroma: Caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, spice.
Appearance: Dark brown to black, tan 1-finger head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, very complex, very balanced.
Palate: Full body, creamy slick texture, soft carbonation, long sweet finish.
Overall: Perfectly balanced, delicious, great drinkability for abv, unique combination of belgian strong dark ale and imperial stout.

Bottle bier huis ossett. Dark Ruby tan head. Aroma is dark fruits treacle taste sane subtle liquorice mollases figs great balance nice alcohol warmth. Nice sticky chewy body. Very good allround very nice indeed!!
Denne belgian strong ale har et mørkt udseende med et meget svagt skum. Øllen har en sød aroma af lakrids og karamel og smager meget sødt af, lidt for sødt, og med noter af citron. Lav karbonering.

Bottle 33cl. Vintage 2015. Poured into a trappist glass. Pitch black, small foamy tan head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; strong licorice aroma, roasted malts, dried dark fruits, bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon; taste is heavy sweet and light bitter, roasted malts, licorice, sugary, alcohol, spicy notes, with long duration, sweetbitter finish, roasty notes, peaty, cloying; full-bodied, oily to sticky texture, soft carbonation; heavy stuff, well-balanced despite its sweetness and alcohol but at the moment it lacks subtlety.

2015 vintage. Dark brown pour with tan head that dissipates quickly. A lot of sediment (which may have been the result of a bad pour). Booze on the nose with caramel and dark malts. Taste is dried fruits, raisin, caramel, sweet but balanced and mild alcohol warmth. Low carbonation with medium to heavy mouthfeel bordering on stout like. Pretty delicious.
Superbe couleur noir, beaucoup darôme : chocolat, café un peu aussi de réglisse. Le sucre est la aussi pour faire passer lalcool. Pas facile à boire tout les jours, mais vraiment agréable...
Probablemente, la mejor cerveza que he probado. Reserva de 2012. Llena de aroma y sabor.

Look: dark red, semi-transparent, clear with yeast particles.

Aroma: mild mould cheese with jam and chocolate deep.
Taste: sweet with dried prunes sourness.
Flavour: arabica, prunes jam, plume wine, some spicy yeasty ethers, rye bread crumb.

Very good.

Sycząca, skromna piana, spory gaszing podczas otwierania (w porę zauważony - powolne odgazowywanie trwało ponad 30min). Barwa brązowo mahoniowa. Aromat intensywny, złożony, są nuty ciemnych owoców (jeżyny, jagody, ciemny winogron), suszonych owoców (figi, śliwki, gruszki), przypalanego karmelu, porto, rumu... W smaku podobnie, jest daktylowa słodycz, lekka kwaskowość wiśni w czekoladzie, lekka paloność, wyraźne nuty sherry, porto, dymu z ogniska, toffi i w posmaku tytoń zalany brandy. Goryczka niska, likierowo migdałowa. Alkohol wyraźnie rozgrzewa. Nagazowanie średnie do niskiego. Treściwe, kompleksowe, półpełne w odbiorze.
Reasumując piwo jest bardzo dobre, sporo się tu dzieje, tradycyjne aromaty i smaki ciemnych Delgian Strong Ale czy Dubbli przeplatają się z niespotykaną w tych stylach palonością, dymnością i czekoladą... Odbiór zakłóca jednak gaszing i nieco zbyt wysoki alkohol.
I have nevera trastes a beer with much complexity, the best of the best... so far.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

2010 bottling. This beer is something of a cross between an imperial stout and a belgian quad. It has a stout, dense mouthfeel while having a flavor profile typical of a dark belgian. Very nice. Right up there with the best of them.

Flaska från Beergium. Mörkbrun, nästan svart med högt brunbeiget skum som lägger sig. Doft av torkad frukt, russin, muscovadosocker. Kroppen är åt det tyngre hållet med lätt stickig kolsyra. Smak av russin, torkad frukt, mörkt socker, körsbär, något mörkrostad och en viss rökig ton. Lätt spritig med en del humlebett i avslutningen. Mäktig att sitta och smutta på ett tag. Mm, gott!!
Black dried plum nose, sweet, enticing. Great complex mouth with spices, dried fig and black plums and mild cocoa and coffee. Supreme balance!

2006 bottle. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head that lasts leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is bready malt, dark fruit, roast. Medium mouth, roasted malt, caramel, raisin, sweet, boozy finish, very nice.
Zwart bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is krachtig, licht zoet met iets van chocolade, port, koffie en bessen.

33 cl bottle, 2015 vintage. Deep brown with a thin head. Aroma is on plums, dry fruits, brown sugar, red wine, warming spices. Very sweet, drier but not very bitter finish, some alcohol. Medium to soft carbonation, full bodied, sticky. Good but from memory I found the 2010 reserva significantly better.

Deep brown nearly black body. Medium brownish head. Crazy complex aroma. Dried plum, chocolate, spices, licorice, light vanilla and coffee notes. Flavours as complex. Sweet candy sugar, dried plums, spices, vanilla, licorice, chocolate... Perfect?

Best belgian strong ale ever. Like this one best among the reserva-grandreserva. The dark fruit character is amazing and its really drinkable compare to the high alcohol, but that doesnt mean its light or watery. Must try BSA.

2011 vintage bottle pours dark brown with red edges and massive amounts of floater particles, finger of head. Nose is soft dark fruit, toast bread, grain, raisin, grape, plum. Super soft silky palate, mellow flavors of dark fruit, caramel, sweet plum, raisin, dark bread, grape. Finishes moderately sweet, dark berry, grape, caramel, malt. Great.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2016 33cl bottle sampled on several occasions. Dark brown pour with a dark tan head. Cocoa, spices (rosemary, anise), milk chocolate, pine resin, brewed cofeee. Quite a complex and unusual quad, more sweet, smooth and complex than most traditional quads.

Bien noire, petit collet fuyant.
Des arômes bien marqués, réglisse, bois, café, pruneau.
Plutôt ronde et sucrée (un peu trop), les flaveurs caramélisés et torréfiés ressortent bien.
La finale est longue et légèrement épicée.
Viel Schokolade, Karamell, Frucht, sehr süß. Ein gutes Bier. Typisches Belgian Strong Beer. Sehr lecker.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Good aroma. Specially good color and consistent foam.
Taste is great, very balanced but noticeable sweetness. Maybe a little bit too carbonated. Overall, one of the best Belgian Strong Ales out there.

Bottle from Centrala Piwna. Aroma: Fruit, caramel, tangerine, peach, dried plum, raisins. Appearance: Dark brown color, head is high, creamy. Taste: Sweet in a dessert way, a lot of fruit: dried plum, raisins, light tangerine, caramel, light bitterness, minimal alcohol underpinning. Palate: Very dense, carbonation is low, finish is sweet with hints of bitterness.

Bottle. Opaque black color with tanned head. Aroma has ripe fruits, caramel malt, spices and dark bread. Taste is malty sweet with long aftertaste. Flavors of roasted malt, spices, ripe fruits, coffee. Creamy mouthfeeling.

Aroma: date, toast, dried fruits, blackbread, plum. Appearance: black, small brown lasting head. Taste: heavy sweet, medium bitter, low sour. Palate: creamy body, nice bitter aftertaste, sligtly astringent, light carb.

Bottle @ Gambrinus, Tartu. Pours dark brown with brownish head. Aroma is sweetish, raisins, date, alcohol, dark fruits, caramel, almonds, dryed peaches. Taste is slightly sweet, bready, cognac, nuts, coffee,alcohol, roasted. Full body.
Black liquid with tan head. Aroma of dates, bread, silo, cognac. Taste of caramel, rye bread, silo, heavy sweet, light bitter, light sour. Full body, sticky, creamy, average carb, long bready finish.

From the 11.2 fl oz bottle. 2014 batch. Dark brown to near black pour with little to no head. I get a sour, wild ale yeast character on the nose with some sweet dark malts coming up on the backside. For a Quad, I was a little disappointed. Medium or better body. The taste stepped things up a little with a sweet malt note along with this buttery and tart taste. Not sweet enough for my liking. I dont get the 100% ratings on this one. Or perhaps I had a bad bottle.
Rich, strong, reddish loot. Tastes of dried fruit, almost a red wine effect. Strong, surprisingly dry finish. An excellent dessert beer.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 33cl bottle, 2015. Pours thick dark brown/blackish with a 3 finger brown head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, earthy dark fruits, roasted nuts. Divine tastes of chocolate, vanilla, caramel, coffee, very fruity, roasted malts, hop, raisins. Very, very tasty and complex. I am very much looking forward to tasting the Reserva and the grand reserva of this magical brew. Absolutely delicious beer!
Pannepot van 2014. Ik had al eens een 2013 gehad maar dit is al de tweede keer dat ik die van 2014 erg zuur vindt het lijkt wel een kriek bier.
Bottle. Surprisingly mild aroma, slight hints of alcohol. Taste has more depth.
Tap @ Tuulensuu. Pours brown, beige head. Dark fruits, malts, spices, marzipan in the aroma. Rich, smooth, malty, spicy, dark fruits in the flavor

33 cL bottle. Pours dark brown with a huge long lasting brown head. Cane sugar sweet and dry fruit (raisins) aroma, some spice notes too. Thick mouthfeel. Liqourice, spicy, dried fruits, sweet sugarish flavour in a lovely heavy blend with clear alcohol notes. Nice bitterness giving with sharpness and fruityness going into a sweet and bitter finish. Warming alcohol feel, well hidden. Lovely beer, it would be sin to not try it ^.^
Tap at Uiltje Bar. Oh boy this is quite the treat. Nice sweetness spices and dried fruits. Backlog from 2015/04/22.

fles 33cl
kleur: zwarte met een bruine schuimkraag. Redelijk veel koolzuur, wat snel verdwijnd. Geur: rozijnen, karamel en koffie. Zwaar, maar lekker!

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Molto scura con poca schiuma. Eccezionale al naso per complessità, dark fruits, prugne, fantastico aroma. Al palato inizia un po? acida ma ha uno splendido seguito dolce di caramello liquirizia. Alcol ben presente ma non invadente, giusta la carbonazione media. Birra fantastica.

Versione 2007. Netta nota alcolica al naso, bevuta molto dolce e con note di liquirizia e alcol ben presenti. Interessante linvecchiamento di 9 anni.

Bottle at csakajo. Darker brown colour, with a huge brown, longlasting head. Nose of caramel, dried fruits with some malts. Taste is medium bitterness, wih some sourness. Very well balanced beer. Nothing fancy, nothing tricky, just straightup fantastic beer. As it gets warmer, the dried fruity notes gets stronger.

Flaske fra Belgisk Bryg, hjemme: brunsvart med kort, beige skum. Pikant og tydelig aroma av lakris, brun kandis, rosiner, knekk og sviskeplommer. Smaken likeså, bare enda mer intens. Superb, balansert og myk munnfylde. Laaang ettersmak, og samtidig alt for lett å gripe etter glasset igjen og igjen. Må spare siste flaske...

Drank this one fresh and vintage 2006.
Both were amazing in their own way and an interesting and never been boring combination of flavours. 
The style isnt completly my thing but if i had to choose one, this would be it!

Obtained these at Belgiuminabox.com.

Clear, very dark brown with small tan head. Aroma has boozy dried fruit, notes of chocolate and cherries. Lovely boozy, syrupy flavour. Subtle caramel and licorice. Warming and well balanced. I really deserved this one.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Tasted this beer at restaurant Moeder Lambik, De Panne. Very nice combination with a steak roquefort. Very complex flavour. Delicious initial taste dominated by caramel, chocolade herbs and sugar candy. Really really good!

Si presenta di color marrone scurissimo, illuminato solamente da qualche riflesso ambrato; la schiuma beige è abbastanza generosa, rimane cremosa e compatta, lasciando un velo a copertura. Laroma è molto intenso e ricco, pane nero, prugna disidratata, uvetta e datteri, frutti di bosco, caramello, melassa e zucchero candito. Il sapore è straordinario: note di caramello, frutta scura, noci e cioccolato fanno da solida base per note deliziose di liquirizia. Il finale è caldo, denso e leggermente amaro. Incredibile equilibrio di fronte a tale complessità, retrogusto profondo e persistente. Porta deliziose note di ciliegie sciroppate, cioccolato e vino liquoroso. Corpo pieno, dalla media carbianzione; bevibilità sorprendente nonostante la gradazione (10%), abboccata, cremosa e morbida.

À boire comme une quadruple : Malgré un nez alcool et pauvre et arômes (on sent du sucre et un peu de levures), la bouche possède une grande richesse. Lattaque est vraiment présente, pas mal dalcool et beaucoup de caramel ! je trouve des aspects cannelle, vanille en fond... La longueur est surtout sucrée et alcoolisée comme une bonne liqueur.

Mooi donkerbruin bier. Geurig, kruidig bier, aromas van mout, kruiden, gedroogd fruit, caramel. Ook in de smaak komt dit volop terug. Een vrij zoetig, krachtig en verwarmend bier met een bijzonder prettige nasmaak, een wat kruidige, hoppige smaak. Prachtig bier, als je van zwaar, zoet en smaakvol houdt!

Bottle.
Deep dark, light brown head.
Aroma of sweet cherry, dark syrup. 
Taste round sweet, syrup. Vanilla. Some notes of coffee,

Bottiglia millesimo 2010, nera con schiuma beige non troppo presente. Aroma di caffè, cioccolato, prugne, frutta sotto spirito, zucchero di canna. Bel bouquet, allassaggio è incredibilmente liscia, quasi snella, con il cioccolato a farla da padrone. Ci sono i frutti rossi, il cacao, il caffè, lo zucchero di canna. Corpo piena ma tessitura leggera. Grandissima birra, di quelle da bere e Ribera. E godere.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle (2014) poured to snifters, showing a fairly clear, dark mahogany color, with good persistence to the frothy, tan head foam, and web-like lacing. The nose was lightly roasted, with a touch of melanoidin scent, dark fruit, dark grape & some vinous nature, subtle spice, and malty, dark caramel sweetness. The taste presented similar notes, a medium body, projected some suitable warmth, and was quite palate friendly & smooth.

Bottle from JefVerstraete, many thanks! A thick, meaty malty backbone, caramel, lots of dried fruit, fresh nuts, bananas, vinous notes, sweet chocolate, licorice and marzipan. Thick and sweet body, while the coffee- and spice-infused finish is spicy, light salty and throat-warming. Very complex, awesome brew.

Bottle. Black body with small brown head. Aroma nice dried fruit with nice coffee and also some cocoa. Taste is plums with roasted malts and nice dried fruits sweetness. Aftertaste is nearly perfect balanced between hops bitterness and roasted malts sweetness. Very nice one.

Bottle, 2014 vintage. Pours a wooden dark brown with a diminishingly small, dark latte colored head. Aroma is liquorice, dark fruits, date, prunes, light roast, some dark bread. Taste is liquorice, dark fruit, light roast, prune, dark breadiness. Full, sticky.

33cl bottle at Backdoor, Ghent (23 IX 2015). Now this is the famous Struise Pannepot. I expected more from the aroma, which has raisin and grassy notes and even ahy flavours. Really odd combinations, but not unpleasant. There is some wood in the nose too. The appearance is lovely: A white, yellow had tops a black brew. The taste is heavily sweet, light bitter, light sour: A strong body with creamy, sticky texture and soft carbonation. A beautiful beer, this one. Tasteful, yet heavy, very sweet, even candylike, liquorice and raisins. Too bad I only had a sample, after I spilled most of my glass on my shirt and pants. So... A beer to try again in the near future.
Dark brown coloured, beautiful lasting head. Good aroma, malts, fruit, nuts, some alcohol. Very complex flavour of chocolate, raisins, dark plums.Wow

À boire comme une quadruple :
Malgré un nez alcool et pauvre et arômes (on sent du sucre et un peu de levures), la bouche possède une grande richesse.
Lattaque est vraiment présente, pas mal dalcool et beaucoup de caramel ! En arômes, très bel équilibre entre des éléments finalement difficilement identifiables : je trouve des aspects cannelle, vanille en fond...
La longueur est surtout sucrée et alcoolisée comme une bonne liqueur.
Bottle @ Bunker. Dark brown with small tan head. Faint aroma. Full taste of sweet dried plums, slightly tart and boozy.
Pours dark brown with a tanned nougat colored head. Aroma; dried fruit, caramel, light roast and port wine. Sweet and barbonated flavour of caramel, burnt sugar, coffee, port, wood and roast

11/09/2015 @home - 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck.
Dark brown with light tanned head.Always amazing to see the beer slowly passing into foam. Always one of the nicest beer to view, just after it was poured. Aroma : port, light roast, caramel. Taste : I would swear it was aged on wood, port, light roast, some chocolate, lightly some fruit. amazing soft oily mouthfeel.

Awesome thick and dense aroma with notes of port wine, a bit of dry winy notes as well. Its also bready, biscuity with pleasant alcohol in the end. Its dark copper color beer, maybe even seal color, with beautiful ruby reflections. One finger, nice looking, beige head. In mouth its a bit over carbonated, but in the same time gives this super silk and velvety feeling. Very pleasant alcohol touch in the end. In taste notes are similar to these in the aroma. In the beginning it has this port wine sweetness, but then some bready, malty and biscuity notes appear. Its not very sweet. Super pleasant alcohol touch in the palate. Great style representant. Its just an awesome beer.

Cest sans doute le goût que pouvait avoir dans mon esprit la kwak avant que mon palais ne découvre quil y avait nettement mieux. Des notes d "alcool de vieux garçons" ( notes de fruits confits dans lalcool donc ... ) Un vrai plaisir pour vieux garçon esthète et misanthrope qui le Week end , aime à se caler dans un fauteuil club pour écouter des musiques difficiles ( Et cette description vaut pour la majorité des productions De Struise ! ) Pas envie dêtre plus précis ... Zavez quà en acheté une ...
Versa un colore scuro tipo Moka sentori di frutta al palato acidula vinosa barley wine? Dannatamente buona come tutta la serie pannepot.Da bere bere bere
Fruity aroma. Light brown head, dark clear liquid. Medium-high sweetness and light bitterness. Soft carbonation. Overall a fantastic well tasting beer!

Appearance: murky brown with one finger of dense mocha head, good retention and spotty lacing. (4/5) Aroma: dark dried fruit, floral perfume, molasses, alcohol, coffee. (9/10) Taste: moderate-strong sweet, light bitter and faint tart. (9/10) Palate: medium-full body, low carbonation, warming finish. (4/5)

A very good example of the style - hearty flavour, decent body, and a mild-mannered yet pleasantly warming ABV. Not deeply complex, but still very good. (18/20)

Bottiglia 33cl @ scurreria.
Scura con bella schiuma.
Corpo fitto ed oleoso, molta liquirizia, caffè, chiude amara.

Epices (cannelle, gingembre, poivre, clou de girofle), fruits séchés, cerises confites à lalcool, malt, caramel, cassonnade.

Equilibre et finesse maximum.
Bottle in Amsterdam. Nice black pour with tan head. Lots of fruits in the nose. Taste also of dark berries, plums, coffee, chocolate. Well balanced. Really nice creamy finish.

Bottle from Appellation Wines.
Appearance - opaque black with a nice fawn head. 
Nose - molasses, burnt bread. Treacle.
Taste - sticky molasses bread. Light nuts and chocolate too. 
Palate - medium to full bodied with a rich creamy texture and a fairly elegant finish. 
Overall - this is a lovely beer but I really cant understand how it can be rated as one of the best in Belgium. It doesnt have extra layers of complexity that Id expect.

2006 bottle, thought it might have been left too long, but its great. Amazing.
Dark fruity, chocolate and caramel, very rich and fruity, raisins, lots of yeastiness, marzipan, nutty. Great stuff.

Label reads 2006, though as far as I know they dont change the recipe. Minimu of white head that does not hold. Dark colour with some red hints when you pour it. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, plums, caramel, coffee. Creamy palate. Taste is similar to armoa, raisins, plums, dates, caramel, coffee. I notice a lot of things and some complexity, but theres some coke feel, and the poor head, that tells me my bottle is not in good conditions. Ill have to taste another one and review it.

330 ml 2015 bottle bought at Craftissimo in Tsim Sha Tsui East.
Looks: Brownish black colour with a thin layer of dark yeast sediments; One-quarter finger head and beige foam which fades in 40 seconds. Good sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant rich dark malt, with potent alcohol, faint Cognac, raisins, caramel, toffee, coffee, cream, soy sauce, brown sugar, strong Bel yeast, biscuits and faint grass.

Taste: Strong sweet full malt, with strong alcohol, rich cream, burnt toast, cherries, plum, raisins, caramel, sweet toffee, strong spices, strong Bel yeast, lime cordial, moderate bitter hops and light grass.

Body: Full body. Thick and very creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: The first thing that hits you is the strong sweet booze reminiscent of Chimay Blue, only stronger and nicer! Very rich dark malt base, very creamy and smooth. It has strong Stout elements here with lingering burnt toast, coffee, cream, soy sauce (as the beer warms) yet the ester fruitness and spicyness of cherry and dark fruits shine just as brightly. This is just a very recent brew and I have already hit the jackpot!

Hoppiness: Faint grass in nose. Lime cordial and grass in taste. Bitterness is mostly from malts burnt toast but complements well with moderate hop astringency for an abrupt, vary sweet-malty finish. 

After Taste: Slightly dry. Very creamy, very fruity and sweet boozy to mouth.

Comments: My bottle might had been leaky so theres not much head nor carbo to speak of, but the aroma and taste are intense on all front - malty, creamy, toasty, fruity, stouty, spicy, and tasty sweet strong booze. A fine blize of senses and, I have found my dream version of sweet-tasting Stout, Belgian style! Need I say more?

Deep brown nearly black body. Medium brownish head. Crazy complex aroma. Dried plum, chocolate, spices, licorice, light vanilla and coffee notes. Flavours as complex. Sweet candy sugar, dried plums, spices, vanilla, licorice, chocolate... Probably more... Long warm .sweet dried fruits finish. Oily body, medium carbo. Splendid beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 bottle from a friend - Aroma is incredibly complex. Salty liquorice, vanilla, cola, lemon, mandarins, caramel apples with slight spicy aromas. Mouthfeel is nice and well carbonated, and the beer is full bodied. Flavors has roasted malt, crusty toast, spices, christmas pudding, sweet raisins and spices. Really, really nice. Was expecting a thinner body since its a belgian ale, but this beer surprised me! Good stuff!

Nesten helt svart, litt lys slipper gjennom i kantene. caffe latte farget skum. Duft av brent sukker, lakris, espresso og noe mørke bær. Litt "boozy" på slutten av duften. Smaken følger duften godt hvor spesielt det brente sukkeret trer frem mot slutten og inn i ettersmaken. Tykk, men lettdrikkelig munnfølelse hvor kullsyren kiler godt i munnhulen.

Bottle from Saveur Bière (2014). Small, beige head. Dark brown body. Smells of spices, nuts, vanilla, sugar, yeast. Tastes apricot, nuts, spices, roasted, sugar, coffee, vanilla. Sweet but mostly bitter. My favorite Belgian beer which I belive is at its best after 4-5 years.

330bottle and on tap. Pours almost black with tanned creamy head. Highly complex brew. Lots of dark fruits, berries, dried figs, carob, raisins. A bit of coffee, chocolate, caramel, molases and dark candi syrup. Sweet but nicely balanced. Alcool well hidden, specially on tap and the beer from older bottles properly aged. Probably the closest I have to a favourite beer.

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 23/07/2015. Botella 2014. BBD: 31/11/2019
Color caoba, espuma beige, aroma malta, madera, sabor malta, dulce, pasas.
Bottle from LP Binnys. Poured pretty much black with min beige head. Aroma deep brown sugar malt dark fruits. light carb med bod. Tastes light roast malty sweet drying. I dig

Bottle, from 2014. Brown color. Medium-big head with decent dose of lacing. Aroma of nuts, dark fruits, toast and maybe chocolate. In flavor again dark fruits, banana, rum with some honey and peppery notes. Sweet but have decent hop character. Not so much based on bitternes more based on flavor. 10% alc. Wow. If I was guessing I would tell it is more like 6-7%. I tried beers with 6% alcohol that have more alcohol character than this one. Overall: good beer, easy drinkable for its 10%. And if they are using t-58 yeast(which in my opinion is some kind of bad yeast, it is maybe not bad but I dont like it), what they say that they are using, you must respect this beer even more. Probably best beer in the world with that kind of the yeast.
11.2 oz bottle pours hazy brown with a off white head. Aroma of malts, dried fruit and grain. Taste is fruit, malts and some bread.

Lovely dark brown colour, clear but almost opaque, shiny. Decent tan head. Full, creamy body, with soft carbonation. Aroma has banana, malt and dried fruits. Taste takes it up a level, with rum and raisin, salted caramel, soy, vanilla and port. Which can only add up to something very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 2014 Lotto 4016040714, best before 31/09/2019, aperta il 2 maggio 2016.
Tonaca di frate scura con riflessi color rubino, schiuma beige poco persistente che forma un anello lungo la parete del bicchiere.
Aroma acetico, cacao amaro, vino liquoroso, mosto duva, ciliegie marasche, legnosa e metallica.
