Al palato attacca acidula, ciliegia sotto spirito con note di uva passa, successivamente legno e cacao amaro, finale legnoso e di cacao amaro con una punta di rabarbaro, la gradazione alcolica è sorprendentemente ben nascosta anche se riscalda la bevuta in modo impeccabile.
Corpo medio-pieno, ben carbonata, un po astringente.
Unclear brown. Beige head. Aroma of a lot of dried fruits. Taste is brown sugar, spice, caramell, coffee, chocolate, dried fruit. I realy look forward to the Reserva!

Draft at MastroBirraio in Trieste. 2014. Deep brown, tall tan soapy head. Sweet, soft caramel, lots of banana, touch of coffee. Sweet, complexity is hinted at, good base but not as impressive as special editions demonstrate. Nice.

2011 vintage. 11.2 ounce bottle purchased at fourteen months ago at Brothers Provisions in San Diego ($7.00). POURS a dark brown hue with rusty highlights (with lots of floaties visible in bright light) and a half finger of tan foam. AROMA of rich sweet toffee, milk chocolate liqueur, fragrant pipe tobacco, molasses, port, dark fruit, and light holiday spice. FLAVOR of sticky dark toffee, nutty caramel, port, dates, raisin, "woody" milk chocolate, mild spice, brown sugar, and molasses. Not really cloying but a bitter over sweet. Holds the high ABV well without being too heavy. I had a 2009 vintage a couple year ago that I had aged, but my father-in-law just pulled it from the fridge one day and drank it one day when he was visiting (hes not into craft beer by the way). So I got a new bottle and aged it. Not sure how this would be when "fresh" but its excellent with four years on it, though I found that I do slightly prefer the Reserva as well as the Pannepeut (still looking for that Grand Reserva). (1981, 973)

Rating #1800. 2010. 330ml bottle. Poured a murky, slightly particulate, deep - near opaque, in fact - brown with a large though mostly fading tan head. Rich aromas of rum, raisin and prune. Some chocolate, yeasty complexities and caramelised sugar. Tastes just as good whilst being both smooth and showing power. Full-bodied, soft to medium carbonation and finishes long combining a roasty, liquorice-toned bitterness and a sweet, dried fruit accent. At once both intense and complex yet balanced.

pours deep brown caramel color and a foamy head fading quickly. aroma is liquorice as in Dutch dropje candy and port sherry. taste is first dried liquorice fruits, dried prunes. aftertaste is dates, toffee, chocolate truffles. moutfeeel is creamy and medium bodied.
Pours dark brown, nut brown head. Aroma is is wine like, prune. Taste has licorice, balanced.

Pours a black beer with a medium beige head. 
Smells of burnt malts, coffee, chocolate.
Tastes malty bitter.
Leaves a fine gentle palate composed of malty (burnt) bitterness and candy sugar.
Great balanced beer! No wonder this classic for Belgian beer lovers.

Fruits noirs, dattes, raisins secs, pruneaux en olfactif. Un peu de mélasse et de céréales aussi . Liquide brunâtre, presque noir. Un goût de cerises au marasquin trempé dans du Kirsch. Des notes de pruneaux et de fruits noirs. Un soupçon dépices naurait pas nui. Bière superbement élaborée. Une large palette de saveurs. Effervescence bien dosée. Rencontre tous les standards dune grande bière.

2014 vintage. Pours dark brown with average light brown creamy head. Heavy toasted malty aroma with notes of coffee, caramel and cookie. Moderate hoppy aromas with orange. Yeasty aromas with cheese and broth. Notes of cinnamon, prune and gingerbread. Heavy sweet taste, long finish with medium bitter, some acidic and salt. Medium to full body with almost creamy texture, carbonation is soft.

330 mL bottle poured into a goblet. 2010 vintage. Very dark brown. Almost like a light stout. Some light penetrates at the edges, but its a dark quad for sure. Nice khaki head with no lacing on the glass and very few bubbles once the head recedes. Outrageous smell. Caramel, dark fruits, roasted malts, bananas, everything. So complex, so delicious smelling. It even has a hint of leather, much like an old ale. The malt complexity is amazing. Taste is not quite as complex as the smell, but still fantastic. The caramel is a bit more dominant and the fruit flavors arent as pronounced, but still present. Those earthy, leathery smells translate into an earthy bitterness in the finish. Remarkably easy to drink (and dangerously so) as a 10% quad. A little dry, but not too much. Medium heavy bodied, but not a bit syrupy. Slightly boozy, but not overpowering. A fascinating and very different take on the style.
Bottle, 330 ml from Magic Beer Room, Zagreb. Pours black, small light brown head. Roasted malts, dark fruit, chocolate, spices. Sweet and full bodied. Complex brew, Great one.
Ruikt al heel lekker en smaakt zowaar nog beter: kruidig en een beetje dropachtig. Smaak blijft lang hangen.

From Boone (Nieuwpoort) Brune forte proche dune bière de Noël offrant un bouquet fort épicé, malté avec des arômes de caramel et une pointe aigrelette. A lattaque, quoique douce à boire, les arômes caramélisés et épicés aux saveurs de cannelle et de cardamone, pèsent pas mal sur lestomac. Ce nest quen arrière-bouche que je reçois les saveurs de café, avec un goût de acre de malts torréfiés, avec un bel équilibre maltage/adjuvents. Sensation davoir du pain dépices en bouche. Lalcool réchauffant le gosier au fur et à mesur de la dégustation. Le tout peu amer . Assez spéciale à boire.

Bottle share thanks to Fergus for the 2009 and Scopey for 2010. Poura a murky brown with an off white head. Smells musty and tich fruit. Tastes like a liquidised Christmas cake your gran went a little overboard on the booze. Its smooth and very nice

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2015 Look: Pitch black beer with a brown head. Aroma: Coffee, Roasted Malts, Liquorice, Red Fruits, Raisins, Alcohol, Cheese. Taste: Coffee, Roasted Malts, Toast, Liquorice, Raisins, Spices, Earthy. WOW, what a complexity! Palate: Full body, oily, medium carbonation. Long finish. Mostly coffee bitter and liquorice. Yes!

Pours a deep brown with an amber hue. It has no lacing or head retention, which is to be expected due to the high ABV. Smells of molasses and yeast. Has a sweeter taste, heavy on the brown sugar and molasses. A good desert beer, but not a memorable one.

Negra densa, espuma escasa y que desaparece al momento. Aroma malteado, con toques de pimienta y canela. Escasa carbonatación, gran cuerpo y estupenda textura. Enorme sabor, inicialmente de dulce caramelo y fruta roja, acabando con tono mas seco y especiado, bastante amargo. Alcohol presente pero sin denotar los 10 gradazos, que sin embargo calientan lo suyo en el postgusto. Excelente.

11.2 oz. bottle. 2011 edition, so it has around 4 years of age on it. Consumed on 6-4-15. Scents of cinnamon, plum, pear, caramel, salted chocolate, pretzel, red grape, and Merlot or Cabernet Sauvignon (hearty, fruity, dark red wine). Quite spicy in aroma. The smell reminds me of a freshly baked Snickerdoodle cookie. Great, complex, appetizing aroma. Pours a maroon-ish dark brown or a very dark amber with a small amount of taupe head. Amber glow. Nice color. Much suspended particulate. The flavor largely matches the aroma except that the flavor is a bit more bitter than the aroma is. Gingerbread, molasses, chocolate, bitters (Angostura or otherwise), and prune flavors. Tangy, dry, complex, and delicious. A touch of booze noticeable, but in a totally inoffensive way. Prune-like aftertaste. Medium to full body. Not as thick in the palate as I thought it would be. Fizzy, lively, and smooth. Easy to drink given the high alcohol. Pannepot is really, really good. Its not quite the best beer of its type that Ive ever had, but its up there. Theres a lot going on. Its one of the best beers Ive had in a while.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 2nd rating 0,33l bottle at home. Vintage 2015. not sure i would rate this one higher than the one before, taste is nice but also alcoholic.

1st. rating bottle at home bought some time ago in Prague. Vintage 2014. almost black color, small coffee-colored. smells sour, sour cherries, some malt, dried fruits, some sweetness. smell is balanced between sweet- and sourness, does not work so well for me though. full body, rather strong carbonation, full bubbly mouthfeel. tastes sour, some sweetness, acidic, citric, a bit astringent, some notes of fruit jam, light medical / metallic notes, malts. rather dry / lightly sour / also fruity finish. rather good, I like the taste a bit better than the smell.

Aroma: dried fruits, cellar, chocolate, coffee.
Appearance: deep black color, beige head.
Taste: almost no bitterness, chocoalte, coffee, ginger, roasted malts, semi-dry.
Palate: full body and low carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Great beer, aroma is weak, but all in all very drinkable beer with a nice complex taste.

0,33 l bottle as a souvenir from my colleaguess trip to Antwerp over New Years Day, 2014 vintage. Clear, almost opaque, very dark reddish brown to black with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, brown head. Pleasant, fruity-malty aroma of dark ripe fruits, cane sugar and a bit of coffee. Very intense, sweetish fruity-malty taste of prunes, figs and raisins, accompanied by flavours of cane sugar, dark chocolate and a bit of coffee. Rather long, chocolaty, slightly warming and even a bit hoppy finish. Full body, creamy and smooth mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Great beer. Incredibly tasty, great palate and only a little alcohol can be detected. It is somehow even refreshing due to its fruitiness. Very dangerous!

Lighter hazy brown, thin enough ringed head. Dusty berry, scratchy choc caramel flakes and damp oakiness. Lean sweetness is what takes me up on the Pot, its thin and passable enrichment with a thicker mouthfeel than many brassy towns with some liquorice embers. Finishes rich, spongey and steady choc.
On tap at Dohertys Ale House in Warwick. Deep purplish brown. Thin head. Very sweet to start, smoothes out after a while with dark earthy, raisony notes. Very underwhelming.

2014 ed. Bottle (33cl) from Vinmonopolet (Aker Brygge), Oslo. Very dark brown colour. Finger-thick beige head that reduces fairly quickly to a small ring and scattered foam islands. Sweet malty nose with rich, dried fruits, coffee and spices like star anise, vanilla, nutmeg. Full body, soft carbonation. Taste has a lovely balance between sweet malt, mildly acidic fruit and some spicy bitterness in the finish.
330ml bottle, 2013 vintage. Pours dark with a copper hue and tan head. Aroma is stewed dark fruits and liquorice. Taste is dark fruits and treacle, smooth and balanced.

From a bottle into a snifter 2013 vintage. Pours a opaque black with large light brown head. Nose is great with lots of spices, anise, cinnamon, nutmeg, toffee, some dark dried fruit with hints of yeast, plums, raisins. Medium to high carbonation, a bit of spunk to it almost like a little heat, oily body, sweet, very little bitterness. Long finish lots of spices lingering on the pallet, a hint of alcohol. Well made beer, enjoyable, just not entirely the flavors im looking for.

33cl bottle. Dark brown pour with thin brown head, no lacing. Aromas of raisins, toffee and coffee. Taste is bitter, a bit sweet. Coffee, licorice and grilled vegetables. Little to no carbonation. Strong aftertaste of spices and alcohol. Interesting, but a bit sweet for my taste.

Tried in bottle,bought in Austria at Tribaun. Colour is dark brown/dark amber. Thin white head, dissalates fast. Aroma is red wine, plumbs, caramel and malts. Taste is same as aroma. Similar to a barley wine. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 Dark brown color with small head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is dark malts, plums, raisins. Taste is dark caramel, dry plums, sweet balsamico, nice tartness, red wine feeling. Refreshing carbonation. Wow! Great!

UPDATE: 2005, 2013, 2015 vertical with jonas, jfb, MoritzF and Ritzn in June 2016. The 11 year old has hardly any carbonation left, making it extremely sweet - like Pumpernickel with sugar coating. The not-so-old vintages were great!

Struise Pannepot 2013 jest ciemno czekoladowy i tworzy pianę tak gęstą, że można na niej oprzeć łokieć podziwiając widoki w Brugii. Aromat piwa pokazuje maestrię piwowarów i potencjał mocnych piw belgijskich, które są u nas totalnie niedocenione. Kakao miesza się z czekoladą, suszone owoce pod postacią świątecznych śliwek, rodzynek i fig, kandyzowany cukier i nuty winne. Zapach jest iście boski i dla mnie doskonały. Z powodu takich właśnie piw, gdy ktoś mnie pyta o ulubiony styl, to bez wahania mówię quadrupel czy też strong ale. Jeśli ktoś nazwałby Pannepota chmielowym napojem, to wykastrowałby go z całego bogactwa smaku, a przy tym minął się z prawdą. Gorycz jest minimalna. Prym wiedzie posmak winny wzbogacony o wyraźne suszone owoce. Są banany i belgijska drożdżowość. Zamiast alkoholu lekko pieką w gardło przyprawy. Bardzo miękkie i oleiste to piwo. Absolutny wzór do naśladowania.

Lovely dark side Belgian strong with high level maltiness, caramel, candi sugar, decent roastiness, dark choco, dried fruits, some fresh fruitiness, light yeast. Moderate sweetness with light bitterness.
Quite an awesome sippable brew.
Aroma is choco dark malt, as typical it gets. Thou the taste is very refresing and full

Inviting aroma of dark malts- cocoa, dark-chocolate alike and deep yeasty profile, but without typical dark fruits esters, just yeasty, a bit reminded me of very malty/yeasty brown ale. And dark caramelized syrupy, brown sugary/ candy overall, as in aroma as in taste. Medium+ sweet, light bitter. Medium+ body, thick, spungee texture, dry and a bit floury finish. After some time sample becomes a bit alcohol toward, but very little. Nice one.

Piwo w kolorze brązowym, ze znikającą błyskawicznie (z racji mocy piwa) pianą wyglądało dość niepozornie. Aromat za to uderzył w nozdrza bardzo szybko - mnóstwo różnych owoców - śliwki, wiśnie. Dość słodko. W smaku nie jest aż tak intensywnie, ale owoce mocno się odznaczają. Wyczuwalne też orzechy, może migdały, karmel. Alkohol rozgrzewający, delikatnie za mocny. Bardzo dobre piwo!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, 2014. Piekny wyglad - przy nalewaniu zachowuje sie jak bardzo geste, lepkie, oleiste. Piana sliczna, kremowa, nawet lekko wpadajaca w czerwone odcienie, bardzo drobna, niezbyt wysoka. Opada niezbyt szybko, pozostaje cienka warstewka, lekko zostaje na szkle, widac tez bardzo delikatne lzy na brzegach pokala. Aromaty bardzo bogate, karmel, ciemne owoce (sliwki, wisnie, banany), suszone owoce (rodzynki, sliwki suszone), przyprawowosc dosc nienarzucajaca sie, zbozowosc, slodowosc, kawa, nawet czekoladowo-kakaowe nuty. Alkohol praktycznie niewyczuwalny. Smak analogiczny - wszystko to czuc. Praktycznie brak goryczki. lekkie rozgrzewanie gardla od alkoholu. dlugie, owocowe, kwaskowate posmaki (jedyny zarzut ktory mi wpada do glowy - zbyt kwaskowate). W ustach pelne, niesamowicie kremowe, gladkie. Bardzo niskie wysycenie. Na chwile obecna: najlepsze piwo jakie mialem okazje pic w zyciu :)Slepy test BSDA/Quadow w pdf: http://tiny.pl/ggmvg - mial wplyw na ocene :) Pannepot z 2004 pity w Het Oude Schooltje w Oostvleteren powoduje cos w stylu orgazmuRami Rami is drinking a Pannepot (2015) by De Struise Brouwers at JabeerwockyNudna belgia rulez, przy czym ta butelka jakos zero piany i malo ciala? Ale smak nadal arcyboskiPS: to moze nie jest najlepsze piwo jakie mialem okazje pic w zyciu, ale zarazem, a) jest genialne b) jest idealnie pod moj gust c) jest megatanie jak na to co oferuje d) jest dostepne bezproblemowo... wiec ta ocenke "naj" z pelna swiadomoscia zostawiam :) Rami Rami is drinking a Pannepot - Old Fishermans Ale (2016) by De Struise Brouwers at Konstruktorska Business CenterTen rocznik troche in minus - mniej ciala, troche mniej intensywnosci, nieco wiecej w ciemnoowocowa strone. Ale generalnie nadal klasaRami Rami: Ale fajne figi w tym sa... Eh, no jednak urealnie ta ocenke, choc serdcie krwawi :>Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle 33 cl.
Dark brown, with thick brown head. Moderate malty, cane sugar, dried fruit, some yeast. Sweet licorice, medium bitter. Well balanced blend. Thick mouthfeel.
Bottle. Cola brown. Raisin, plum, figs, belgian burnt sugar, light chocolate, slight spice. All around amazing. Excellent feel. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted from bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a light tan head. Aroma is raisins, plums, prunes, figs, brown sugar. Taste is similar to aroma with dark fruits, brown sugar, figs, and some vinous flavors. You do get a little alcohol burn. Moderate to heavily sweet with minimal bitterness. Complex and solid belgian beer but not quite as good as the best belgian strongs I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Immense! rich, malty, complex, immaculately balanced. This is deservedly rated 100. A must-try beer

Bottle 0,33l. Poures a dark almost black colour. The aroma is sweet, molasses dark dried fruit, dates, raisins. Taste is rich and sweet, caramel, spices, complex fruits.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark black. Really good. Much more malty then a normal belgian. Caramel. Some banana. Yeasty. Im surprised i like this. Tasted at Carters bottle share.

330 ml bottle, vintage 2009.
Dark brown body, with a medium, dense, creamy, dark beige head.
Full aroma of dried fruits, nuts, almond, sherry, wine, spices.
Taste isnt as big as expected, even quite one-dimensional, mostly sweet, with dried fruits, nuts, almond, red wine, spices.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes astringent, a bit alcoholic, quite dry, a bit bitter, but not very aromatic, with some nutty and some wine like notes.

Quite disappointing to be honest. Too one-dimensional for my taste. Maybe it wasnt stored well (bought this about a year ago, 5 years after bottling), or it even doesnt age as good as the vintage labelling suggests? I dont know. Will definitely rerate when I get a fresh one.

Beczka. Barwa ciemno-bordowa. Brak piany. Aromat czekolady, śliwek, rodzynek. W smaku delikatna czekolada, orzechy, suszone owoce, mam wrażenie jak bym pił pół wytrawne czerwone wino. Niskie wysycenie. Kolejny piwo z browaru Struise, godne polecenia. Niesamowite piwo.

So dark its black. The brown head disappears as fast as lightning.
Very intense aromas: caramel, chocolate, dates, coffee, cardamom, even HP sauce.
Powerful, soft and creamy. The main flavours are sweet, sour and umami. Low carb, long finish. One of the greatest.

Pours dark brown with small head. Aroma: heavy sirup-like aroma of dried fruit, including plums, peaches, grapes, raisins, with a very pleasant rum/bourbon aroma. Taste: very complex, with plums and raisins in the foreground, followed by raisins and a pleasant alcoholic warming effect in the palate. This is a very big and complex beer. Fantastic example of Belgian beer craftsmanship.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2017 Bottle Vintage 2010. Dark reddish brown colour. smell of dark fruits, oak, herbs etc. Taste of plums, oak, berries, caramel, herbs, florals, hint of tobacco. overall very complex and delisious beer. VINTAGE 2010: 8-5-9-5-18 (4.5)
 Rate for Vintage 2014:
 Pours dark reddish opaque colour with creamy light brown head. Visually low carbonation. Aroma surprisingly without note of an alcohol, or better to write - with low-mild notice. But you can detect notes of dark and milk chocolate, oak, coffee, cacao, esters of cherry, berry and molasses.
flavour: Without note of an alcohol, with strong note of coffee, dark chocolate, of dried dark fruits, especially dried plums, with hints of oak, whiskey or bourbon, cherry, grape and berry esters. finish is slightly tart.
Malt swetness is still high/medium, hop bitterness is mild/medium, body is stick/mouth coating, carbonation is low. VINTAGE 2014: 8-5-8-4-16=4.1

Bottle at home, 5th April 15, 2014 vintage. Poured dark almost black. The aroma is sweet, molasses dark dried fruit, dates, raisins. Taste is rich and sweet, complex fruits. Nice but quite sweet for my palate.

Flasche (Jahrgang 2013, 33 cl) von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin-Wedding. - Tiefes Rotbraun, trüb. - In der Nase schwere, sirupartige Malzsüße, Pflaumenmus, Anklänge von Anis und spritige Schwere. - Antrunk breit dunkelmalzig und plump süß mit Pflaumenmus und ein wenig holziger Herbe. Erstaunlich plump und wenig subtil. Der Alkohol schmeckt deutlich heraus. Im Abgang etwas holzige Herbe. - Enttäuschend wenig komplex für ein derart berühmtes Bier.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 For 2013 version, Smell with malt, spice, caramel, come with dark brown with thin creamy crown, Taste a bit mild than its color and it?s alcohol %. Mid body, sweet, anise, toasty malt, coffee, caramel, very good, but not at perfect 100

Bottle from BarleyWine, Copenhagen - dark brown pour with creamy beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste, caramel, chocolate, brown sugar, earthy yeasty, dark dried fruits, spices, smooth mouthfeel, lovely.

2011 Vintage. 
Smell of red berry and torrefaction. All explode in mouth with a final of coffee and anise. Discrete alcohol taste.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2015 Black beer with strong spicy aroma, portwine like with sweet chocolate/toffee, booze. Also hint of tobacco. Full bodied and rich. Quite sweet. Taste has sweet malts, coffee, tobacco, still light portwine, cola, liquorice, spice. This is for cold winter nights.
Very dark brown beer with a off-white head. Almost port like beer. With dark fruits, yeast, sugar and a sourness. Definite firm alcohol percentage. Very interesting beer but not really my cup of tea.

Bottle. Has vintage 2014 heads up with 2013, this is rating of 2013.
Pours dark brown with very nice one finger lasting brown head. Aroma is loads of belgian yeast, port, dried fruits, raisins, prunes, brown sugar. Some nice chocolate and honey in there as well, bit spices to. Almost cakey. Toasty malts. This one is way more rounded after only a year. Taste is all the same. Sweet, belgian yeast, spices, dried fruits, burnt sugar, toasty malts and slight dry. Nice port/sherry booze and full body. Really a smooth classic! But one year makes is a lot more richer!

Bottle @ Fermentoren Aarhus. 

Pours dark Ruby.

Lots of malty goodness in the nose, chocolate and oak wood. 

Swapping between 2014 and 2013, the 14 still has a bit sharper, yeasty hint to it, whereas the 13 is smoother and richer. Like a teenager growing into a woman - the perfume is nice, but age gives it finesse.

Taste is like being hand-fed with gold dusted cocoa beans by a well trimmed monkey ; sweet and smooth chocolate, yet somehow a bit of wildness to it.

Really a nice beer!
UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 Mørk brun med lavt skum. Aroma av karamell, krydder og noe vanilje. Smaken er belgisk gjær, toffee, tørket frukt og brunt sukker. Tykk konsistens. Søt. Nydelig karbonert.
Bottle. Deep amber color with a medium thick foamy head. Aroma of caramel, cinnamon and vanilla. Sweet taste with some sourness and bitterness. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

330 ml bottle @ Tuulensuu
Dark cola colored beer with beige head. Aroma has brown sugar, plums, banana, cherry, liqueur and some coffee. Flavor has brown sugar, mämmi and malts. Palate is full with quite strong carbonation, slightly foamy. Finish has quite mild bitterness. Aftertaste has mämmi, brown sugar, dark fruits, vanilla and coffee. No signs of alcohol. Decent, but not totally my type of beer. The mämmi kind of sweetness reminds me even of Czech dark lagers.
Poured dark with a great beige head. Whiskey aroma and alcohol. Flavor is massively sweet with light caramel and dark fruit notes. Ill repeat for sure!

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2015 Fris pittig aroma met citrus en kersen caramel hinten. Donker troebel uiterlijk met een kleine schuimkraag. Heerlijk toegankelijk warm caramel smaak zacht zoet met een hele zachte bitter. Vanille kersen bessen smaak met een lange warme fruitige afdronk. Lekker dorstlessend met een mooie diepgang. Gedroogd fruit in de afdronk. Droge nasmaak. Ge-wel-dig!!
This is a very enjoyable beer with some unique flavours. Nice dried fruits and raisins, not too carbonated. Good for a cool rainy day in a pub.

0.33l bottle. Hazy reddish dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma of cocoa, chocolate, toast, reisins, dark fruits and a noticable sour charachter (brett). The taste is awesome. Lots of chocolate with caramel, vanilla, reisins and dark fruits (maybe some coriander). Alcohol is warming, but not harsh at all. Superb beer.

Pretty fantastic beer. Reminded me of Westvletrns warm finish. Candied sugary Belgian goodness. Really flavorful and rich. Should be considered among the top Belgian strong ales. Thanks for sharing kapusil!

Robe brune foncée, quasi pas de mousse. Nez riche sur des aômes de café, de cacao, de chocolat, de caramel sur un fond de malt et de levure, une pointe de fruits mûrs. Bouche à lattaque ample, une note épicée et de la fourrure, bulle fine et longue finale sur lamertume. Un bière qui allie richesse et amertume. A mon sens un cran en dessous de la rochefort 10.

Botella 2013. Color marrón rojizo oscuro. Espuma marrón de muy poca formación y persistencia. Aromas a chocolate, avellanas, nuez, azúcar moreno, madera, notas de vino tinto, bizcocho de naranja, nuez moscada, clavo, cerezas, ciruelas pasas..compleja y cambiante...en boca entra dulce, donde el chocolate domina, con tokes frutales, cereza, ciruelas pasas...herbales del lupulo ...el alcohol bien camuflado...y en el final aparecen los tokes a madera. Buena Birra pero con unos años en botella gana. Recuerda un puco a una imperial stout madurada en barrica.
Nez complexe, sur les épices, goût boisé ,sweet candi, épices, longue en bouche , finale plutôt sur lamertume.

330 bottle, vertical tasting of 2011-2012-2013-2014. 

Dark red color, slightly hazy, with now head at all, only the 2013 had some signs of foaming. Aroma was sweet and sugar-caramelly, more alcohol-strong in the 2012-2013 vintage ones, cherry-like in the 2013-2014. Taste was really spicy and sweet, again with big differences between the vintage. All had big notes of Belgian sugar, caramel, malts, cherries, raspberries, and some alcohol. Some chocolate is there too. Aftertaste is spicy and long. Medium to full body with low carbonation! Struise nailed it again!!!

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home, 2012 vintage. Pours muddy deep dark brown with a creamy light brown head. Aroma is fruity, raisins, plums, prunes, dates and some spices. Flavour is sweet with some liqourice. Medium bodied with a smooth texture, soft carbonation. Finish is quite vinous.

In bottiglia da 33cl. Colore marrone, schiuma bianca fine e abb persistente. Aroma di frutta secca, nocciola, caffè, frutta sotto spirito. Al palato corpo importanta, calda ed etilica con note dfi uvetta, frutta secca, mela, caffè.

Bottled in Frape (where else). Dark brown colour with huge creamy brown head. Complex nose. Aroma is huge with soft malts, almond, nuts, fruits and burned caramel. Flavour is almond, nuts, dried plum and burned caramel. Palate is sweet with plum notes . Alcohol is present but well hidden.

Vintage 2011 from Belgian e-shop

Very dark color, almost black, very thin head that dissipates. Aroma is light tart, combined with the color it reminds me a bit of oud bruin, dark malts, not much sweetness. Taste is amazing, ballanced, light tart, floral with amazing complexity from the combination spices. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, very drinkable. Amazing brew...

Bottle; pours dark brown with a khaki head; aroma is spicy with caramel, dark fruits, and a little bit of malt; taste is sweet with dark fruits, a little caramel, malt, and a hint of alcohol; finish is spicy and dry; very good Belgian Strong.
Pours very dark with a tanned head that disappears. Aroma is spices and banana maybe some bubblegum. Taste is complex and so smooth.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 dark brown colour, minimal beige-ish head; complex aroma of plum jam, raisin, green apple, woody and herbal notes, some alcohol, hints of chocolate and yeasts; taste of tons of dried fruits (mainly plum), burnt plum jam, woody notes again, some cocoa, roasted sugar, minimal alcoholic spiciness and some herbal liqueur; a bit lower carbontion than the ideal one, but otherwise an excellent Belgian Strong Ale

13 - Pours very dark brown with tan head. Nose is dark fruits, brown sugar, dark chocolate, allspice, and caramel. Taste is chocolate, dark fruits, and a hint of alcohol. The flavor is rich and wonderful!

330ml bottle, 2012. pours very dark brown with no real head. aroma is dark fruits, plums, dates, figs, molasses and caramel. nice sweet full bodied treacle mixed with prunes and plums. slightly oaky finish. very nice but i slightly prefer the special and grand reserve.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 2013 bottle. Writing this as I drink it. The beer is black in colour and it has a small brown head with good retention. Aroma is dark chocolate, spices, milk, vanilla, nuts, brown sugar and alcohol. The taste is spicy and sweet at first, then becomes spicy-bitter. A lingering spicy aftertaste remains, that leaves ones mouth longing for more. The alcohol is warming, but no direct alcohol taste is noticeable. Wonderful, full, smooth body. This is one of the best beers Ive had so far, if not the best one. It outperforms the Belgian trappist ales that enjoy an oh-so-high reputation, but most of the time disappoint me, by far.

Pannepot 2010
Guiness black
Spices (black pepper, smoke) caramel, coffee, hint of alcohol.
Full bodied, velvety like a strong wine.
In the palate sweet dominates, but finishes with a espresso-like (coffee) bitterness, Truly unique.
Birra interessantissima. Color bronzo profuma di caramello e canditi. Fantastica ha una persistenza incredibile. Da meditazione o dolci intensi

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 0.33 bottle. Very dark brown color and a small, brownish head with a good retention. Aroma of dark malts, alcohol, metal, dried fruits, and wine. Taste is sweet, contains a lot of dried fruits, dark malts, again some metal, and alcohol. Medium to full body, slick texture, and average carbonation. Finish is sourer and vinous due to increased fruitiness. Overall a nice beer but nothing spectacular.
Flaska från Saveur-biere. Svart med lite beige skum. Lite spritig smak med kanel, choklad och syrliga körsbär.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Birra assurdamente aromatica!!! Incredibili tutta la diversità che propaga dallaroma al gusto!!! A primo impatto sale al naso un aroma di banana, caramello, cannella e caffè e altri che purtroppo non riesco ancora a decifrare. In bocca rimane poco frizzante e molto bilanciata con tutti i suoi sapori di tostato, di nuovo banana, cioccolato e caffè. Alla fine ne rivuoi un altra, grazie ancora De Struise!

Pannepot parallel tasting. 

Pannepot 2013
Dark murky brown colour with a tiny light tan head.
Plums, raisins, dark fruits, alcohol and mild vinegar in the aroma. 
Dark fruits, dark chocolate, some alcohol, dryness, peanuts and malt in the flavour. 
A bit harsh and alcoholic. 

Pannepot 2010
Dark murky brown colour with a tiny light tan head.
Plums, raisins, dark fruits, mild alcohol, mild vinous notes, mild chocolate and some dark malt in the aroma. 
Dark fruits, peanut skins, sweetness, mild vinous notes and liquorice in the flavour. 
Quite rich. Tasty. 

Pannepot 2008
Dark murky brown colour with a small light tan head.
Plums, raisins, dark fruits, vinous notes, dark chocolate, mild vinegar and mild sourness in the aroma. 
Dark fruits, vinous notes, strawberry, peanuts, sweetness, plums, chocolate and some maltiness in the flavour.
Rich and tasty.

The rating is based on 2008 vintage.
Dark beer with taste of ripe plum, fresh liquorice and sugar candy. Very good, but not my type ... to take as a glass of dessert
UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 330ml bottle. Dark brown, nearly black, body with a minor tan head. Spices, dark dried fruit, yeast and liquorice. Dry, sweet and salt at the same time.

2011 bottle. 

no head retention is visible in this dark brown to black ale. The slight rim of lacing present is a light tan color. the aroma is big and chewy with big sweet fig notes. a subtle fall spice character shows itself and seems to play nicely with the sweet maple/chocolate oatmeal aromatics. Med/high mouthfeel, real smooth, low/medium carbonation. the alcohol hides so well in this beer i am not sure if its because of the big chewy malty flavors or something different. i am really loving the fig/raisin quality that this beer has i believe the spiciness is plays nicely with the chocolate tones and rounds the whole thing out. It is a good thing this stuff is not readily available because its way to drinkable. solid beer i am glad i waited to crack this bad boy open.

2013 bottle. Pours a near black color with a small tan head. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel dark fruit aroma. Fruity malty spicy dark fruit and caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy caramel and dark fruit finish.

Intriguing quad, although honesty didnt blow me away as much as my favorites. Appearance is a dark molasses- very pretty brown lacing with small carbonation bubbles. Aroma and taste are for me dominated by candied fruits with very mild bread undertones. A slight alcohol burn on the palate that disipitates rapidly when you swallow into a dry slightly bitter aftertaste. Overall clearly a complex and well crafted beer deserving of high marks, but def not the best in my book. I prefer rochefort, westvleteren, or even chimay blue.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2015 Struise Pannepot 2014, uitgeschonken in origineel 33cl. De Struise Brouwers bierglas. Kleur heel donker vrijwel zwart, met karamel kleurige schuimkraag, die snel terugvalt. De geur is geroosterde malt, gedroogd fruit en koffie. De smaak is fantastisch, heel complexe en speciale smaken in dit bijzondere bier.
Tonen van geroosterde malt, karamel, gedroogd fruit als rozijnen, dadels. Verder ook koffie en chocolade, winter specerijen als kaneel en kruidnagel en aardachtige smaak. Het mondgevoel is zacht, bijna romig met weinig koolzuur. De afdronk is lang en zacht met houtige tonen en licht bittere hop finish. Dit bier is zo complex en zacht, dat je moet zoeken om een beter Belgisch bier te vinden. Naar mijn idee zelfs nog iets beter dan toppers als Rochefort 10, Westvleteren 12 en St. Bernardus abt. 12. De smaak van dit brouwsel is nog iets specialer, door de stout bier tonen. Maakt ook nieuwsgierig naar de Pannepot 2013, Reserva 2010, en Grand Reserva 2009 die ik nog heb liggen. Echt Belgisch biergenot van het hoogste niveau.

Poured from bottle, deep dark brown with low beige head. Aroma is mild and complex. Notes of dried fruit, herbs, spice, leather and some grass. Taste is as complex. Sweet, full and mature. Notes of dark bread, dried fruit, dates, madeira, and a trace of resin. More of an old sweet wine than a beer, but surely irresistible.

Pours dark brown to black, creamy tan head. Huge aroma of digs, dates and molasses. Flavor has lots of fruitiness dates, figs, plums, lots of molasses. Some winey port noted as well. Medium silky body, medium carbonation. Awesome beer!
Bottle from saveur bier, belgium. Almost black color, tanned head. Aroma is spices, wood, barrels. Full body, licorice, spices, wood, vanilla.
On tap in the Cafe rose red in Bruges. Sweet tight saturated. Very berry, fine Belgian ale
2014 bottle from struise beer shop in Bruges. Probably 3 month old, guessed from expiry date. Rich and complex aroma. First bite is surprisingly acid. A bit wine like.
Bière sans mousse. Avec une acidité en bouche, goût très puissant. Bière qui fait penser au vin.
Excellent Beer. Clear black. Malty and spicy with a sweet ending. High alcohol but you wont even notice.

Tap at beergeek bar with cam, rach and the expat gang. heard they got it and had to try it out. had like 4 of em. pours dark copper with small head. fizz lasts all through the drink. aroma is nutty, cinnamon, spices, with figs and raisins. taste is awesome. overripe dark fruits, cherries, caramel, with spices and a smack of booze. as you drink the spices and hops come through more. moves to a dry warming finish. so good, so gooooodddd

What can I say about this except Wow!! What a fantastic beer, spicy, fruity, malty,sweet and alcohol thats barely noticeable, so easy to drink and what a pleasure too. Will be revisiting as soon as possible, one of the best beers ive tasted.

2012 version.

Completely black in color, with a one finger broad, beige, froth head.

Smells of spiced, sweet milk chocolate with a caramel core to it, while also providing a flowery, peppery pull. On top of that settles a hint of hot glue, together with molasses, balanced by earthy, calming malts.

Begins with earthy cocoa nibs, cream and toffee. The smooth mouthfeel experiences an addition of bubbly carbonation, which adds to the sweeter toffee presence. Spices become visible in a slightly peppery and licorice fashion, while also compliementing to the sweetness. The balance remains, because of earthy malts, along with hazelnuts and a Coca-Cola note. Finishes with a gentle coffee note, which isnt bitter at all, due to the more present cane sugar and nougat, accompanied by a tingly spiciness.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2014 POURED 2006 from bottle to glass. Dark hue with creamy tan head that settled. Aroma is prunes, caramel, plums, toffee, tobacco, leather. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet with a slight ethanol finish. Overall this is a fun brew!
POURED 2011 from bottle to glass. Dark hue with fizzy brown head that settled. Aroma is caramel, toffee, honey, licorice, floral. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a spice astringent following and estery ethanol finish. Overall this is a very nice brew!

2011 bottle. Pours nice and dark, pretty effervescent. Sounds like a soda or some shit. Small ring of brown head. Smells awesome! Deep Belgian sugar and molasses. Little funky on the nose. Tastes so awesome, its more balanced than a strong quad. Definitely glad I got to try this one! Outstanding Belgian ale.
330ml bottle from 2011. Pours dark with very little foam. Amazing smell, spices. Tastes malty with a lot of raisins, spices and dark sugars. A truly amazing beer!
UPDATED: MAY 30, 2015 Braun. Dunkle Früchte, Rum, KAramell, Holz, Zucker, Vanille. Wärmend, Vanille, dunkle Früchte. Sehr geil, sehr komplex. Cremig.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Tumbler glass; room temperature.

Woaw ! So were in front of a beer with a nice and powerful aroma of spices, enhanced by that great taste. It says Belgian strong Ale, but I would say that shes more like an red/brown beer ! A little bit of a sticky palate.

One of the greatest Ive tasted so far ! Go go go !

Finally rating this. had this a lot of times, but this time its the 2013 in a head-to-head with westy and rochefort 33cl bottle. Pours an almost pitch black with almost no head. Aroma has lots of sweet, yeasty esters with prunes, dates, prunes and stuff, but compared to the other beers, this one has american stout-like notes, like sweet tobacco, some cinnamon, slight roast, anis, licorice and caramel malts. Both lots of candy, but also pretty different with the licorice and the tobacco notes. Taste again is sweet, but with lots of exotic dry and almost bitter notes, like again the roast and the tobacco. Low carbonation and nice, full body.

Bottle at home. Aged for almost one year. Pours dark brown, almost black with almost no head. Smells of dried fruits, spices and coffee. Taste is lean, spicy. Low carbonation. I find this beer very pleasant!

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2015 33cl flesje bij Cambrinus, Brugge Alcoholpercentage van 10% Uitgeschonken in origineel Struise Brouwers glas 2014 versie Uiterlijk: zwart met dikke cremelaag Aroma en smaak: caramel, gebrande mouten, donker fruit, rozijnen Conclusie: erg zuur op het moment dat ik hem dronk, verkeerd flesje wellicht, want dat staat me niet bij van eerdere keren

Edit 15-7-2015: gedronken bij De Gouverneur, Maastricht, versie 2015. Bij Cambrinus inderdaad een verkeerde gehad. Deze is niet zuur als azijn. Perfecte smaken nu weer. Chocolade ook nog als smaak erbij.

Very dark ruby, brownish colour, nice beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, candy sugar, biscuits, yeast, caramel. Taste is medium sweet and very well balanced. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Veeery good.

Pours a very dark brown with big fizzy tan head that turns to a very fine ring around the glass. Aroma is brown sugar, candied sugar, dark dried fruits(plums, dates, rasins, prunes) and a touch of molasses. Flavour is dark dried fruits, rasins, dates, plums, prunes, candied sugar, molasses, brown sugar, a touch alcohol warmth, mild chocolate and a faint bitterness.
Dark brown with samll light brown head. Bread aroma. Sour with some sweetness balanced with bitternes later.

Black color, minimal head. Aroma is very complex with notes of caramel, chocolate, nuts, banana, vanilla, wood. Same in the taste with a predominent sweetness first, counterbalanced by a nice bitterness. Low carbonatioon and oily texture. Definitely one of my top 3 beers!

Bottle 33cl from Systembolaget, 2013 vintage. Dark mahogany, thin beige head. Syrup, dark fruits, dried fruits, raisins, some alcohol, fruity, banana, candied fruit, brown sugar, spices. Quite sweet. Medium body, low carbonation, sweet finish. A little too sweet for my taste, otherwise very interesting and complex.
Aroma: Dark syrup, black currant, bit alcoholic hints of banana and raisins. Sweet fruity taste with just enough btitterness in the background to give balance, maybe a bit too sweet.

Part of a wonderful day in Bruges sampling Pannepeut, Pannepot, Reserva and Grand Reserva. The Reserva is clearly the best, especially in terms of balance of flavours. All must be tried. The wife thought Pannepeut was second best and really should be sought out more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very very good beer!! Smells like wine, and after than some karamell, fruits, etc. love them!!
A: caramel, raisins, liqurice, rhumbarrels, vanilla T: apricot, orange, zest, sweet taste! O: Low carbo and quite sweet and sour.

Beczka; bawa brązowa, zmętniona. Aromat suszonych owoców, chleba, karmelu, kwiatowy, likieru. W smaku dominuja suszone owoce, suszona śliwka, karmel, ciemny chleb. Gładkie w ustach. Alkohol świetnie ukryty.

Draught
Aroma-caramel, floral, dark fruits
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium sourness, lightly bitter, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

From tap at Ma Che Siete, Rome. Black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, coffee, fruity (dark dried fruits). Taste is sweet and light bitter, malty, fruity, banana, chocolate, coffee, light wineous. Medium to full body, oily, soft carbonation.
Brown colour with remaining laces. Sweet dried fruut aroma. Complex taste with dried fruit, malt and balanced bitterness, well hiding the alcohol.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2014 01.11.2014, 0,33l bottle (2013) sampled @ Cardinal:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, dried dark fruits, caramel malts, dark sugar, grass, citrus, hints of butterscotch. Taste is slightly dry fruity, citrus, dried dark fruits, alcohol, caramel malts, grass, minerals, burnt caramel. Medium bitterness, slightly dry and watery mouthfeel. Fair enough.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2016 Tasting this very complex beer is an amazing experience. At first fruity and spicy esters, then a massive doppelbock caramel aroma soon followed by christmas cake, mature fruit, nuts, then chocolate, and at last bitter coffee. The aftertaste is incredibly clean and not so persisting. The body is lighter than youd expect. Every sip is different from the following one that I think Id need at least 3 bottles to really understand this elegant beer and how it plays with its balance between maltiness and "esterness". Hops actually not perceived neither spices added. Very dark color with a medium foam. The alcohol content is just something printed on the label. 

Update: after more than two years Im tasting this beer again, a 2015 bottle. Sure there are esters (prune and yellow fruit above all) but the phenols are less preminent than the previous one. Im astonished by the fabulous chewiness and the massive velvety texture. Its very next to an imperial stout, less belgian than I recalled. Im changing some marks because this beer is a freaking awesome.

P.S. For the beer geeks like me: the FG (measured) is 1030 although they say its 1025.
P.P.S. The aromas remind me the Fermentis T-58 yeast. Some say its the actual yeast but... who knows?

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Couleur noire, très légère mousse beige. Nez fort et complexe de cerises noires, fruits noirs, sucre candy, alcool, malt, notes fruits secs et épices... Gout de fruits noirs muris en fut, vieux fruits, fruits secs, malt, cerises noires avec notes aigres, sucre candy, raisins, épices, réglisse.
Super legere et ronde en bouche... bien longue, et on sent a peine les 10c°.
Un vrai feu dartifice... une tuerie.
 (merci freretoc p les 2 derniers commentaires..)
ps: a ce jour ma meilleure note

Bottle 0,33l. Deep brown color, even black. Medium beige head. In aroma there ale lot of spicy notes, some dried fruits, caramel. Taste is even better! There is caramel, biscuits, fruits, light coffee, spices, a light hoppy finish... its very complex! Highly carbonated. Excellent one.
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 I had it from Bier Temple, Brussels!  Sice I had Pannepot  Reserva  a few weeks before than this one, my expactations were high. Its good but Reserva is way better
UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 33cl @ bottle. Praticamente perfetta, a partire dallodore e dal gusto. Ha poco da invidiare a birre più famose e osannate. Banana, cioccolato e spezie varie. Splendida.
Mörkt, mörkt brun och ett brunt skum. Doft: Russin, lakrits, söt malt, madeira, sött fat doft, söt körsbärs likör, rom. Smak: Fat, malt, lakrits, vin, russin, rostat.

Bottiglia del 2013, colore marrone scuro tendente al nero con una schiuma color cappuccino fine e poco persistente, allaroma si sente malto, cioccolato e frutta sotto spirito, in bocca è fantastica, piena e rotonda con un bel sapore di liquirizia nel finale. Una birra fantastica che va sicuramente bevuta almeno una volta

330mL vintage 2013
Dark brooding, near black ale. Dark tan head is dense and persistent.
Nose offers an evolving painting of aromas; dark chocolate, nutmeg, date, clove, sultana, roast nuts, nut brown butter, earthy spice, molasses.
Creamy, syrupy, chewy body. Rich, decadent, without being cloying. Smooth carbonation.
Theres so much to enjoy going on here; chocolate liqueur, liquorice, charred barrel notes, stewed vinous fruits, raisins, clove & nutmeg & black pepper, cooked citrus, treacle & dark candy sugar, a subtle earthiness, moderate bitterness. Smoooooth finish, lingers so nicely. Whered that 10% go!?
Sensational beer - one of the best Belgians, truly.

Finally got to try this Pours a clear dark brown with a big yellowish head. Date-, prune- and alcohol aroma. Big and stable off-white head. Tastes quite sweet of molasses and sirup spiced with dates, figs and prunes. Hint of burnt caramel. A strong effect in the back of the mouth - nice. Medium to high carbonation. Very full beer with a sweet finish

Pour a dark garnet color with a light tan head and decent lacing. Aroma is fruity with red apples, cherry cough drop, some banana even and bready yeast. Taste is dark fruit like raisin and plums, cherries and bread. Nice and flavorful Belgian.

2014 bottle. Pours a dark brown, garnet color. Aroma is full of fruit; banana, cherry, apple, tropical and dark, with some bread and a hint of alcohol. Taste is more dark fruits, raisin and prune, with some red apple. Really develops on your tongue. Has some roast and chocolate. Medium mouthfeel. Really interesting and dense flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Muddy medium brown with half a finger of khaki head. Smells is dark fruit, cheese, yeasty, raisin, plum, brown sugar, cherry. Taste is a sweet rush of brown sugar caramel sweetness, bready, a little mocha, raisin, malty. Warming, medium mouth, coats. Good Belgian yeastiness, nice malt sweetness and dark fruity flavors. Well done Belgian strong. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In short: yeasty liquour beer.
Aroma is incredibly rich and complex, and resembles uncooked flour, creamy crown, taste is strong and sweet/liquory, aftertaste is complex and kind of bitter.
An amazing beer which pours out a thick and dark. I was mery much amased by its thick texture and balanced sweet aroma.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle served in a Westvleteren chalice.
I dunno remember the Edition of my first review. This review is based on 2010 Edition enjoyed at the 26/08/2014. LOT 32255711. Best Before 24.09.2016.
A: Pours a deep amber to brown color forming a small to medium beige head. Medium to low retention forming and leaving only few spotty lacings in the glass. A small layer remains for a long time on the top
S: Very sweet, malty, spicy and mainly, fruity. Strong notes of caramel, caramel malts, candi sugar, licorice, dry plums, dry raisins, orange zest, vanilla, chocolate, brown bread, earthy hops and wood. Notes of black pepper and coriander. A bit booze in the end. But a very well hidden 10% ABV
T: Exactly like the nose. Very sweet upfront. Strong notes of caramel, caramel malts, candi sugar, licorice, dry plums, dry raisins, grapefruit, vanilla, chocolate, brown bread, black pepper. Balanced bitterness in the end. Earthy hops 
M: Full heavy body. Creamy and molasses. Medium to low carbonation. Sweet, malty and aftertaste with a pleasant earthy bitterness in the back of the tongue
O: Perfect drinkability. Perfect Quad. Perfect beer
[ BA Review @ 10/17/2009 ]

Poured from bottle into tulip glass. Thick head and dark brownish color. Aroma a little bit pungent with malt and vinegar. Flavor is immediately complex and intriguing. Flat carbonation with a fruity sweetness on the front end mixed with toasty malts, a moderate sourness, and some subtle chocolate. Almost no booziness in the finish. Instead, it ends in a soft saccharine like cola finale. A beer that is hard to pin down and keeps you interested through the whole bottle. Intellectually stimulating.

Poured a cloudy brown color with a large off white head and no lacing. Aroma of mint, dark fruits, roast, yeast, and a funky barnyard aspect as well. Taste was sweet raisins, chocolate, roast, tons of spices and an alcohol burn.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep brown, nose is dark fruit, berries, taste is fruity, esters, light chocolate.
Bought at Belgian Beer Shop, Leuven. Rich, warming, chocolatey sweetness gives way to a pleasant mild bitterness. This might just be my favourite beer.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe website (£3.79): 
Dark opaque brown colour with some ruby & a bubbly, light brown head about 0.5cm tall that fades quite quickly.

Strong dark & ripe fruits (dates/plums/raisins/currants). Lots of sugar & alcohol tinged yet not as strong as a 10% beer should be. Caramel malts come through with some acidity. Complex but not bad.

A strong taste with strong fruit that mirror the nose (dates/plum/currants & a few others). Very sweet some acidity & an almost wine like taste. Grapes feature with lots of sugars too.

Very sweet with some alcohol (doesnt seem 10% though). Smooth, medium body with some acidity but it still goes down easily, helped by the medium carbonation.

Nice stuff from De Struise here, the beer was exceptionally sweet throughout with quite a complex mix of dark & ripe fruits that seems to mask some of the alcohol. It was definitely an enjoyable beer & one that went down well but Im not entirely sure it is one that Id go back to again, mainly because it was so strong.

"2007 vintage-poured very dark...almost stout-like, but ruby tinged when held up to light. thin tan head. strong aroma of fruit (fig/dates), malt, molasses, booze. feel is very smooth and full...one of the best for any belgian ive ever had. it was nice to not have ridiculous amounts of sediment, floaties, and overcarbonation. those thing seperate this from others. the flavor was quite good as well...more molasses and fruity malts, spice. if it had any faults, maybe it was too rich, but really no complaints. solid beer. i ever so slightly prefer the grand reserve."

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2014 2010 vintage, pours a cloudy brown brew with a good retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with caramel, vanilla, chocolate, darle fruits, smooth, great balance, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with a bittersweet finish with a long aftertaste, excellent
Bottle at NK Ölbar. Dark brown with tan head. Sweet aroma with candied sugar, molasses and dried cherry. Smooth sweet taste with more of the dried fruit, brown sugar and sweet liquorice.

Draft @ basement beer bar in Aalborg. 
Amazing caramel aroma with overripe red berries, dried dark fruit, alcohol. Reddish brown with tiny off-white head. 
Quite sweet, more fruit. 
Soapy texture, great body, finish is longlasting, light carbonation.
Surprisingly dark for the style (drunk in a Belgian Strong Dark beer tasting). Astringent quality from the dark malt with notes of liquorice and spices. Intense and full body. Very good.
Ein fantastisches bier. Nach jedem letzten schluck spürt man das verlangen nach einem weiteren...
Brownblack colour. Smells of raisins and liquorice. Taste is mostly liquorice. Has a ginger spiciness upfront. Smooth mouthfeel, alcohol is there but in the background. 2010 vintage 33cl bottle.
Shared bottle at Mi2 15.09.14. 2013 vintage. Almost black. Beige head. Herbs and liquorice in aroma. Similar, and slightly sour, taste.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2015 Old Fishermans Ale 2013. Bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours dark brown, almost black. Aroma of raisins, burnt sugar, malt, spices. Taste fruity-sweet with liquorice, raisins. Bitter-sweet aftertaste, some alcohol warmth. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Well balanced.

[2011] 33cl bottle. Slow gusher. Murky mahogany with a foamy beige head. Lots of sediments. Flavors are bread, dried fruits, cherries, plum, dates, dark chocolate, molasses, brown sugar, toffee, licorice, tobacco and spices with vinous and slight oxidized notes. Pleasant alcohol warmth. Full body, bright light carbonation, creamy and sticky texture. Delicious.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2015 The "Fishermans Ale". Not Struises first, but the beer with which they first attracted international attention; I remember the first batch, brewed at Caulier (and tasted at Kulminator years ago), as being a perfectly decent massieve ale, but a lot sweeter and more straightforward; the recipe was revised then and the result became one of the most wonderfully complex and rich, profound brews in Belgium.  It has a very dark bronze colour, hazy, with a thickly lacing, light beige, creamy head; very fruity and deeply malty profile, candi sugar, complex with pleasant drying spicy notes, elegant yeastiness and characterful hop bitterishness in the finish along with warming, liqueurish alcohol. Hints of port, banana, walnuts, candied orange, toast, bitter chocolate, caramel...  Very complex, balanced and solid, a great beer indeed.  The 2014 issue seems to have become notably more tart, with a drying sour berry acidity almost as in a Flemish sour; in comparison, the earlier vintages (2013 and before) are more rounded and sweet, acting more like genuine abts, with more pronounced hints of port, banana and candi sugar.  I tasted several vintages yesterday: the 2011 was a lot like the 2013 but with a somewhat less pronounced aroma and more restrained flavour, but very well balanced.  The 2009 in comparison showed signs of maderization, effectively making it more complex and more noble.  The 2008 was expectedly further oxidized and a bit thinned by age, leading to the conclusion that quality (slowly) begins to deteriorate a bit after six odd years, though it still remained a great beer of wonderful complexity...  Clearly a great beer for ageing, which holds strong for quite a number of years.  Highly recommended!
Bottle 0.33l from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark colour with small white head.Taste of cheery with sweet note.Dried fruits especially grapes.Awesome

In tap (2013) while in Brugges; great beer ... pours a very dark brown/black. Aroma somewhat of cocoa and brown sugar, finishing with a little plum. The 10% alcohol is very well hidden. A very good beer, and I will absolutely buy again

Bottle from CBX. Pours a deep brown, almost black with a creamy tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, toffee, caramel. roasted walnuts, plums, dark fruits, and spices. Complex, milk chcoclate in flavor with toffee, toasted bread, caramel, plums and raisins with subtle notes of spices. Silky mouthfeel and smooth carbonation and no trace of booze. Good stuff.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2014 Birra fenomenale!!! Dal colore marrone scurissimo, impenetrabile, quasi nero, tanto da ricordare unImperial Stout (anche un po il sapore). Ma se si piega il bicchiere si possono notare riflessi ambrati. Schiuma non molto abbondante e poco persistente, di un colore marroncino con riflessi dorati. Laroma è pieno, caldo e avvolgente, con chiari sentori di vino passito, marsala e porto, nonché una passa e prugna. In bocca è un vero capolavoro. Corpo decisamente strutturato, quasi masticabile. La birra è molto vellutata al palato e scivola bene, quasi cose se fosse crema più fluida. I suoi 10 gradi non si sentono assolutamente. Decisi sentori di cioccolato al rum, marsala, porto, prugna, caramello e uva passa. Sentori chiaramente percepibili anche nel retrogusto molto persistente. Sensazioni incredibili per una birra dalla fama veramente ben motivata!

2009 bottle at home in my Struise glass. Picked up at the school yard in Aug 2009. had this a few times before, but this is my first rate. 
Aroma is brown sugars, muscavado sugars, tart apple, berry, raisin and some tart raspberry and serbert. Dark caramel brown / orange coloured pour with a lasting thin light tan head. Flavours is vinous, caramel, berry fruits, unrefined sugars, subdued but nice yeast complexity. Palate is medium full, vinous and highish carbonation, tingles the tongue. Quite well attenuated. Good stuff.

Drucken på Monks Porterhouse, gamla stan. Gräddig belgisk doft och kropp. Smaken går i samma tecken som är rätt avrundad och lite belgisk söt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vloeit lang uit..
Chocolade.
Het aroma zou een licht zuurtje als smaak geven echter dat is nauwelijks te bespeuren.
A great ale. Pours a deep mahogany brown. Aromas are bubblegum and dried fruit. Flavors are dried fruit, coffee, raisins. So good and smooth. One of the best Belgian ales out there.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18E). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 5528260913- AROMA: nice dried fruits aromas, reminiscent of raisins and dried figs, with a sweet and caramel/vanilla malt background. no roasted aromas, nor hops and diacetyl. alcohol aromas are spicy and pleasant and not solventy, with an old Port like quality. APPEARANCE: dark brown color with a slight ruby tint. nice moussy brown head with good retention. TASTE: well balanced flavours similar to the aromas (raisins and dried figs) with a sweet and caramelly/vanilla Port like background. moderate bitterness that balances the sweetness. finishes medium-dry. no roasted flavours. gente alcohol warmth and not solventy. PALATE: smooth medium body with medium carbonation with a smooth alcohol warmth noticeable. OVERALL: a very nice, complex dark belgian ale with a plethora of aromas to dive in. And very dangerous...

At common table with Colin, Jacob, Justin, and friends. Pours brown dark with almost no lacing. Aroma is caramel, nice sweet, smooth alcohol. Nice warming. Taste is big smooth alcohol, caramel, molasses, thick and warm.

0.33L bottle. Pours black with a thick, brown head. Sweet aromas of cereal malt, vanilla, alcohol, cotton candy. Falvor is quite sweet up front, dark fruit and vanilla. Morpths into a complex sweetnes, a bit hard to pull out inidividual flavors, but it moves quickly through quie a few of them. Finishes with enough dark malt bitter and hop to cut the sweetness. Full body with a creamy mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Overall, some nice complexity to this beer. Definitely good for desert!

Beautiful dark brown colour, minimal head. Aroma: Red fruits, caramel, toasty. Taste: Malt, spicy (cinnamom), dark chocolate. Licorice. Alcohol is noticeable, but not that much. Very complex and tastefully and extremely balanced. One of my all time favs!

Aroma is deep malts, molasses, light caramel, plum and raisin. Taste is some light sour notes from age, deep rich malts with a nice sweetness. Dark fruits compliment the fruit body nicely. Appearance is a amber /black body with a thin beige head that retains fairly poorly.

Esta exquisita cerveza de Struise cuenta con muy poco aroma, pero con una amplitud de sabores sumamente profundos y dulces. Sabores maltosos, acaramelados y tostados. Me recuerda al chocolate, a la miel y al pan negro de centeno recién salido del horno. Es absolutamente sublime.

When I poured this, I was so excited. It took me a while to find it, and I was emotional. When I saw the color of the pour, I actually got giddy. Super nice dark mahogany color. All in all, very very nice, although I will admit it's not my absolute favorite among those in it's class. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a dark dark brown with a small shortlasting tanned head. Aromas of some caramel malt, sweet dark dried fruits, some spices, booze, soy, licorice. Taste is pretty sweet up front, malt, slight roast, pretty spicy. Dark chocolate. Full body.

DWF; Bottle from Cardinal. Pours dark copper with a lasting, lacing, tan head. Nose is malt, caramel, dried fruits, berries and vinious. Taste is bitter sweet, sour, warming and lasting. Body is medium, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft.
DWF Cardinal. Dark with brown lasting head. Aroma of malt yeast and caramel. Tast is smooth with malt caramell and yeast.

Best flat beer I ever had. Great dried fruit nose after swirling. Very dark Amber with small head that disappeared quickly. Figs, coffee, butterscotch, licorice, raisin, vanilla, plum flavors. Small alcohol warmth and almost no carbonation. Semi sweet finish. Awesome!

Cor escura aroma de especiarias e tosta. Espuma com boa estabilidade e persistência. Sabor de malte torrado e leve caramelo. Corpo médio. Seca com amargor médio. Uma cerveja complexa e excepcional, comparável a um bom vinho.
Een heel lekker bier, net als de Pannepeut een uitgesproken smaak die mij enorm kon bekoren

Pours a black body with a medium brown head. Complex, strong and slightly sour aroma of dark dried fruits, wood, red wine and tart red berries. The flavour is also strong, with that kind of sourness that red wine barrel ageing gives. But if I understand the label correctly this isnt barrel aged at all? There are also plenty of sweet, dark dried fruits, clove, anise, caramel and alcohol, with traces of chocolate in the back. Moderate sweet, light sour and moderate bitter taste. Thick and pleasant mouthfeel, soft carbonation. A splendid beer! 
[33 cl bottle, 2013 edition, shared with mforseth @ Café Sara, Oslo]

Small bottle, 2013 vintage. Shared by suurjuust. thanks! Pours dark brown with tan head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, vinous, dark fruits, spices, alcohol. Flavor is sweet, spices, fruits, and some alcohol. Overall: nice brew, I guess it would get better after some time.

Nice inch thick off white head and black body poured from bottle. 2010. Caramel Aroma. Thick mouthfeel with just a little carbonation. Lots of a caramel, sugars, and some nutmeg and chocolate taste. A healthy alcohol finish. One of my favorite beers.

330 ml bottle, as Struise Pannepot 2013 Old Fishermans Ale (ale brewed with spices), PNP No. 4 Brown Brew. ABV is 10%. Very dark brown to ruby colour, nearly black. Moderate tan head. Intense and interesting aroma of rich malts, various spices and brown kandij sugar. Medium sweet and distinctly spicy flavour, again notes of rich malts, also notes of liquorice, anise, caramel and pumpernickel bread.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Pannepot 2010 - Sűrű testű, nem túl hivalkodó habbal bír, illata pedig hasonlóképpen visszafogott, finoman sejtető. Az élesztőfelhők közé egy légiesen könnyed gyümölcsösség, enyhe lekváros árnyalat fonódik - a gyümölcsök természetesen a markánsabb fajtából valók -, az aroma összességében azonban meglehetősen lágy, a legkevésbé sem zömök, vagy átütő. Kakaó, kávé és étcsokoládé finomítja tovább a képet, melyek ez esetben valóban a világosabb tónusok mentén tartják meg az aromaskálát, nem nehezítik el a hangulatot. A lezárás ezt követően szintén az élesztő savanykás élű képében jelentkezik. Azt semmi esetre sem állíthatjuk, hogy a képzeletbeli édesség-fokmérő maximum értéket mutatna a tesztelés során, a kandiscukorral viszont ez esetben sem spóroltak a főzőmesterek. Közel sem annyira émelyítő és nehéz azonban, mint néhány korábban kóstolt darab - csakúgy, mint az illata esetében, az édes zamatok ezúttal is remekül nyújtják szét a terepet, nem tódulnak egybe, finoman terjednek szét egy harmonikus keretet adva az ízeknek. Ezek között leginkább a diós, mazsolás jellegű, desszertszerű komponenseké a főszerep, melyekhez egy fűszeres, gyógynövényes jelleg is társul, a komló kissé távolinak tűnő karaktere és egy enyhébb fokú alkoholos érintettség mellett. Ami számomra a leginkább különlegessé teszi ezt a sört klasszikusan finom ízén kívül, az a tökéletesen egyedi test, mely a felsorolt benyomások, cukrászati alapanyagok emlékképének jelenléte ellenére határozottan éles tud maradni, és egy üvegvékony gerincként bár, de mindvégig ellen képes állni a hízott összetevők mázsás súlyának. Lényegében tehát némileg könnyedebb ital képe bontakozott ki a kóstolása során, mint amire előzetesen számítani lehetett, a hatás azonban feltétlenül pozitív volt. Különlegesen gazdag főzet.
Pannepot 2012 - A Pannepeut-tal némiképp összehasonlítva a színében egy sötétebb, majdhogynem feketés árnyalatot vesz fel, habja is nagyobb, ám ugyanolyan telt és krémes, mint az említett típusé. Az első meglepetés az aromái terén ér, mivel azok megérzésem szerint a savanykásabb, vadóc élesztős hangulat hiteles közvetítői. Eperlekváros, gyümölcsaszalványos, s egyszerre éretlen gyümölcsös jegyek szabadulnak fel, a fanyarság nagyobb foka véleményem szerint az utolsó cseppig kitöltött élesztő jelenlétének, na meg a kornak tudható be. Íze is a fanyar irány felé halad, sós és édes, savanykás és óvatosan kesernyés jellemvonásokat egyaránt felvonultat, szilvalekvár, mazsola, némi karamell és marcipán, dohány képe is feltűnik, rendkívül színes tehát a forgatag, összességében azonban az érett, nem metszően, inkább lágyan fanyar, harsány élesztős karakter a fő mondanivalója ennek a példánynak, s a vibráló kavalkád mintegy tartalommal tölti meg a vaskos kontúrokat. Bebizonyosodott tehát, hogy a korábban kóstolt verziótól az évjáratbeli különbségek igen erőteljesen elválasztják az egyes változatokat, bár nem kevésbé fantasztikus, mindenképpen más főzetet csodálhatunk tehát ennek a típusnak a személyében.

Bottle from the brewery in Bruges. Pours mahagany with a tan head. Quite sweet with notes of dark fruit, christmas cake spices, caramel and chocolate. Very drinkable with the alcohol barely noticable. Extremely tasty.

330ml bottle. 2013. Black-brown colour with a reddish tinge, tan foam head and aroma of malt, molasses, raisins, dark fruity. Taste is roast malt, bready, sweet, brown sugar, with caramel, chocolate, cherry, dried fruits, and some spice, coffee, hints of grassy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, lingering sweetish warming light bitter finish. Complex, very drinkable.

Poured from a 2011 bottle. This pours a dark brown color with a foamy light brown head. The aroma is bold with sweet malts and molasses. The taste is sweet, smooth and delicious. There is a good amount of spices that are well blended. There are lots of complex flavors for being an easy drinking beer. Definitely a must try!

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2017 From bottle, a 2011 vintage sampled in 2014. Dark hazy almost opaque brown with a medium beige head. Little lacing. Huge aroma of figs and dates and dark fruits, along with bread and biscuit. Taste has all of that, sweet, little bitterness. Full mouthfeel. Perfect carbonation. This is a work of art. No wonder its score is so high. 

Enjoyed again from a 2016 bottle (one year old)  at the Cafe Gollem Raamsteeg, Amsterdam. Same luscious silky smooth deliciousness.

Very complex aroma with caramel, cinnamon, mature fruits,vanilla.Dark brown color, really small head, licorice lacing.medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, licorice, cinnamon, caremel, some dried fruits.long finish.
caramel, dark chocolate, tasted notes, alcohol. dark hazy brown appearance with eige head. Taste: heavy sweet and light bitters after waves of sweet.

Vierte color marrón oscuro con reflejos rubí, media cabeza de espuma beige de retención escasa; en nariz aromas a dátiles, ciruelas pasas, bourbon y frutos negros; en boca entrada potente y licorosa con notas a cacao y especias. Cuerpo potente con carbónico bajo, alcohol bien integrado en una cerveza bien balanceada con largo y dulce pos gusto que no empalaga.

Bouteille from de struise 
Un nez puissant de arômes d épices
En bouche c est une explosion de saveur
Couleur noir café une mousse persistante
Un maltage parfait bref une bière 100% juste

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Draught @ Ma che Siet Venuti A fa, Rome; pours dark brown with mahohany reddish glitter and creamy amber head. Nose is caramel, strog dried fruit, like prunes and dry pears, rum and cinnamon. Taste is caramel, raisin, prunes and dried cherries or even cherry brandy, but without noticable alcohol wormth, despitr of the 10% ABV.  Body is large with soft carbonation. This is an amaizing beer! Very complex, rich and malty but soft and extemly drikable. One of the best! De Struise rules!

Dark brown with tanned head. Aroma of caramel, roast, fruits and some alcohol. Very smooth and fresh taste despite this! Completely changing from my lately usual IPAs. Very soft palate, flows very well. And of course one cannot miss the alcohol at 10%! A really good one!

Poured from bottle into a pint glass
 Appearance  The beer pours a super hazy dark brown-mahogany color with a billowy off white head. The head fades rather slowly over time to leave a good level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is quite heavy of darker fruit smells with lots of plum, raisin, and fig. Along with the darker fruit smells comes plenty of bready and lightly roasted malt smells. Some yeasty smells as well as some other sweet aromas of a caramel and toffee nature come along as well. A bit of spice of coriander and clove as well as a slightly funky like smell come and linger on the nose creating a rather dark and sweet but slightly funky off aroma to sit on the nose.
 Taste  The taste begins with a very dark fruit sweet flavor with tons of raisin, fig, plum, and cherry. The sweeter flavors are matched by a bit of a bready and doughy taste with a hint of a chocolate and a bit of roasted malt mixed within. The yeast and spice that were detected in the nose come on more strongly toward the middle of the taste and bring a very nice dimension to the brew, complementing well the sweeter dark fruit flavors of the brew nicely. Some candied sugar flavors and a little bit of a rummy booziness develop on the tongue as the flavors advances, bringing a little bit of warmth to the taste. At the very end, a little bit of earth and a light woody/oaky flavor join the profile which end up leaving a very tasty and somewhat smoother, but robust sweet dark fruit quad flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the average side in terms of thickness and creaminess for a brew of 10 % abv. with a carbonation level that is on the average side as well. The average thickness and carbonation are a nice compromise for the sweeter dark fruit and boozy, oaky, and spiced flavors of the brew and makes for a nice easy drinking, yet slower sipping brew overall.
 Overall  This is one quite tasty quad. This one is on the tops of my list. Dark fruity, nicely spiced, and yeasted, with a good blend of a warming taste/feel, but all while maintaining a great drinkability and enjoyability. This is quite a nice quad!!

Pours a very dark brown with barely half a finger of beige head. Preserved fruits, raisins, medium roasted malts, sweet licorice and some coffee on the nose. Palate is medium bodied, definetely on the sweet side. Sweet fruits, a hint of acidity and no bitterness. The finish is very long. Very nice. Will try to cellar a few to see how it developes. I think this will be even better in a few years time.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2015 Pitch black color with beige medium-lasting head. Aroma is intense, ripe fruits like plums, figues and raisins are present together with chocolate, toasted malts, hazelnuts and spices. Medium to full bodied. Taste is very sweet, with toasted malts, caramel, cherries, plums, vanilla and spices, with a slightly tart and vineyard backbone. Very balanced, with well integrated alcohol. Dry finish, with some coffee and toffee hints. An absolute masterpiece.
Struise pannepot 10%. Zwart donker koffie bitter lange finish lekker vol alcoholisch. Tap at ma che siete venuti a fa roma. Dark coffe like beer. Thick. Slow drinker. Very nice

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 Dark black beer with almost no foam and no carbonation.
Smells like sweet cherry and wood. Tastes like cherry, bitter hops, malty fruity, sour, caramel, spices, coffee, soft and spicy accents of dried fruits.Very, very good beer.

Pours a coffeelike body and a thin head. Rich and complex aroma of dades and bread. Nice complex taste with a little creamy feel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. pour is nearly black with a large brown head that has a reddish tint to it as the bubbles break down and leave a thin light brown layer on top. Aroma is all dark fruit, raisin, cherry, melanoidin bomb. Taste is initially fruity then a light funky tartness comes through, like a tart apple almost. This is a 2010 bottle and here is some definite oxidation and it is the papery kind. Mouthfeel is medium to light, with some smooth alcohol warming in the ears after a couple sips. overall, pretty good, but the tartness and oxidation really prevent this from being world class.

Pours burnt umber with small superficial mocha-head (vanishes within minutes). Very little lacing. Aroma is knock-the-door-down belgian yeast and banana. Raisins, some brown sugar (molasses) and some plum. Melange of competing scents. Glorious and tone is the beer equivalent of a dessert wine. Taste is sweet - one small complaint is that it becomes a little cloying towards the end. Provides everything in the palate that it does in the nose (surprisingly rare). Banana and yeast notes are dominant but the dried fruit is never too far away. Excellent beer that provides the drinker with a conundrum that is unravelled in every sip.
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 Deze toch alweer een tijdje geleden op (2010 versie was het) maar totaal niet mijn ding.

Cerveza oscura de color café. Poca persistencia de la espuma. Buen cuerpo y de aroma y sabor complejo. Destaca la malta de aromas y sabores frutales que recuerdan a frutas oscuras y maduras como las pasas, ciruela, plátano y dátiles. En el sabor se hacen más evidentes las especias junto con un suave picor final. El retrogusto deja un leve dulzor residual seguido de una astringencia también leve. La presencia alcóholica es notoria pero a la vez está muy bien integrada en el conjunto. Una cerveza redonda que hay que degustar con tranquilidad. (Botella 330 ml)

Bottle @ home 20140630. Pours black with a medium light brown head. Aroma of dried fruit, cherries, toffee, licorice. Taste is roasty, lots of dried fruits, alcohol (almost like rum), cherries. Full body, slightly viscous, light carbonation. Quite complex. Nice.
33CL bottle at home 2012 on bottle, almost black beer with a medium head, aroma is roasted stuff, some fruit, taste is fruit. WOW this stuff is awesome!
Dark brown nearly black. Creamy cappucino with roasted malt, caramel, salt liquorice and spices. Full body and a long finish.

Bottle 2011: Very dense black. Light head and lace. Extremely dark roast profile. Hard hope lift. Mocha edge. Woody spice edge rather than hop not. Roast dominates not malt or hope or fruit. Dry to off dry, not sour and medium to medium low bitterness. Dense and long. Roasted flavor dominates. 
Very stout like. Lacks complexity and richness of some Belgium strong ales.

Happy to see this on tap at CBC Covent Garden. Pours a very dark brown with a recv edge and a tan head. Huge dark sticky fruit aroma - prunes, figs. Rummy too, with toffee and liquorice and some cherry candy. Full body, light carbonation. Sticky. Dark toffee, grass, light apple, rum, toffee pudding, coke, black jacks... Its rich, sweet and tasty. Nice enough.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Flaska drucken på nya Tröls. 2012 Vintage. Murrig brun färg med lågt krämigt skum. Från kylskåpet och väl kall. Relativt syrlig, söt, värmande alkohol, kraftig men ändå aningen platt. Stor söta smaker av torkad frukt, främst russin, men också banan, päron, plommon, körsbär, madeira, sötlakrits, marsipan, vanilj, mörkt socker, choklad. Väl integrerade smaker och alkohol. Riktigt riktigt gott.
Bottle 2013. Black with no head. Hints of caramel and coffee. Again it couldve been more enjoyable to drink this beer in winter rather than the summertime. Warming. Tasty. What not to love?
Very sweet fudge drink. Prefer the American strong ale which is an excellent style but this is good. Very dark for a Belgian. A bit too sweet in the long run.

Bottle, 2013. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma: brown sugar, bread, leather, dark fruit, alcohol. Taste: cane sugar, raisins, coffee, vanilla, spices, wood, chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel, complex, full bodied, very sweet (but not distracting) with a warming rum finish. Lovely!
Dark brown with sticky tan head. Dried fruits, sweet aroma. Raisins and dried plum. Sweet
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (40:-). 2013. Fruktig och kryddig, torkad frukt, hög sötma, karamell, banan och lakrits, viss sälta, medelfyllig till fyllig, oljig i konsistensen.

Bottle, poured into a tulip. Appearance- very dark, almost black, a little bit of light comes through when held to the light, where it appears dark brown. Head is one finger, light brown, it dissipates to leave a slight covering. Aroma- dark fruits, cherry, raisin, sugary fruit, a bit of bread and yeast, dark malts, chocolate fruit and nut, some cocoa powder and caramel, definite hoppiness. Taste- where to start? Lots of bitter, dark chocolate, big roasted malts, espresso coffee, hint of liquorice, rum and raisin ice cream, lots of dark fruits as well- cherry, raisin. Some vague vanilla sweetness and toffee, and theres a bit of banana bread in there too. Amazingly complex and so much going on- all the flavours vie for your attention.
