Mouthfeel is also exceptional- full and viscous, lasting bitter finish, nearly chewy, and silky smooth. This is incredible- one of the best beers Ive ever had.
@Ölprovning på Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget. Arom: Banan, choklad, lakrits. Smak: Dito + söt, fruktig. Kroppen är medelfyllig, konsistensen oljig.

Bottle, 2013 vintage.
Gushed and poured dark brown with a brown head that fizzled down at once.
Aroma has rye bread, chocolate, sweetness, marzipan.
Taste has chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, caramel, yeast, sweet vanilla/bourbonlike notes, sweet liquorice and slight alcohol heat.
Medium bodied with soft carbonation, smooth mouth feel.
Quite stout like, very good.

Bottle, Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Pour very dark, nearly black, medium dark beige head. Amazing aroma of chocolate cookies, bananas, dried fruits. Taste cinnamon, chocolate, palate much the same. A complex, highly interesting beer overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Op de fles bij de 3 dorstige herten. Donkere kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : koffie, lichte koolzuur. Heerlijk.

Bottle, 2011. Pours a beautiful brown, with clove and banana on the nose. I would probably identify this as an abbey quad in a blind tasting. Belgian yeast with a spicy sweetness. As it warms more roast and chocolate comes through. Yum.

Aroma: caramel, dark chocolate, tasted notes, alcohol. Appearance: dark hazy brown, medium frothy beige head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: light bitters after waves of sweet. Overall: fantastic Belgian Strong Ale. Bottle at t Brugs Beertje, Bruges.
UPDATED: JUN 4, 2014 Flesje uit 2013. Slechts een kleine schuimkraag. Smakelijke afdronk met zoete toets van koffie.

Pours a murkier coffee flavour that other ABT quads. Immediate, huge smell. A smooth-chocolate mouth ... Less alcohol burn than the Rochefort. Silky, chocolatey spice. This is as good as it gets. Up there with it's neighbour Westvleteren XII. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 bottle is 2011 vintage. Bottle gushed immediately upon opening, unavoidable alcohol abuse. Pours an opaque dark brown with light barely passing through. Head was 3 fingers for quite awhile (see above), but settled down to a rocky wisp of head covering the entire meniscus with sugary lacing. Thankfully all of this occurred in a 24 oz snifter. Aroma is rich and sweet: dark fruits, plum, raisin, brown sugar, Belgian yeast and spicy notes, and a slight alcohol burn. Flavor is classic Belgian quad - Belgian yeast with roasted malt, subdued spicy notes, and dark fruit characteristic of the style. Alcohol is well masked, and finish is quenching with a slight tang. Always an event to have this poured.
Caramel, bread, cereal, nuts, floral, basement aromas, herbs, bubblegum, clove, woody.
Heerlijk zwaar bier. Redelijke schuimkraag met een lekkere nadronk. Koffiesmaak. Alweer een heerlijk biertje van een excellente brouwerij.

Egyszer volt hozzá szerencsém, mert egy sulis társam meglepett vele, miután hazatért egy belgiumi körútról. Nagyon erős és intenzív, odaver. És emellett az íze és a habja is kiemelkedő. Ezért mondják a belgákra, hogy tudnak az egyszer biztos!
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, röstig, dunkles reifes Obst. Geschmack röstmalzig, stark malzig, überreife Früchte, Karamell.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a big brown head. Complex aroma of yeast, malt, raisins, alcohol and caramel. Flavor is sweet, plums, caramel, yeasty and brown sugar.

0,33l fles van marlies gekregen. Donker bruin veel fijne deeltjes, een snel slinkende crème kraag. Geur is fruitig met kersen en blauwe druiven ook biscuit op de achtergrond. Smaak sluit mooi aan op de geur met een volle afdronk, vooral erg zoet met een zuurtje.

Vertical tasting, thanks PriorL and Mathieu87! Vintage 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013.
General notes:
Dark brown colour, creamy beige foam. Medium carbonation. Very complex aroma of dark fruit, chocolate and light roasted malts. The older vintages had more vinous notes. The 2012 version was a bit sour (infection?). But overall a very good beer and lovely to age!

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2014 La birra si presenta con un aspetto perfetto. Colore scuro e schiuma pannosa e persistente. Al naso si sentono aromi leggermente fruttati che si uniscono a quelli tostati. La birra risulta molto bilanciata e piacevole al palato nonostante lelevato grado alcolico.

2013 vintage. 330 ml bottle from BG Birra, served in a snifter glass. Dark brown, with no light passing through, and a nice, creamy, dark beige head. Rich and complex aroma, notes of bitter dark chocolate, wood, roasted malts, spices (especially cinnamon, but also licorice and vanilla), some chocolate, wood and oak. Light booze as well. Incredibly smooth and velvety in the mouth, with the alchool completely masked. Some bourbon like qualities, tons of dark fruits and a sweet coffee/chocolate milkshake feeling. Less spicy compared to the nose, warming but not harsh, just perfect. Good balance bitween the sweetness and a mild bitterness. Average carbonation, medium to full body, oily texture. It really deserves to be a sipper. You seriously cant go wrong with Pannepot, always a pleasure!

Bottle bought from goos spirits guide Glasgow
aroma sweet grain with hints of chocolate
pours dark brown almost black with beige head
taste is sweet malt with light chocolate notes and a dryish long finish
body is slightly light for abv
overall a very nice beer

(Flasche) Es ist undurchsichtig, hat eine kalte braune Farbe, ist unfiltriert mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist hat was von Trauben, Bettanomyces und Erde. Es Schmeckt minimal röstig, samtig, Bettanomyces und Treibholz. Der Abgang ist warm und hat etwas von einer Bäckerei.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Very, very intense darkbrown beer. Taste resembles the darkest chocolate you can imagine, mixed with a hint of extremely dense caramel. Coffee aftertaste. Quite low on carbonation, almost like a pint of Guiness. This makes the drinking experience not as enjoyable as could be; combined with its robust taste I would recommend only drinking one.

WOW, a really nice beer to drink. Warm-brown colour. Really malty aroma, and really generous caffe taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing beer! It's just so good ... everything about it: smell, taste, looks ... everything. It's a perfect combination of fruits, oak, chocolate and spices.

On draught at Roscoes for Belgian Beer Summit. 2011 vintage. Slightly opaque reddish black color. Aroma is butterscotch, toffee, and liqueur. Taste is brown sugar, butterscotch, anise, and molasses. Smooth, sweet, and slightly boozy. Dark malty sweet finish.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2015 A: dark amber brown, small creamy head lacy, 
A: pleasant earthy sweet malty yeast strong
T: stout like
P:small carbs fades to smooth full bodied
O: good stout like beer
Flesje 33cl, zwart met bruine schuimkraag. Smaak is perfect. Heerlijk belgische strong ale. Struise chapeau.
Aroma is dark fruit and licorice, taste is dark fruit, malty, alcohol, some sweetness, aftertaste is short. Lacing is mild to moderate, head dissipates quickly.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Blind quad test against Westvleteren 12, Pannepeut, Rochefort 10, St Bernardus 12, St Amatus 12, The Sixth Glass, & Chimay Blue My prefered order was; Pannepot, Rochefort 10, St Amatus 12, Westvleteren 12, St Bernardus, Pannepeut, Sixth Glass and last Chimay.

Pours much much darker than the other quads, and has a tan head. Aroma is coffee, raisin, some vanilla wood notes, a bit oak touch, and a lot of dark fruit. Taste is upfront bitter roastiness, but then explode with dark fruit and complexity, this is really good, it has a licorice touch to it, and just has an amazing mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2017 Bottle from Rehills, Jesmond.

2006 Vintage Drank after 11 years. Black-brown in colour with a very thin head and a surprisingly fair amount of carbonation.  It has a plum, currant and dired fruity flavour with sherry notes, vanilla and oak on the smooth, slight bitter and wet paper finish. Still pretty good for its age.

2006 Vintage Score 4: Drank after 8 years; Black-brown in colour with ruby red highlights. It has very rich red fruit flavours, sherry spicy fruit notes and a warming leather and slight wet-paper off notes on the finish.

2010 Vintage Score 5: Drank after 4 years; Opaque black with ruby red highlights. This beer has very rich plum, sherry, red fruit, liquorice and chocolate flavours, a smooth silky mouthfeel and a spiced warming finish. Superb!!

Dark mocha chocolate brown, opaque, with oily residue. Aroma of dusty barnyard followed by saline, and hints of malt. Strongly malta favor with lots of coffee. Palate is full though oily, but despite the strong coffee flavor does not have the astringency of coffee.
Pours opaque chocolate brown. Brown head, dissipates quickly. Aroma is mostly dark malt, coffee. Rich flavor, full body. Long, roasty finish. Carbonation is just right. Very good.
Botella de 33 cl en el lupulo en octubre de 2012. edición 2009 --PNP no. 4 Brows brew-- bastante buena con sabores tostados y ligeramente dulces y especiados. Para repetir nuevamente

AROMA full of spices, caramel, banana, raisin and sugary notes. some fresh notes of the hops are showing, resinous. APPEARANCE is good, red-brown clear robe with a thin brown foam of regular sized bubbles. Taste is really spicy, coffee, fresh in fruits, but from dry fruits. Really sweet ant a bit sour. Long lasting PALATE of sugary candy taste, medium body of thin texture. average carbonation. OVERALL I was expecting a great beer and was indeed pleased. Super well balanced between the different notes and tastes. One of a kind ! Poured from a 33cl bottle from fridge in Teku glass.
Bottle 33 cl. 2012 edition at Nya Tröls. Complex with loads of dried fruits and spices.
Bottle to a snifter, 2011 version.  Deep brown pour with ample tan head.  Dried fruit, dates and raisins.  Sweet roasted maltiness.  This is an amazing beer!!!

Bottle. Aroma: dried fruits, raisins, little dark malts. Pours deep dark brown colour, beige head. In taste quite sweet, full bodied, same notes as in aroma. Oily texture, alcohol (10%) present as a little warming effect - very well hidden. Bitter finish. Very good beer.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Dark brown, beautiful. Aroma: Caramel, toffee, sweet. Taste: Caramel, toffee, wery well balance, alcohol, but not much... Excellent.

Pours deep dark with a cream head. Aroma and taste: dried fruits, raisins, plums, spices, also hints of roasted malts, coffee. Heavy body, fizzy carbonation, oily texture. Hints of alcohol, warming, bitter finish. Amazing beer.

Absolutely one of the best beers I have tasted in a long time. A dark beautiful Belgian Beer at 10 %. Deep dark beer with a nice creamcoloured head. A trappist beer in structure. Rich in flavour and taste. Dried fruit, raisins and plum with a note of sugar and spices. Strong without the sharp alcoholtaste. A complex and wellbalanced beer.
Complex, sweet all in great balance with the bitter finish. The flagship of Struise Brouwers.
caramel, alcohol, licorice, brown, medium bitterness, coffee, rocky head, roasty, resin, thick feel,

Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with nuts, hops, toffee, earthy notes, licorice, chocolate and ripe fruits. Bitter finish with citrus, toffee, chocolate and earthy notes. Exquisite belgian strong ale.

330ml bottle. 2011. Dark brown pour, thin, slightly frothy tan head. Nose is dark fruits, coffee notes, milk chocolate, earthy notes, sherry, cherries, wood, leather and hints of whiskey. Really nice. Flavour has lots of the above, with some liquorice, bitter, heavy coffee. Really intense, powerful flavour. Heavy body, some nice light but fizzy carbonation. Incredibly, flavour opens more as it warms. Slick, oily mouthfeel. Finish is heavy, dry liquorice. Definite hints of the big ABV, warming in the finish. Astounding.
Bière très foncée, mousse moka assez fine. Au nez on sent lalcool et le sucre mais au palais se rajoutent des arômes de graines torréfiées, figue et sucre candi. Superbe équilibre !

Bu en bouteille de 33cl estampillé 2012, une couleur brune intense avec une mousse brune très peu marquée et qui tombe vite, en bouche cest un feu dartifice, très sèche pour commencer elle éclate sur une attaque sur le sucre Candy et le grillé de type noix de macadamia, elle est longue en bouche et elle sattache sur une note poivrée très prégnante, une tuerie
Cervesa rodona com poques, torrada i especiada i molt fàcil de beure. una de les millors belgues.

2007 bottle. Gushed over upon opening! Ugh. After allowing her to settle down, she poured a deep caramel/plum color, loaded with sediment. After allowing (or trying to allow) the glass to settle, the aromas very delightful. Lots of red wine/vinegar, dark fruits, caramel, spices and breads. Very inviting. Taste was very unbalanced, unfortunately. Lots of booze upfront, very sharp. The dark fruits and port character did little to calm the the booze/spice that continued to dominate through the finish. Not was I was hoping for at all, but willing to give this another try in the future.

2011 bottle poured into snifter. Has a winey and caramel aroma. Sweet brown sugar, caramel and dates on taste. Overall very delicious and has aged well

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2015 Wonderfully rich and complex aroma of... where to start? Dark malts, raisins, plum, candy sugar, yeast, chocolate, dried fruits, spices. Flavour is quite sweet, dried fruit, some alcohol. This is a beautifully complex and balanced brew, its reputation is well-deserved.
Svart med ljusbrunt skum! Doftar och smakar portvin, kaffe och choklad! Mycket kolsyra! Flaska från 2007 köpt i Danmark!
Mørk brun farve med beige skum. Lukt av anis, malt, karamell, frukt, whiskey og krydder. Smak av malt, karamell, frukt og krydder. Import.
God duft av lakris, rosin, vanilje og frukter. Mørk brun farge, nesten sort. Tynt dekkende brunt skum. Nydelig smak av lakris og karamell. God sittende ettersmak. nydelig desertøl.

2010 vintage. Dark brown with reddish hues with a brownish head that fades into nothing instantly. Superb combination of aromas including chai, dark robust cocoa, raisins, plums and some cigar notes. Almost full bodied, very low carbonation, plummy, dark candi, fruit cake, indian spices, finishing on a long cherry/chocolate finish with spices in the mix. Easy drinking quad. Never tought this could be posible... Really great stuff.
UPDATED: APR 6, 2014 Intensly dark and strong ale, rich aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, nuts, mokka, caramel and fruit.
Too much sugar for me... Pours dark cloudy brown with nice brown head. Aroma is malt, licorice, spices, slightly roasty., alcohol. A bit too sweet.
Cervesa rodona. Perfecta integració de maltes llúpols llevats, espècies I graduació alcohòlica.

Cerveja escura, espuma cor de creme e não muito persistente. De imediato um aroma de café, porém existem notas de ameixa e frutas secas no aroma. Sabor um pouco caramelado, uvas passas, ameixa e um pouco de café. Extremamente complexa, se nota muito pouco o álcool. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Foamed over upon opening. Bottle says 2007 ale brewed with spices. Huge immense plum, fig raisin smell. Thick surprisingly no carbonation given that it foamed over. Luscious and delicious dark, oakey, fruity, milk chocolatey. Incredible beer

Poured from a bootless it is a dark brown color with a flight head. The aroma is of Bourbon and a hint of anise. The taste is strong scotch whiskey flabor that lingers bitter on the palate with licorice overtones

Bottle at home - Color: deep black beer with no carbonation and small ivory head. Smell: malt, caramel and yeast. Taste: malty and caramel balance and high yeast taste. Aftertaste: small alcohol taste but not so strong with malt, caramel and some licorice.

33 cl, flaske, 10,0 % ABV, købt i Det Belgiske Ølhus på Jyllingevej i Vanløse, 28. februar 2014.
Brunlig og ibenholt-farvet ufiltreret belgisk Strong Ale med flygtig og minimal skumtop. Max 1/2 cm som lægger sig i kanten et par minutter efter ophældning. 
Kraftfuld sødlig aroma af lakrids, kaffe, tørret sødlig frugt, malt, belgisk gær, krydderier og meget andet. 
Voluminøs, vinøs og overlegen smag. Vanvittig kompleks med masser af sødme, krydderier og bitterhed i velspillet samspil. Læg dertil en lækker bitter afslutning med smag henad engelsk lakrids og kaffe. Lang eftersmag. 
Oveni lægges et rart tilrettelagt indhold af kulsyre, som bare fuldender en overvældende oplevelse. 
Har skrevet og sagt det før: Niveauet hos Struise Brouwers er bare astronomisk højt.

Aroma and flavour of rich molasses and maple syrup. Dangerously sweet and complex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Rose Red, Bruges. Pours dark cloudy brown with nice brown head. Aroma is malt, licorice, spices, slightly roasty. Flavor is malt, coffee, spices, licorice, alcohol. A bit too sweet.

Last of the Pannepot family tree Ive tried and it wasnt a disappointment. Aroma of light smoked malt with a dab of peat and black currant. Raisins and a great dose of Belgian floral yeast underlying everything. Pours black with great head and lacing. Finish is smokey and sweet with amazing balance. Really digging this one. Bottle.

Vintage 2011 - Pours a dark brown with a light brown 1/4 in fizzy head. Sweet of banana esters and bready yeast. Malty backbone and a slight hint of Belgian spiciness. The 10% abv. was definitely hidden in this tasty Belgian quad.
