Colour: hazy ruby brown. Aroma: spices, dried prunes. Taste: medium bitter-sweet body. Palate: dry, bitter-sweet finish, lively CO2. Overall: ok, probably too fresh. Needs to age more..

Escura quase preta com espuma creme de boa formação e persistência. No aroma, caramelo, frutas secas, chocolate amargo. Na boca, bom corpo, passas, torrado, com médio amargor dulçor equilibrado. Final curto e seco. Excelente! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAY 7, 2014 Bottle from the internets. Pours a dark dark brown with a ring of tan head. Aroma of dark fruits. Taste of raisins and bread. Masks the abv well.
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2014 Bottle. Dark black with tan head. Aroma of ripe raisins and spices. Taste of yeast and sweet dark fruit. Sweet aftertaste. Really great Belgium.

2010 bottle brought back from The Bottle Shop in Bruges. Pours a very dark rich opaque brown, small amount of tan head. Smells great. Lots of chocolate, malts, a little cinnamon. Now the taste; some booze, raisins, bread finishes with a little bitterness that turns into coffee. Very creamy mouthfeel. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016 Absoluut één van mijn lievelingsbieren. Donkerbruin, bijna zwart bier, met caramelachtige kraag die snel verdwijnt. Geuren van koffie, toffee, chocolade en bruine suiker. En zo smaakt hij ook. Zeer aromatisch bier die de perfectie benadert. Alcohol heeft nooit de bovenhand ondanks de 10 % promillage. Een absolute smaakbom en een bier die niet voor niets alom wordt geprezen !!

There is no such thing as perfection, but Pannepot comes pretty damn close. It starts with an astonishing aroma: caramel notes, dark fruits, maybe some cherry and sugar. Color is very dark with a head that doesnt last very long. Upon the first taste, the great complexity of this beer surfaces: cherry, raisin, dark chocolate, some coffee. The sweetness gets the upper hand, yet there is plenty of bitterness balancing this nicely. The body is very full with a slick texture and a long finish. To summarize, this is one of the best beers out there and if you can get a hold of it, do not hesitate! Cheers.

33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is malty, heavy yeasty, sweet, chocolate, alchool and light spicy. Great balance between the sweet and bitter in the flavor, moderate yeasty, alchool, Nice mouthfeel. Great!

Draft at Maxs Belgian Beer Festival. Pours dark brown with no head. Tastes like raisins, prunes, dried fruit. Dry feel, with bitterness, and a strong syrupy sweetness. Smells like sweet sugary raisins.

(Drinking date: 14 February 2014) Dark brown/black colour with small beige head which disappears quickly. It looks hazy. Sweet aroma of dark chocolate, alcohol and burned sugar. The aroma could be more overwhelming, but it is still nice. The taste is really really really delicious. You can compare it with the taste of Westvleteren 12, and I even prefer this one, the Pannepot. The taste is sweet, with a bit of liqorice and milk chocolate. Not really bitter. In the aftertaste there is a little bit of bitterness. The beer feels thick in the mouth, which I really like for this type of beer. The carbonation is flat to medium, also really good. Yes, I like this beer a lot. That?s why I give it the total score of 4.5!
33 cl bottle 2012 Vintage. Dark brown with a beige head. Roasted coffee, caramel dried fruits. Nice mouthfeel. Very nice beer.
Bière très complexe et riche en bouche. Alcool moyennement présent. Peu pétillante. Fruits rouges, café grillé. Excellent.

Pannepot 2011

Aroma - has dark fruit (figs, black cherry), caramelized sugar and alcohol, 
Appearance - the body is taupe in color, the liquid opaque, the head sadly not present save a tiny buff colored ring. Albeit there is no head to speak of it still has a beautiful glow about it.
Taste - the taste is excellently conceived - sweetness is the primary element with dark fruit (most notably fig, raisin, and black cherry), there is also alcohol, but its wave is held back - letting you enjoy the components of this really delightful brew. Incredibly complex and very subtle, its really enjoyable.
Palate - body is full, the texture almost chewy, slick, and thick. The carbonation is soft on the surface, average on the palate. The finish is medium in length with the soothing qualities of alcohol around the gums. Great feel. Warming as well

That is a really great beer. Sometimes, a highly praised beer hits all the marks, but isnt really that enjoyable - they can be a challenge. This beer has high billing and brings the goods. Subtle, complex, a sort of James Bond of beer. (Must try) BTW - this was a 2011

Pours dark brown. Full creamy head that settles into a nice half,inch head. Beautiful lacing left on glass. Taste of leather, caramel, vanilla and spice (anise?). Full body, chewy with medium carbonation. Excellent beer.

Amazing beer! Pours a dark brown color with a slight brown head. Aroma is really complex, hints of dried fruit, sweet. Complex taste: fruity, slight caramel and tiny bit of chocolate but really well balanced.

Shared a 33cl bottle from Mi-Orge Mi-Houblon. Pours a very dark brown colour with a tan head that turns into a creamy lacing. Aroma is licorice, caramel, spices and yeast. Soft carbonation and medium creamy oily body. Taste is a complex and balanced trip between medium bitter and medium sweet in various dimensions. Overall, a very good beverage that resembles more a digestive than a beer... but is a beer.

Bottle at home. 2011 Vintage. Pour is deep brown-managing with a frothy brown head and great lacing. Big caramelly, brown sugar, dark fruity, licorice, bready, slightly tangy, toffee, spice, and cherries in the aroma. Taste is candi sugar, raisins, plums, red grapes, Belgian spice, toffee, caramel, toasted bread, and wood with a lightly tangy finish - though not sour. Full body with medium carbobation. Very tasty Belgian strong.

This comes across like an amazing Imperial Stout. Very thick and heavy sweet malt taste with dates, plums, mild spice and coffee. All the flavours balance brilliantly. Thick and chewy in the mouth. Yum!

33cl bottle served in a trappist glass. One of my favorite beers of all time! The aroma is nice and the look is fair even though the head dissipates quickly. The brilliance is in the taste and feel though. Nice sweet, fruity and spicy flavour. I love it!

Pannepot 2013 
is a great beer. Dark color and abundant and persistent foam. The nose initially looks like a chocolate English and then give off hints of caramel and dried fruit, figs and banana, spices and coffee. The taste is sumptuous, with a tendency sweet balanced by a good acidity. The finish is long with a slight predominance of alcohol.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2014 (2011) small frothy light brown head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick dark reddish-brown body. aroma: moderate malt, mild coffee, raisin, ruby Port, alcohol. if: heavy sweet light bitter. ff: heavy sweet light acidic bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation, metallic light alcoholic finish. Aroma levemente metalizado no começo, depois some. Maravilhoso dulçor de frutas secas também lembra vinho do Porto. Leve amargor de café balanceia brilhantemente. Final traz levíssima acidez lembrando ameixa fresca e uva. O amargor de café a torna menos enjoativa que a torst front room. R27 370 s

jan 30th, 14 (2012) Essa Belgian Strong Ale belga tem espuma pequena, aerada e esbranquiçada, de reduzida longevidade. Moderada formação de colarinho. Corpo opaco, denso e marrom-ambarizado. Aroma: uva-passa, malte, álcool e madeira. Sabor inicial: moderado dulçor maltado e leve acidez. Sabor final: moderados dulçor e acidez; longa duração. Paladar: corpo médio-leve, textura aguada, forte carbonatação e final levemente adstringente. A acidez surgiu, para mim, como grande defeito (tal característica apareceu na Pannepot Reserva, mas não com a característica azeda desagradável, mas sim lembrando amoras frescas; este fato a faz infinitamente pior que a Reserva). Notei também uva-passa no paladar. Em termos gerais, essa cerveja foi uma grande decepção em relaçãoao que eu esperava. 20s
On tap @ t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Dark brown color, nice beige head. Smells little sweet. Sweet taste, little bitterness. Cant remember if the one from the bottle had same bitterness. Great beer.

33cl bottle at home. Very dark brown with a small off-white head which didnt last long. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Sweet with some spicy bitter tones. Prunes, caramel, raisins, spices, dried fruits and warming alcohol. A great complex beer with a very rich palet of tastes.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2014 33cl in a Trappist glass. Pours a very dark brown with very little light being able to travel through it. The head is nice and thick but does not last too long. Flavour - Where to start? The amount of flavours crammed into this beer is very impressive. Prunes, dates, spices, candy and yeast being the more obvious. Unfortunately, some examples I have tried have taken on the taste of vegetable extract but certainly not all. In my experience the 2013 beers have been better than 2012. The mouthfeel is otherworldly and almost creamy. Extremely nourishing and unique. Excellent

Great beer. Poured a dark brown, almost black. Off White two finger head. Aroma of caramel, molasses and figgy plums. A hint of a spice. The taste was pure delight. Caramel, burnt sugar, molasses, plums, figs, vinous notes. Maybe some other non descript dark fruits. Sweet, no hint of the alcohol. Slight hint of some "spices" that seem to have reserved themselves to currently being pleasant. This beer was great and it was a 2011 vintage. The body was tremendous as well. The only De Struise beer we get locally!
Bottle. 2011 Vintage. Pours dark brown with tan head. Aroma of strong fig, raisins, nuts. Has a medium to full body, lots of fig, great carbonation, touch of vanilla. Really good.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Jan 2014 - 2012 vintage, into Struise tulip.  Very dark red - black really, sparkling, small light brown head endures.  Smell - very yeasty up front.  When it settles its oversweet caramel, bread dough, metallic.  Body - medium, slightly foamy, lowish carbonation.  Taste - sweet caramel, red berries, background milky instant coffee.  Tart and sour notes in the finish.  Nice, but oversweet. (3.8)
Jun 2015 - 2009 vintage.  Thanks!  Aroma is appley.  Taste is solvent, soapy, spice.  Not bad.  Sweetness has dried out.  (3.4)
Jun 2015 - 2010 vintage.  Apple, caramel, molasses aroma.  Taste is molasses, alcohol, tangy spice.  Hasnt quite developed in the direction I hoped.  (3.4)

Deep dark black, thin espresso head goes fast. Medium strong malty sweet aroma has licorice, herbs, syrup, raisins. Oily rich palate, soft and round, bit sticky, low carbonation, sweet and slightly bitter, long syrup malty finish. Oily beer is rich in flavor and aroma and will keep your motor running even in those freezing winter nights.
Pannepot 2008 bevuta nel 2014,spaziale,una miriade di gusti che si intrecciano in unequilibrio perfetto,frutta secca,torbato,incantevole come quasi ogni prodotto Struise!

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2014 Notes: review of 2013 release. 
Colour: Dark brown, coffee-like with a beige head.
Nose: Dark cherry, raisins, plums, toast, coffee and spices. Very aromatic.
Flavours: espresso, vanilla syrup, chocolate, dark fruits, spices and herbs. Sweeter near the end. Coffee overtones remain.
Finish: Long, intense, mesmerizing and sweet. No indication of alcoholic content.
Verdict: Astonishing. One of the best ales ever made.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Look: opaque black with red highlights and a big beige/coffee creamy head with good retention. 
Aroma: starts quite simple - something between a caramel and coffee-flavoured lollipop and cheap sweet chocolate. As it warms up, it gets some alcohol or nail polish and some roasty/toasty malt notes too.
Taste: even better than the aroma - lightly acidic coffee roast, dried fruit sweetness and alcoholic/phenolic spice. not sure what and where the spices are.

What a great beer!

2011 bottle to taster. Very dark brown stout like pour. Aromas of dark fruits banana candy sugar. Taste is slightly sweet and slight boozy. Very clean smooth finish. Good stuff. Better than the Belgian quads Ive had.
Bottle. Poured dark brown with a quick off-white head. Initial aroma of milk chocolate that turned to dark fruits and brown sugar. Dark fruit flavor. Medium to full body.

330 ml bottle. Pours a ruby reddish deep brown with a resilient dark beige head. Aroma is coffee, roast, brown sugar. Flavor is a hint of fruits, lots of roasted grains, dry, hazelnut, brown sugar. Finish is earthy, with some burnt caramel. Lingering earth flavor. Medium to full body, soft, sticky mouthfeel, weak to average carbonation.

Bottle kindly shared by Cuso, thank you! 2006 vintage, so this was aged approximately 7 years at the time of drinking. Aroma chocolate, plums, fruity, light sting of alcohol-spices-sourness. Dark brown colour. Taste is very rich, initially sweet, fruity, raisins, berries, chocolate. Then alcohol kicks in. Waming, but pleasurable. Full body. Finish chocolate, moderate duration. Really nice experience. I would like to revisit this someday in the future.

Spicy aroma, that dissapoints a little in the first smell. Until you taste: immediately rich. Complex sweets and spices, some coffee, fresh, fruits. Delicious. Highly recommended.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought at Malting pot in Brussels. Strong slight over bearing dark ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a large brown head. Very dark chestnut brown appearance. Very hazy. Rich aroma of yeast, malts, dark fruits, spices and some coffee. Spicy, yeasty taste. Hints of cinnamon, malts, nuts, dark fruits, coffee, wood, brown sugar and a little bit of hops. Long smooth spicy aftertaste. Oily texture. Very good beer.
Alcoholic and caramel malty aromas. Tastes sweet in a very correct way and a little spicy. Simply the best!

Vintage 2009. Prawie perfekcyjne piwo. Wspanialy aromat czekolady, sliwek i orzechow. W smaku jak sherry, porto, malaga i to wszystko podlane gesta goraca czekolada. Dlugi posmak slodko wytrawny. Troche moze lekka alkoholowa nuta ale wytrawna koncowka. Cos super smacznego, wielbiciele Belgijskich mocnych ale beda zadowoleni. Niewielkim minusem byla niewielka piana ale kolor prawie czarny i gesty. Po 5 latach starzenia osad ciezko bylo oderwac od dna. Polecam
Bottle from Astoria bier and cheese in a tulip glass. Very hard to find in nyc. Very thin tan head, chocolate appearance. Ive been looking for this one for ages but it was well worth it.

Bottle, 2013. Pours a portery black with limited tan head. Aroma of spice and alcohol. Tastes spicy and rich rich caramel, with alcohol well hidden, and sweetness building. Mouthfeel is excellent,with initial carbonation giving way to a deep smoothness. Aftertaste of sweet, christmassy malt and spices grows as you drink. This beer is like a cross between a porter and a Belgian Christmas ale.

11.2oz bottle (2006 vintage) shared by dmac. I really think Dave is trying to kill me by serving me all his old expired beer. I'm pretty sure he wants to keep my lifeless dead body in his basement, so he always has a friend, since it seems like no one ever wants to hang out with him. So a 2006 Pannepot pours a deep dark murky brown color with no head. Aroma of sour cherries, lots of caramel, cardboard, and some Belgian spice. Taste of light roasted malts, sweet dark fruits, caramel, tart black cherries, cardboard, and oxidation.

Bottle. Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma of molasses, roasted malts, and dark fruit. Medium body with malt sweetness and notes of chocolate, dark fruits, and a hint of toffee. The alcohol is well hidden.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2014 Drink this beer It?s the third time, but there are variations of each can to bottle this beer, but Meguriae the good thing is the very possible this time. It was delicious to the highest great Kaorigashi, even try to drink from the moment you take off the plug. To taste delicious luxury too, it has become a captive of this beer.

2012 330ml bottle into a De Struise tulip and consumed straight after Christmas pudding. Aroma is toffee, slight roasted coffee, dark chocolate. Taste is amazing. Caramel, coffee, dark chocolate, coriander, orange zest, treacle, with a very light citrus sourness. So much depth & complexity. Medium bodied. I've had this a few times before and can say that it gets even better after a few years. I've found 5 years age works really well and introduces some incredible port-like characteristics. Definitely one of my favorites.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Trembling Madness Bottle Shop, York. Darkest darkness. Film of beige head. I very much doubt I can add anything that hasnt already been said. Its Christmas Eve, and this, with a slice of the Missus Christmas cake is proving the dogs arse. Which is a good thing.

Wow. This beer is complex, with some stouty characteristics, but quite Belgiany. Very strong candi aroma, with some roastiness and a lot of pear, apricot and dark fruits. Very balanced. Should get better with age.
Pours a dark amber with aromas of malt and sweet dark fruits. Flavors are the same doesnt taste like 10% abv, a great beer that could be drunk everyday.

Aroma: Sweet, roasted malt, dried dark fruits, slight hint of alcohol Appearance: Nice lingering lace, beige, fine bubbles Taste: Coffee, liquorice, dark dried fruits, some booze. Definitely my favourite beer at the moment - 2011 version!
Bottiglia. Splendido colore tonaca di frate, frutta rossa matura. Fantastica maltosità, gusto in continua evoluzione. Birra da comprare e degustare dopo svariati anni.

Appearance: 2013 version. Very dark brown, nice dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, wild berries, chocolate.
Taste: Nice malt and fruit, slight alcohol. Winter warmer.
Info: 330ml bottle, 21/12-2013, BB: 31/12-2018

2011 bottle @Party Source. Opaque brown-black with a tan partial head cover, no lace. Taste is very sweet toasted malt with a strong addition in the palate of fruit cake fruit and semi-sweet toffee. I also taste light mown hay and earth. The finish includes unflavored bittering, some carbonation, and alcohol warmth that lasts well beyond what is already a long finish. I can imagine this soothing the spirit on cold nights on the water. Good stuff!

Shared 33 cl bottle. Pours dark brown with some head. Aroma is sweet malty with some chocolate and raisins. Taste is again sweet with cocoa, figs, raisins and some vanilla. The high abv is well hidden.

Bottle from Kaufmanized, he sent me as win from his charity LIF. Vintage 2006  Brown color with creamy beige head. Aroma of plums, coffee, chocolate, raisins, caramel. Taste, dark malt, prunes, plum jam, milk chocolate, raisins, alcohol.Taste is milk chocolate, plums, raisins, alcohol, warming. Long sweet finish. Extra nice beer.

Bottle, courtesy of Cuso, year 2006, many many thanks. Pours brown color, beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, red berries, raisin, sweet. Taste is milk chocolate, plums, raisins, alcohol, warming. Extra nice beer.
Bottle by Cuso, many thanks! Bottled in 2006. Yeah! Smooth, mild, sweet fruits. It reminds me of marmalades, raisins, some chocolate. Overall a delicacy!

Poured from bottle. Aroma: chocolate, prunes. Full body, creamy texture, warming alcohol. Flavor: mature fruits, prunes, chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is in my option depending upon the year one of the best beers in the world. I first had the 2006 which floored me the 2007 wasn't the same until it aged five years, the 2011 is very nice in its youth. In fact it converted a German friend to Belgium beers. He was amazed that their beers could be so good while their Futbol team was so bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Tap at Beer Revolution, Oakland. Colour is deep dark read with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, some sourness, some sweetness.
Bottle 0.75l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Vintage 2016. Colour is deep reddish brown with very small white head. Aromas and flavors: Dark fruits, plums, some sweetness and malts. Very interesting. Points 3.4 are ok.

Dark brown pour with a big tan head, and lots of floaties at the bottom of the glass. Aroma of carmel, coffee malts, dark fruits, and baked bread. Taste is very rich and robust, with the sweet, but roasted malts coming thru. A mighty big beer in a small bottle. 2011 date. Love this style of beer. Enjoyed!
UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 2011 bottle. Great fruity aromas. Really complex flavors, fruit and caramel. Sweet but not too much. Really good stuff.

Bottle at Avenue Pub, New Orleans
AROMA: dark fruits, spices (nutmeg?), chocolate, brown sugar
APPEARANCE: black, frothy
PALATE: full body, oily feel, lively, astringent, bitter, long finish, 
OVERALL: complex aromas, one to savour, spicy notes blend well with fruit.

Cerveza strong ale. Color marrón muy oscuro, capa de espuma muy ligera, pero cremosa. Olor dulce, achocolatado y toque de café. En boca tiene notas de caramelo, café y vainilla (entre otros). El alcohol se hace notar, si bien lo compensa con el sabor. El final es seco.

2011, 11.2oz. bottle that pours dark brown. Rich aromas of prunes, and sweet dark fruits. Brown sugar, molasses, rasins, prunes, many layers of flavors. Also followed by cherries. Quite complex and chewy. Wonderful mix of a lite sweetness along with some tartness, and dryness in the finish.

Pours dark nutty brown with a small ring. Aroma is roasted and spicy. Flavor is hot and spiced with good sweetness, very balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours dark brown with light brownish head. 
Aroma dark fruits, caramel, candi, spice, roasted malts, coffee, 
Taste caramel fruity sweet, coffee but fresh bitter, some peppery spice in the aftertaste. 
Mouth-feel Creamy. 
Amazing beer. Great complex taste and nose.

Bottle, sample, 4-ounce, 2011 vintage, during the Bières et saveurs, savoured on August 30 2013; eye: dark brown, semi-opaque, tiny ring of tan head, no lacing; nose: roasted malt, plum, toffee, light alcohol, yeasts, light brown sugar, light molasses; mouth: roasted malt, plum, toffee, light alcohol, yeasts, light brown sugar, light molasses, slight pepper, finale in malt with presence of yeasts, medium-full body, average carbonation, light liqueur-like texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Bouteille, échantillon, 4 onces, millésime 2011, lors du Bières et saveurs, savourée le 30 août 2013
il : brun foncé, semi-opaque, petit anneau de mousse fauve, pas de dentelle; nez : malt torréfié, prune, toffee, léger alcool, levures, léger cassonade, léger mélasse; bouche : malt torréfié, prune, toffee, léger alcool, levures, léger cassonade, léger mélasse, très léger poivre, finale en malt avec présence de levures, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation moyenne, texture légèrement liquoreuse; en résumé : bien

From 33cl bottle. Pours a creamy deep but lively brown, with a swirling tan head. Herbs, grains and sweetness on the nose, almost akvavit-like. Velvety taste, lots of soft caramel and toasty coffee. Remarkably fresh, veering on an oyster stout. Long, bittersweet finish. Real pleasure.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, chocolate, coffee, toast, alcohol, woody, brown, black, clear, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, lively, long finish,

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2013 What a wonderful brew. It looks pretty, dark brown with a creamy tan head. The aroma has some caramel and fruit. The flavor is sweet with the caramel and fruit. I detect a touch of oak. The beer is extremely smooth with a creamy feel. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2014 One of the best. Rich full flavor of dried fruits and some dark chocolate. Long bittersweet finish. Deep dark with almost no head but there is enough carbonation. I had the 2013 batch.

330m ml bottle, very fruity in the nose, there are some serious flavours here, cherry, strawberry, apple, blackberry, red grape topped with caramel. The palate is thick and oily. Carbonation is low. Finish is quite sweet but there is some hop balance. This is an intense beer!

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2015 2013. Very dark brown, beige head that leaves and island of big bubbles. Bubblegum, pear, banana, strawberries. Roasted malts, hint of coffee. After it has sat in the glass while it gets more complext. Caramel, toffee, Taste is weet with a tart touch. Alcohol is very noticable. Mouth is medium full, average carbonation. Very enjoyable complex beer.
2014: a bit more sour with red berries and red wine. Not as great but still very good.

# 2011.
Marrón oscura, casi negra, con una espuma esponjosa y finísima que desaparece poco a poco.
Aroma no muy intenso a fruta madura y ciruelas pasas.
Ligera, con pequeñas burbujas.
En boca dulzona (en un sentido no despectivo), con presencia del chocolate y la fruta. Deliciada, muy suave. Alcohol muy bien integrado. Cervezón.
Riktigt bra Belgian Strong Ale. Kraftig smak, mycket välbalanserad. Jästen visar sig fint också

Aroma of treacle, stewed fruit, blackcurrents or maybe red berries. Cherries.Theres banana in there somewhere too, but theres a lot going on in there, fruit-wise. 
Thick consistency in the pour. The colour of strong, black coffee. Only light carbonation and head which is light tan. Sticky mouthfeel.
Subtle and lingering tart bitterness behind all the sweet malt and caramel. But not quite sour. Kind of like a green apple, but without the apple flavour. The sweetness lasts longer in the aftertaste. The alcohol is hard to detect.
Yeah, theres definitely banana in there somewhere.... Damn, its all gone.

Caramel, coffee, berries, black and hazy, small, long lasting tanned foam, dark chocolate in taste, medium sweet, light bitterness, full body, quite thick feel, rather soft carbonation, long bittersweet (more sweet) finish, alcohol unnoticeable, Overall: great beer, plain and simple
Cervesa extraordinària. Aromes molt complexes on shi pot trobar de tot. Recomanable per la darrera tanda

Det är väldigt svårt att bedömma en öl som man vet att många andra högaktar, det är vansinnigt lätt att hänga med i andra människors glädjerus. Smaken i sig var komplex med toner av russin, choklad och råsocker. Kroppen var stabil och balansen var fulländad och såhär i efterhand kan jag konstatera att den här ölen verkligen är värd sitt höga betyg.

Ampolla
Aparença: Al servirla el color força fos, lescuma és marró, molt cremosa i es manté.
Aroma: Fort olor dolç, chocolata, inclús vainilla. 
Sabor: El sabor com una imperial stout, molt bona, amb sabors a xocolata, amarga i amb notes afruitades. 
La primera impressió és de dolçor, però et deixar en boca uns tocs amargs molt ben compensats. Sens dubte una molt bona cervesa.

Light brown creamy head. Dark brown colour. Aroma is malty with coffee, red fruits, chocolate and light sour and wood notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (cherry) and light sour tones, ending in a moderately fruity finish. Full bodied.

Bottle. Dark cloudy brown color. Raisen, fig, and pine nuts aroma with a medium body and long dried cherry sweet finish. Some smoke also finds it?s way in after it sits on your palate for a little bit. This is a very layered beer that is enjoyable to experience as it opens up over time. I suggest you drink it low and let the smoke build and layer itself back into the rich sweet of the initial nose experience.

Appearance: uncapped bottle left to warm a bit produced a foamy column popping out of the top; proper pour was dark and thick, cola brown, with a creamy light tan head that lasts in spite of the high abv.  Aroma: 	strong nose of molasses, clove, candi sugar, cherry, raisin, chocolate, toasted almonds, leather, and slight kelp.  Taste: sweet and boozy-tasting (but without a boozy burn), with gingerbread, molasses, dark corn syrup, yeast, clove, cinnamon, prunes in heavy syrup, cardamom, allspice, nutmeg, coffee, and slightly burnt cardboard.  Finish: lingering sweetness, with chocolate, leather, and raisin notes most prominent; alcohol remains well-hidden save for a hint of warmth. Notes: 	Quite a good strong ale. Rich and complex with a full body that, while requiring sipping for full enjoyment, isnt off-putting in its richness. Not quite as balanced as, say, a Westy 12, but still very nice.

I can imagine being an old salty dog and fishing all day. Then coming back to the pub and having one of these. Aromas of chocolate cookie almonds and cherries. Flavor big dark cherry. Big bitter dark coffee dark fruits figs dates raisins. Spme funk and wood. Personally I dont care for the cherry. A little more would be nice. More of a Stouties type ale. 100 points........I think not.

330 ml bottle into chalice, 2011 vintage. Pours very cloudy nearly opaque reddish brown color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings to the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big plum, raisin, fig, pear, apple, banana, caramel, toast, candi sugar, molasses, clove, pepper, coriander, light chocolate, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with great complexity and balance of malt, spice, yeast esters with a great malt/ester balance; and great strength. Taste of big plum, raisin, fig, pear, apple, banana, caramel, molasses, toast, brown bread, chocolate, clove, pepper, candi sugar, light roast, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of dark/light fruits, caramel, molasses, toast, brown bread, chocolate, candi sugar, clove, pepper, light roast, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, balance, and robustness of fruity/spicy yeast and dark malt flavors with big robustness; great malt/yeast flavor balance, and zero cloying sweetness on the finish. Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a very slick and lightly syrupy mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible Belgian strong dark ale! All around fantastic complexity, balance, and robustness of yeast, malt, and spice flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. An insanely delicious offering.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 A deep red beer with a huge brown head. The aroma is sweet spicy with notes of ginger and caramel. The flavor is very sweet and again with notes of spices and caramel.

Bottled. Mahogany colour, rich head. Aroma of red berries. Sweet, lightly roasty and rather vinous. Richly malty with velvetty soft mouthfeel. Powerful, yet balanced. A full bodied, intensely aromatic world class beer.

Bottle of 2011 Vintage. Pours a dark brownish crimson color with a half-inch of tan foam. Sharp notes of Belgian yeast, candi sugar, dark fruits and sherry in the aroma. The flavor starts with dark caramelized sugars, red wine and black cherry upfront leading to prune, fig, chocolate and clove. Mouthfeel is silky smooth and full-bodied with soft carbonation and a tart, alcohol-warming finish. Deservedly one of the great Belgian ales.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 Had a 2011 Pannepot. Simply delicious. Looks great. Awesome sweet smell. Delicious coffee, chocolate and vanilla taste.Update 30-11: Yesterday I shared a 2004 and a 2007 bottle. Genius! Especially the 2007. The 2004 lost too much carbonation and really began to taste like port. Rating is based on 2013 version. Edit: drank a 2013 bottle yesterday (24-4-2015), rated slightly higher after that.

Blistering barnicles! I was not expcting this to be so fufilling, but the overall totality of the beer is impressive, a leatherly, slightly sweet swell, and dark opaque hue with a lingering brown swirl of cirrus head. medium sweetness, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, mellow finish like fig. Ahoy! When do we set sail?

Schwarz, hellbeiger luftiger schaum, intensives aroma bach dunklen beeren/früchte, leichte alkoholnote, antrunk und geschmack sehr beerig, süsslich, feinherb, geringere rezenz

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
11oz bottle from 2011 pours a dark brown/black with zero head. Big oak barrel and vanilla taste. Oak caramel and leather aroma.

Dark Brown with à thin head. Aroma of dark fruits and spices. Very nice, though I prefer the reserva. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2006 Bottle. 

A: Pours a oily, placid dark brown (bordering on mahogany) that miraculously develops a quarter inch of off white head. 

N: Hearty raisin, prune, clove, esters, hint of oxidation, brown sugar, walnut, metal. 

T: Soured with a basic sweetness. Oxidation is evident as well. Apparently this hasnt aged too well. 

M: Lighter with a hefty amount of carbonation. 

O: Probably infected unless the yeast in this went wild. Will end up re-reviewing a fresher bottle. Its not bad, persay, but it certainly isnt what youd expect.
Black with a creamy brown head - Sweet malt aroma - Very good sweet malt body vith a very good and smooth taste - Lingering malt finsih that lasts for a long time - This was extremely good -

Tap at Borefts 13
Very dark bron colour on the body, almost black. Thin beige head with okay retention. Light lacing on the glass.
Great aroma, sweet, black berries, toffee, plums, dates. 
Taste is sweet, again black berries, brown sugar, dark fruits but not that heavy, the alcohol masterfully hidden. This beer tastes like a sweet pie, as someone else wrote, a desset in a bottle. Great!
Medium thick body, good carbonation.
Really enjoyed this one, Ill look around for a bottle.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... 2007 vintage... Amazingly aromatic, I can smell the beer without it being even close to my nose... Sweet sugary nose, brown black in color... Nice tannish head... Very sweet brown sugar flavor, tastes like dessert in a bottle... Not very yeasty like a lot of the other Belgians... Not much bitterness, finish is sugary on the palate... Dates are very prevalent... Can't taste the alcohol but you can sense it is there, phenomenal beer, right there with the westvletern 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Monks Struise bar / whiskey paradise.
No head. Dark black/ brown color. Small sweet aroma of red forrest fruit and chocolats. Chocolate taste well blended with belgian taste. Small bitterness and fine firm body.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Bottiglia 2010. Limpido color mogano scuro con uno strato di schiuma beige mediamente persistente. Sentori di toffee, uvetta, prugne, malto, spezie e lievito; gusto dolciastro con note maltose di frutta passita e un delicato retrogusto acidulo, nel finale compare invece la liquirizia. Corpo medio-abbondante, effervescenza gentile, vellutata al palato: una strong ale di gran carattere ma che non mi appassiona al 100%.
Esto es una gran cerveza, qué decir, compleja, especiada, afrutada, dulzona y muy, muy redonda. Riquísima.

@Hopduvel, Gent
zwart met minimale bruine kraag
aroma: moutig, zoet, chocolade, koffie, caramout, deeg, rozijnen, banaan, donker fruit
smaken: redelijk bruine suiker zoet, zwak bitter, sterk, redelijk fruitig (donker fruit), rozijn, banaan, Belgisch gist, redelijk gemout, matig kruidig
volle body, romig, met heerlijke zachte smaken, super complexiteit, fantastisch bier !
Bottle tried at Cafe Buitenlust Oirschot. Dark brown color. Nice flavors of malts and dark fruits like plums and raisins. Full body, medium carbonation.

Crystal clear, deep copper, 
Medium body but intense flavors,
Bitter-sweet, almost like a sour or fruit beer, syrupy, 
Flavors remind mace, pomegranate, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Pours a brown-black colour with a big beige foamy head, that quickly disappears. Nose has chocolate, coffee, caramel, raisins and plums to it. Taste is complex but nicely round and soft: again, chocolate, coffee, dried fruits are distinguishable, but theres also a refreshing hoppy sourness and just a little bitterness in the aftertaste. Low carbonation and thick body. Exceptionally balanced beer!

Bottle. Pours cola colored with a 1 thin tan head. Aroma is candi sugar, chocolate, dark fruit and nuts. Taste is dark fruits, chocolate, a touch of roasted malt, bread and apples. Palate is perfect. Full and creamy but still delicate. This is deservedly called one of the best.

Poured from a 33cl bottle into a standard glass

Overall: One of the best tasting beers I have ever had. The appearance was a little underwhelming, but this was a nearly perfect beer otherwise.

Appearance: deep brown. very little head.

Aroma: Raisin, spice, chocolate, floral, very complex and wonderful.

Taste: Extremely well balanced. warm alcohol. 

Palate: Very rich. Long finish. Heavy body.

Quite dark, almost opaque with a short-lived light brown head. Almost like coke in appearance. Smells fruity, mostly of dried prunes and raisins & also slightly yeasty. Taste is malt and dried fruit, with a clinging sweetness and no bitterness. Alcoholic warmth and very thick silky texture with carbonation on the low side.

330ml bottle nursed at home. 2011 vintage. Pours black brown with a good tan head. Starts big, fades but stays. Aromas of dark sugar, eastern spices, leather, liquorice, and prunes. Something creamy too. Taste has more spice, more dark sugar, then something metallic creeping in, and a boozy note. Bit sticky on the palate, soft carbonation. Long finish though. A very interesting beer.

Dark actually black beer with a dark malt coloured head. On the nose you got predominant aromas of candy/rock sugar but you can notice things like wild herbs and sweet malts. Pretty full bodied beer, light oily; tasting bitter sweet in a lovely balance! The finish predominantly holds the bitterness but in a pleasant way and last for quite some time.

Bouteille de 33cl "2012". Couleur presque noire, opaque, mousse moyenne de tenue assez faible. Très puissante aromatiquement, on trouve du pruneau, de la datte, de la réglisse, du caramel, du sirop pour la toux (!) et peut être une très légère fumure. Lalcool est bien masqué, le goût est sucré. La carbonnation est peut être un peu faible. Trouvée à Roby - Menin.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2013 Bottle of 2011 vintage. Pours dark red-black, with a tan head that reduces quickly to almost nothing. Nose is chocolate roasted malts, dark & red fruits, some liquorice but not much. More nuttiness as it warms. Mouth is sweet and malty, coffee and chocolate with some leather, but also prunes, cherries and raisins to give it a fruitiness. Yet its still a restrained sweetness with spiciness there too. The finish is medium-to-long and quite umami. Medium body and low-medium carbonation. This is really delicious.

Bottle 0.33l at Herman Berlin. Pours black with a beige head. Head disappears rather quickly. Aroma is very heavy with prunes and spices. Medium to low carbonation. Taste is extremely complex. Prunes, rum, molasses and undefined spices. Very oily mouthfeel. Alcohol is lingering in the background. Heavy stuff.

Tasted at the café t Brugs Beertje. Light brown creamy head. Dark brown colour. Aroma is malty with coffee, red fruits, chocolate and light sour and wood notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (cherry) and light sour tones, ending in a moderately fruity finish. Full bodied.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 Bottle (2011), for rating #300. Pours dark reddish-brown with tan head, decent retention. Aroma of dark fruit, cardboard, chocolate and cherries. Taste: a mix of dark fruits -- complex assortment of cherries, plums, figs, dates, complete with some tootsie rolls and leather. Generally sweet, but not cloying, with the sweetness dropping off a lot on the end. Some oxidation as well. Full body, smooth, soft to average carbonation. Overall: Quite nice, though somehow I built up my expectations for this to an unreasonable level. Will re-evaluate again on the next bottle.   the next bottle has been had, and this deserves a bump from the original 3.9. Lovely beer. That is all.
Bottle A: licorice, brown sugar, caramel, dattes. App: hazy brown beige head. T/p full body medium long sweet finish. O: amazing loves the different level of sweetness.

On tap at Schouskjelleren in Oslo. It was a dark pour with a tan head. The aroma was boozy with a surprise hint of bubblegum?! Freaky, the taste was licorice, cherries, sweet malts & esters. Full bodied & complex. Kind of port of sherry like with a bit of a sweet sugary candy vibe to it.

33cl bottle, served in Trappist glass. Pours deep dark brown, almost black, with medium beige head. Exellent appearence. The aroma is not very intense, but nice: malts, licorince, candy, cake...The taste is roasted malts, toffee and fruits. Maybe also a slight touch of chocolate and grape, so complex. Sugary palate, not cloying at all though. Zero alcohol presence despite its 10% ABV. Creamy mouthfeel, perfect carbonation. Incredibly smooth and well balanced.

Very interesting and complex. Strong spicy malt aromas. As with most Struise products, the alcohol is well-hidden. Weighty palate with a creaminess and the right amount of carbonation. This was a 2011 edition. Dark red and brown color with a small head. Strong flavors of wood, dark malts, grape, raisin and spices. Very balanced and good before bed.
Vintage 2011: Doft av torkad frukt, anis-salmiak. Tokbalanserad och mjuk med lång ihållande eftersmak. Smaker jag upplever är övermogen frukt, soja och salmiak. Fint hantverk!
The beer I´ve chosen to celebrate the birth of my two sons. Two years between them, two years of loyalty to the pannepots. Spice in the perfect size.

Bottle - Vintage 2007 - Mollases, anise, prunes and dark fruits. Black/brown with almost no head. Sour cherry, prunes, brown sugar and dark fruit. The sourness has me believe this beer is past its prime, but still enjoyable.
2011 Bottle shared with a few. Dark color. Very quad like. Tried this at the same time as Westy 12, St. Berny and Roche 10. Came in 3rd place in a blind test with Roche 10 winning.

HERE WE GO NOW! 2011 vintage. Dark brown pour some tan head that thins. As I poured the last bit out it was all foam. Aroma of strong leather, caramel, lactic, slight spice, coffee roasts. Tastes strongly of belgian yeast. Raisins, chocolate, roasts, and lactic flavors make up the background. Im going to let this one warm up a bit more. Firm carbonation. Sweet, but avoids overdoing it like most quads do.  Only slightly heavier than mid mouthfeel = not too heavy. Alcohol is hidden. Im going to think of it as refreshing raisin bread water.

2011 vintage bottle provided by Adam Jackson. Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma is raisins, caramel, dark fruits ( plums and figs) and leather. Very complex flavors. Caramel, toffee, traces of chocolate with the above dark fruits, figs, plums, dates. Mouthfeel, is still has light fizzy carbonation and remains soft. The flavor is very sweet but not cloying. No alcohol to be found. Very nice brew but not my favorite in style by far.

Tastes of dark candy sugar, slightly reminiscent of coca cola. Pours with a thick, foamy, tan head that soon diminishes to a light lacing. Aroma is similar to flavor. Some coffee style flavors and roasty bitterness. Wonderful, dark, belgian ale.

2011 bottle.
Appearance: The body is clear with a deep chestnut to garnet hue, opaque through the center with a short tan head that dissipates into a foamy ring with a sparse coating.
Aroma: The aroma is restrained, but has brown sugar, cherry and fig notes with a slight medicinal presence.
Taste: Fruity right away with a grape flavor that transforms into fig then into green apple before finishing as grape. Malts are very weak with caramel and hints of brown sugar while a medicinal flavor finishes out the beer matching the grape on the finish. Odd.
Palate: Like a watery syrup, think Robotussin instead of Nyquil, with mild carbonation.
Overall: I guess this just hasnt held up to age. This tastes watery, like something is missing. I wish we could get this fresh still, but Shelton has pulled out of NJ.

2011 - Dark ruby black with a tiny brown head. Aroma of dark dried fruit. Once it hits your mouth flavors explode everywhere. Raisins, prunes, burnt bananas, hazelnuts, all held together with some mellow brown sugar sweetness. That big taste finishes kind of quick with some hazelnuts and burnt chocolate, lingers nicely. Excellent deep complex beer.

Bottle from vintage estates. Pours a deep dark brown with a full tan head. Aromas of dark fruits, coffee, alcohol, some chocolate. Tastes like raisins at the front end followed by coffee on the back end. Very complex flavor. Not my typical style but I can appreciate this one.

11.2oz bottle (2011) - pours dark brown with khaki head and decent lacing. Nose is brown sugar, toffee, and butterscotch. Flavor adds nuts, earthy notes, alcohol, and some coffee. Quite sweet. Slightly burnt aftertaste. Almost flat. If I could Id give the palate a six. Glad I tried it, but not worth the $6.99 USD.
Pour is blackish with tan head..Nose is roast, spice, chewy, toffee...Taste is Spice, roast, chocolate, nice fudge, dry..

Bottle from Happy Harrys. Pours coca-cola brown with a thin khaki head. Doesnt leave a lot of lacing in the glass. Brown sugar and dark fruits on the nose. Rich and fragrant and bready on the tongue. Hides its alcohol well. Fantastic after dinner treat or works for breakfast as well.

2011 Bottle: Dark brown opaque color with small tan head and no lacing. Aroma is all malt with just a hint of sweet deep fruits and some woodyness. Aromas a bit weak to be honest, but still okay. Flavor is smooooth caramel, chocolate, cocoa malts. Zero alcohol presence- just all goodness. Big body, slightly oily mouthfeel with minimal carbonation. This is pretty amazing.

Bottle 33 cl, vintage 2012, BBE 31.12.2017. Pours dark brown in color with foamy tan head. Sweet dark 

bready notes, plums, wooden notes and slightly vinous notes in aroma. Feels very complex so far. Just a 

bit of dark fruity sweetness, light wooden notes and hints of vinous cherry-liqour in taste. Smooth and 

enjoyable to drink, even if is a bit sticky from time to time. Full, round and warming feeling with a 

vinous and sweetish touch towards the finish. Outstanding sipper.

Jet black with a tan head that disappears quickly. Aroma - raisins, dark fruit, rum, liquorice, vanilla, molasses. More lively mouthfeel than expected. Taste has fruits and spice and a short bitterness.

2011. Dark mahogany with big, foamy, brown head, decent lacing / Rich nose of dark fruit, chocolate, roast grain, caramel, citrus / Full body, lively, rich, somewhat sweet & syrupy, but with excellent balance with bitter finish underneath it all / Rich, complex flavors of caramel, prune, fig, cherry, brown sugar, licorice, chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon / Awesome.
Millésime 2012. Nez très sucre candy et épicé. Bouche à l?attaque onctueuse, notes de café et de caramel salé. Finale très épicée et longue.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2017 OLD: My first Struise and thus the beginning of a love that lingers to this very day. Drink this beer, its awesome. Update: this beer has become less complex over the years, would give it a 3.9 or 4 now, rating is for the old bottles.
2010 vintage, pours bubbly dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma is dark fruits and raisins.. Taste is smooth, rich, great body, awesome beer!

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 Nice sexy black appearance with light brown head. Aroma is spice, yeast, some funk, raisins, red fruit. Full mouthfeel with some fruit and low carbonation. Wow! Aftertaste is unique! Some hops,spice, coffee( in a belgian? Awsome!), dark malts. Overall: surprises in every factor of this beer. Very easy to drink, perfect balance

Draft at Sybarite Pig. Tulip. Pours a deep amber with almost no head. No lacing. Aroma is raisins, dark fruits, plums. Taste is similar with bread and malts. Smooth mouth, low carbonation, dry finish. Cant believe its 10%. Masked very well. Very very good.

Bubblegum, banana, cinnamon, a little alcohol, and toasted almonds aromas. No head, light carbonation, slightly thick syrupy mouth, very mild aftertaste and subtly warm going down.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
toast, caramel, raisin, and great pour at Against the Grain in Louisville serve as a mask to a sour aftertaste that lingers well
Bubblegum aroma with some gumball flavor. Somewhat boozy with hints of toast. Restrained hops and modest sweetness with body.

Aroma: excelente, chocolate, cafe, oporto
Sabor: similar a aroma. 
Paladar: mucho cuerpo. Llena la boca.
Apariencia: oscura casi negra. Poca espuma
Overall: excelente birra. Muy tomable pero a paso lento. Licorosa. Parece una muy buena imperial stout

2012. Nose is apricot, toffee. figs, candy sugar, light smoke emerging vinous notes. Taste is lactose, dark fruits, light chocolate, toffee, caramel, slight mint, spice and pepper in the finish. Mouthfeel is silky. 

Absolute smasher of a beer. Need to try some older noes.
Whouaaaa amazing. Not as complex as W XII . A much more smooth beer. Where is the alcohol? Dried fruit ,caramel (not over powering). A bit of coffee. Perfect blend

Purchased at Discount Liquors in Milwaukee, WI; enjoyed at home on a humid early July Saturday afternoon. 2011 version. Appearance is a very dark plum brown with a thin off white / tan head that rims around the glass, looks great in a snifter. Aroma is rich in grapes, plums, figs, a touch of chocolate, also smells a bit like a sherry, really interesting and great aroma. Taste is rather filling with moderate carbonation, great mouthfeel, syrupy and sweet with dark fruit notes as well as a bit of chocolate, tastes rather decadent but still easy to drink. This is really fantastic stuff.

2008 vintage thanks to t0rin0! The best beer of this style that Ive had. Dark pour with thin head. Smells and tastes of oak and cherry. Great lingering aftertaste. One of the smoothest 10% beers imaginable. Never had it fresh but the 5 year old version is outstanding.

Truly world class. Holy shiznit. Plum, toffee, and brown sugar espresso. Perfect mouthfeel and long complex finishes that dances on the tongue. The 10 percent abv is completely hidden. There are not that many beers where it is worth the time for a seasoned beer geek to actively seek it out, this is one of them.

Pours deep cola brown with smallish tan head diminishing. Aromas of figs, plums, caramel, burnt toffee, sweet chocolate and pitted fruits. Medium body, chewy mouthfeel, dark chocolate, caramel, sweet toffee, figs. Spicy notes accentuated towards the finish by the above average carbonation, finishing milky sweet, creamy, complex.

2007. Brune opaque un peu plus foncé que la grand reserva. 
Nez sucré. Caramel. Toffee. Banane. Épice. Cerise. Malt. Café. Très sucré. Malté-caramel. Bonbon. Liquoreux. Anis. Girofle. Délicieux.

I have had this beer for awhile! Pours a very dark brown color with a lighter brown head. Smells of chocolate and caramel. Sort of like a chocolate bar. Taste is quite sweet! Might partly be because i have had it for so long. Little bitterness at the finish.

Nice aroma, appearance results in a nice dark color with not much scum. Taste is interesting with caramel flavour and the final spicy touch. A great beer that I would recommend as a strong pale ale from Belgium.

ying out a legend. 2011 edition 330 for me. Aroma of fruitbread, spicy alcohol - if such a thing can be said - along with currants and brown sugar. Dark blood brown color marginal espresso looking head. Holy hell is it strong. Extreme malt sweetness...dark chocolate, vanilla and lots of dark palm fruits blended underneath. Initial smoothness, but leaves a rough sawdust palate feel on finish. Completely exotic as a beer, but totally civilized for so strong a drink. A wonderful show with a $8 admission. As for the 750, bring your spare liver.

11.2oz bottle served into a snifter.
Vintage 2011

A - Pours dark brown with a tight knit mocha head that forms a razor thin cap and collar.

S - Spicy, brown bread crust, brown sugar, candied figs, sugary dates, caramel, spicy and fruity alcohol vapors, hints of cocoa, lots of bready yeast,

T - Layers of bready, dark and caramel malts, brown sugar, sweet figs, sticky dates, and currants run underneath. The fruit melds so well with the malts, its effortless. Hints of cocoa powdered bananas on the finish.

M - Thick velvety feel, very smooth and creamy, warming, medium micro carbonation.

Wow!!! The flavors in this beer were blended perfectly. Everything complimented its counterpart. Very complex aroma and flavors. One of the best beers Ive ever tasted. Seek this gem out!

Serving type: bottle

12-28-2012

2010 33cl bottle from Ales by Mail. This has been on my radar for a good while and I finally lashed out on 1 last week, at around £4.25, well worth it. Pours a beautiful rich deep brown colour with a light tan coloured, foaming head. Vineous, sherry aromas, with hints of apple. On the tongue theres ripe plums, more sherry, red wine and brandy notes, then chocolate and raisins later on, with some coffee too. Complex, moreish and fantastic.
Very good Belgian Strong Ale. Dark and malty with an amazing palate. Good stuff.

Robe brune foncée surmontée dune mousse éphémère. Superbe bouquet aromatique avec fruits confits (prune, raisin...), caramel et notes torréfiées. Bouche impressionnante et onctueuse, notes de fruits confits, de sucres et final caramélisé.
Bottle (2012), bread, coffee, roasty, pitch black. Brown head, quickly disappearing. Reminds me of Rochefort, equally great!

2011 Vintage.  Pours a dark brown.  Age has treated this one well, light oxidation yields the typical rich sherry-like flavors as well as a velvety texture.  The subtlety of the spices integrate perfectly with a sturdy and assertive caramel/toffee like malt backbone, yielding flavors of cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, plum, fig, and raisin.  Absolutely a must try, and based on this bottle, I would highly suggest trying one fresh and aging another.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 Chocolade bruine kleur met een goede crème kraag. Ruikt, fruitig, kruiden, chocolade, koffie. Smaakt bitterzoet, fruitig, kers, kruiden en iets alcohol.

Fantastic rich and delicate aroma; sweet and complex; caramel, dark fruit, touch of alcohol, some spices, a bit of roasty/coffee. 
Tastes about the same, very smooth and delicious.

2010 vintage - rated 6/12/13. Dark brown with small fizzy lasting brown head. Fantastic rich and delicate aroma; sweet and complex; caramel, dark fruit, touch of alcohol, some spices, a bit of roasty/coffee. Flavor follows right through. Full body; luxurious, smooth and creamy. Supremely balanced.
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2013 what a magnificent beer. stunning balance. great body, great bitter finish. totally worth the hype. Theres a building oiliness to this beer. I am enjoying it so much!
Draught. Dark brown to black. Smallish head.  Dark fruits, figs and half malts and candy sugars. Good but not quite as amazing as Id hoped

Bottle (2011). Pours a deep red  - almost black color, with a medium sized brown head. Aroma of malts, spices, chocolate, sugar and yeast. NICE! Flavours of sweet roasted malts, dark fruits, caramel, sugar, spices...and oak? Sweet but not too much - "just right" in fact. Body is on the heavier side of medium and it has a nice creamy feel to it. Malty and fruity aftertaste. Really good and a nice surprise. Definitely one Ill have again.

On tap from the Struise Tap Trailer at Haand Festival 2013
Dark brown, nice tanned head. Smells of dark malts, dark fruits, raisins and belgian yeast. Very complex aromas. Medium sweet, dark delicious malts, more dark fruits and caramel, some raisins too. I get some port assosiations when drinking this. Nice moderate bitter finish. This beer is so well balanced; and to get it directly from the Tap Trailer gives an extra dimention as well. This is definitvily a world class beer

Pannepot 2010, bottle from Saveur Bière
Appearance: dark brown, creamy offwhite head that leaves a fine lacing.
Aroma: figs, viandox, burnt toffee, worcestershire sauce, wine like flavours ... huge complexity in that brew !!!
Palate: Full bodied brew, smooth carbonation, great length. Nice bitterness in aftertaste
Taste: Well balanced. Dried plum, coffee, some spices and mild oak. Harmony
Overall impression: very, very, very, good beer. Wine barrel aged strong Ale? Funky/Burgundy Quad? .
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Bottle at home. Great beer! Pours deep dark. Sweet aroma of sugar, caramel, darm chocolate and Somers coffee and other spices. Really smooth taste

Appearance: Black color with a creamy tan head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Rich and complex. Different fruits and malty.Palate: Full body. A round fine sweetness and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation. Creamy texture.Taste: Complex and well balanced. The most prominent flavor was: Plum fruity. Coffee, some spices and mild oak. Well hidden alcohol.Overall impression: Crazy stuff.Personal stats: Sample @ Haand 13

Bottle from 2010. Brown beer with a medium beige head. Dried dark fruits, vanilla and spices aroma. Similar flavour. A lovely one. 

Also tasted a bottle from 2011. Ratings: 7-4-7-4-14. Not as good as 2010.

Sampled from tap at Haandøl 2013. Fingerthick creamy light brown head on a black body. Dried dark fruits and a funky candy brown sugar nose. Pungent fruity sweet, full bodied, mellow toasted and smooth. A well balanced bitterness carries the pleasant finish.
Poured from 2011 bottle , with dark brown color. Frothy head,taste was medium sweet and smooth with hints of  caramel and a cofee finish.
Intriguing aromas of chocolate, cinnamon, sweet clove and spice. Flavor is rich, complex. Dried dark fruits, chocolate, Belgian spice.
Haandfestivalen. Mørk brun,beige skum,  mye mørk frukt,plomme,kaffe,Brent malt,eik Veldig god

Pours a really dark brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma of dark chocolate and booze. Taste is medium sweet and a low level of apparent bitterness. Flavors of chocolate, molasse, raisins and various dark fruits. Quite similar to a Rochefort 10 but with an even nicer mouthfeel (creamy). Marvelous!

Poured from 2011 bottle, pours a very dark brown, nearly black with a thin light brown head,  aroma has a lot of dark fruit mixed in with some spices and caramel, flavor is pretty sweet with a lot of chocolate and dark fruit on the front end, sweet finish with a nice bubbly mouthfeel, the abv is tasted a little bit in the finish, solid all around.

Pours black with a fading tan head.
Nose shows chocolate, spiced figs, prunes, caramel, burnt brown sugar, candi sugar. Lovely.
More burnt sugar as a flavours along with some roasted malt, bready malt and spices.
Could use a more syrupy body and creamier carbonation.
Actually preferred this to the Reserva version.  Bottle at Pizza Paradiso in Dupont Circle.  Slightly floral on front end with a fairly boozy finish.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2013 Zeer smaakvol bijna zwart bier met een mooie schuimkraag. Vol aroma en een complex smaakpalet

(2011) Pours dark and opaque with a medium tan head. Aroma is heavy sweet malts, prunes, and maybe a little clove - theres also a little alcohol in the background. Taste is really unique. Initially you get a heavy malt flavor then, almost immediately, an alcohol sweetness dominates. Afterwards, a thick, oily, earthy maltiness envelopes the tastebuds for a great finish. Hard to pinpoint individual flavors probably because of the age. Would like to compare with a fresh one.
Dark brown pour with a tan head. Aromas of dried fruits, malt, and yeast notes. Complex flavors of figs, plums, brown sugar, and malty goodness. Abv is well hidden. Awesome brew.

Pours inky black with mocha head. Aromas of chocolate, raisins, and roasted malt. Flavors match aromas with a rich full mouthfeel. A well crafted complex beer demanding contemplation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet- 2010 Edition. Pours hazy dark brown with a medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and som spices. Flavor is a lot of dark fruits, chocolate and som spices. Extremly complex but also very well balanced so it is smooth and very easy to drink. Alcohol is hidden but noteable. Medium carbonation, medium bitterness, full body. 

Simply one of the best beers so far.

Pours deep dark brown with a dark kahki head. Aroma is spices, pungent yeast, chocolate roasted malt. Flavor is a big dark fruit bomb. Sweet figs, chocolate, cherry, hints of spices, yeast funk. Silky smooth texture goes along with the huge complex flavor. Relatively heavy carbonation. Hints of alcohol warmth. Great beer.

Bottle. 2010 vintage. Very dark ruby beer with touches of a residual head. Aroma of dark treacle and dark fruits. The taste is very complex. Dark fruits, licorice, dark treacle, sweet and rich. Oily and a little sticky on the palate. Slight carbonation. An outstanding beer, one of my favourites.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Old rate. Great beer, dark fruits, caramel, nice maltiness, good yeast character, delicious beer.

330ml bottle, 2011 vintage.
Pours a brilliant, deep mahogany, with a thick brown head. Theres a decent amount of sediment towards the end of the bottle.
Complex, spicy aroma, chocolate, caramel, dark cherries, tobacco, quite vinous, phenolic notes, yeast, earth.
Off-dry, medium to full bodied, mid bitterness, creamy CO2.
Complex, vinous taste, caramel, candied sugar, chocolate, faintly sour, phenolic yeast notes, spices, hints of licorice, dark cherries.
This is a downright fantastic beer, there are so many layers of flavour to be found here, I wish I had more bottles to cellar for a few years. (2013-05-01)

Top 10 beer in the world IMO. This thing is complex, without being overpowering. Nice balance of malt, caramel, and leather. Strong, but not too bourbony. Smooth, and calm going down. No prob downing.
12oz bottle to snifter.  Dark dark reddish color.  No head worth mentioning.  Dark fruity flavors with a spiced backbone.  Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 2006 provad 2013. Härligt knäckig och skitbra. Sista  ölen för ikväll. Andy vill gå hem sedan länge men den här var värt att vänta på. 
   -------- Tap på OC. Bra och välgjord men föredrar lagrad några år.
not for me. strong coffee aroma and flavor. too much. very complex flavor. very dark color with almost no head.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2013 Pours a beautiful black beer with a not very long lasting brown head. I smell some dark fruites, coffee. The taste is light bitter abd medium sweet.  A bit to sweet. A thick body. Low carbo and a dry long lasting finish.  Not my favorite kind of beer but certainly not bad. 
14-06-2013
Rerate. Taste is way better then I first rated.

This is a classic Belgian Dark strong ale in the vein of the Trappist monks at places like Westvletereen ( XII)  and Rochefort (10)  and St. Bernardus (Abt 12).  A delicious brew indeed. This brew has what all the aforementioned above brews have.  Nothing else needs to be said.  If you love this genre or beer style, and If you see it buy it and drink it slowly, you wont be disappointed !!
Brutal cerveza con toques achocolatados, no esperaba menos de esta cerveza, toda una explosión de sabor en mi boca.

Color negro con reflejos rojos. Aroma complejo: caramelo, frutos rojos y chocolate. En boca, chocolate, azúcar, y un final ligeramente acido. La textura es media-alta. Una excelente belga. Quizá me gusto más la Reserva.

33cl bottle (2011 vintage) purchased in Brugge.  Aroma  is dominated by dark fruits, spices (cinnamon, clove?) Taste is malty sweet, but balanced.  Roast comes through with some bitterness in the finish to balance the sweetness.  Hides the 10% ABV very well. Well worth the wait (and travels!) for this one.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2014 
Tap @ Gastropub Tuulensuu.
Pours deep dark red-brown color with a medium sized off-white head. Lots of sourish plums on the nose, raisins, dark malts and some chocolate too. Ripe fruits and caramel on the flavor, slightly sugary with molasses, some spicy notes, yeast and faint dark chocolate. Awesome balance, very rich and complex. At least as good as it was from a bottle.
Rating: 9-4-9-4-17
33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100728.
Pours murky brown color with a medium sized head. Aroma of plums, raisins, sweet caramel malts, some brown sugar, yeast and mild spice notes. Flavor of caramel, subtle licorice notes, malts, plums and raisins, yeast and faint spices. Complex, yet balanced brew. Top notch.
6336
Rating: 9-4-9-4-17

In bottle @ delirium cafe Brussels.  ho preso una 2010. schiuma color cappuccino, non molto persistente. Allapetto è in tutto e per tutto una imperial Stout, ma appena si avvicina il naso si sentono caffè e malto tostato in perfetto equilibrio con i lieviti belgi. Il profumo di luppolo è molto più intenso di quanto invece non si avverta sulla lingua. In bocca ritorna il caffè ma è bilanciato con un bel calore alcolico, dalla frizzantezza leggerissima e il finale lunghissimo.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */..Deep, dark brown color with a creamy beige head. Aroma is sweet, a bit bitter, roasted malts, dried dark fruit, sugar and some spices. Notes of coffee and dark chocolate. Very smooth and perfectly balanced beer. Amazing!

A real nice dark beer, ages really well.. i had a pannepot 2006 @ kulminator, which had an amazing taste. I find the younger versions (got some 2012) a bit too sweet, but the taste evolution after a few years makes up for it!
UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 Color as black coffee. Sweet and a oily thickness. Dried fruit or overripe plums. Licorice and fresh hops.

25/03/2013 on tap @Brasserie 4:20 (2009). Bruna, riflessi tra il miele di castagno e il mogano, schiuma leggerissima bianco sporca. Al naso sentori di frutta matura, ossidazione, caramello, spezie, alcol. In bocca è dolciastra, frutta, caramello, lieviti, quasi piatta. Corpo medio-pieno, inferiore alle attese per via dellossidazione, carbonazione molto soft. Discreta evoluzione, ma non allaltezza delle aspettative.

Drinking a 2011 vintage bottle...25cl fromMi-Orge Mi-Houblon. Pours drak brown/ruby red with a hint of foam clinging to the edges of the glass. Aroma is prunes, raisins, apricots, molasses. Taste is sweet, a mild tartness, dried fruit and candy. Palate is dry, mouthfeel is oily. Complex brew, but deserving of its fame.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2013 This beer is paragonable at one imperial stout.
(2010 version) - black color with fine, non persistent beige head.
aroma is roasted, the taste is of coffee, liquorice, dark chocolate and spiced.. . Aftertaste is roasted/ bitter dry, not hot for ABV level, alcohol is well hidden... Nice beer!

(2012 version) - Black color with fine tan head, roasted and complex aroma, very strong, in mouth is heavy, complex, with low carbonation, strong dark chocolate aftertaste...

i have prefer the bouquet of 2010 version drunk in 2013

UPDATED: APR 7, 2013 On tap during Belgianfest at Maxs in Baltimore. Pours very dark brown with a good tan head. Lots of dark fruit on the nose combined with chocolate and spices. Very complex and balanced brew that finishes slightly hoppy.

11.2 oz bottle to snifter (2010 vintage; shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a semi-opaque dark brown with thin off-white lacing. Smells and tastes good; dark fruit, caramel, and Belgian yeast. Good on the palate too. Good beer.
Pours a very dark brown with tall frothy brown head. Aroma is malt, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, some yeast, spices and caramel. Taste is medium sweet leading to a sweet spicy finish. Brilliant!

Picked this up for a premium price because I kept seeing pop up on Ratebeers "Weekly Top Performers" list.  I have to admit I would have not considered buying without this insight.  Pannepot is a nice treat!  Aromas of raisin and caramel--even rum cake in there; flavors follow in much the same way.  I was worried the 2011 vintage may be too old, but I had no problems and I noticed other rate-a-tarians rating the same vintage.  Belgians are not usually in my wheel house, but this is a fine example and should not be missed.

Rating #800. 2011 vintage tasted alongside 2009 Pannepot Reserva and 2011 Pannepeut. 33 cL bottle from Binnys Beverage Depot in Chicago, served in a stem glass. Pours hazy chestnut with a tiny tan head that fades to a few bubbles. The nose has huge toasted malts and chocolate up front, along with figs, dark fruit, cherries, caramel, earth and just a touch of hops. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with a subtle spiciness and rich fruity notes. Chocolate, roast malts and oak enter through the middle and longer towards the end. The finish is long and sweet with toasted malts and fruit. On the palate it is medium-full in body with a smooth, milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a great chocolatey malty spicy strong ale. Very complex and elegant. 2013-03-14

At Maxs. Look: Dark brown body, soapy off white 2 finger head. Smell: Dark fruits, spices, burnt sugar, roasted malts. Taste: Roasted chocolate, berries, spices, candied sugar. Feel: Med-light nice carbonation. Overall: Tasty treat for sure. This will be in heavy rotation in my fridge. Recommended.

Cerveza donde se perciben notas frutales y dulces con bases a notas acidas y vinosas.

En apariencia, perfecta! Color obscuro, espuna practicamente nula por su potencia alcholica. Turbiedad imoortante con presenxia de sedimentacion.

En boca es dulce, acida y vinosa.

Al paladar es excepcional! Cerveza que se percibe suave y aterciopelada, nunca agresiva. Inicialmente dulce y muy frutal, posteriormente un sabor profundamente acido.
Se perciben sabores a frutas rojas y uvas intensas. Buen equilibrio aun que destaca el sabor acido.

En general una cerveza excepcional, un poco falta de aroma paraser perfecta.  Embotellada en 2006 lo que le dio una maxima complejidad.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 Nice. Aroma is big cherry, dark fruit, caramel, chocolate, and alcohol. Malt bomb. Drinks smooth as hell and tastes awesome. Sweet caramel behind dark fruits and a touch of smooth alcohol and cherries makes this a winner. Damn I love this beer.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 Aroma has a lot of hints of spices and caramel, yeast and bread.. Tastes how it smells and I like it.  Reminds me of westvleteren 12.
Donker, bijna zwart bier met lichtbruine, snel inzakkende schuimkraag. Aroma van chocolade, stroop en donker fruit. Complex, flinke body. Top!
12oz Bottle at OL Beer Cafe. 2011 Vintage. Wonderful subtle spice flavors. Consistently one of my favorite beers.

330ml, 2011 bottle from Systembolaget.
Thick aroma than fills my entire nose.
Beautiful appearance for its style.
Taste is just wonderful at all aspects.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 2007 bottle: smells like cherries and  brown sugar. Pours a murky brown with lots of carbonation wow just wow I get a wine like flavour aftertaste some Carmel and a wallop of booze. Damn fine beer. 

Updated: so I sat on another 2007 bottle of this for 9 or so months, not a ton of time per say but for a beer this old it can change in a hurry. Aroma - similar but much more sherry like, smells a lot like a barley wine. Taste - its mellowed a lot in fact I think the first bottle I had was the infected version as there is no wine aftertaste, and the bottle didnt fizz all over the place like last time. In this bottle I get rich butterscotch, raisins, brown sugar and man it is oh so smooth, no hint of the booze...absolutely zero..no idea what this tastes like fresh but good grief for a beer 5 or so years old it has held up remarkably well. I docked it on the appearance last time as it fizzed everywhere and was a glass of foam until it chilled out. Bumping it up there 
as it poured great this time.

2013.03.05 - Struise Pannepot - 11.2oz bottle in goblet glass.  2011Vintage. Bottle marked 2015190511-24FF.

Aroma: malty, spices, maybe a trace of cherry.

Appearance: Pours around upper end on SRM scale, 40. Dark opaque. Average carbonation.  Caramel mocha head settles to thick-ish ring and slick.

Taste: Malty sweetness balanced quite well with spices. Sweetness and spices and fruity notes giving way to a bit more tang and tart on the back end (relatively).  Somewhat boozy. Complex and tasty.   I love Belgian Strong Ales, as well as quads (as this is categorized at BA).  Put some sweetness and spices into this pot and add some clear craftsmanship and Im happy.  My only bottle of this, Ill certainly grab more next time I see it.

Palate/Mouthfeel: medium thick, slightly creamy.


Aroma 8/10, Appearance 4/5, Taste 8/10, Palate 4/5, Overall 18/20

2006 vintage. Bottle courtesy of shrubber85. Gusher. Dark fruit, molasses, oak, black bread, barley malt, and alcohol aroma. Murky mahogany with a  quickly receding tan head. Sweet dark fruit, black bread, wood, spice, and light alcohol flavor. Full sticky warm body.

Bottle of 2011
A: pitch black with mocha head. 
Ar: caramel, dark fruits (black currant), spices, alcohol, chocolate, brown sugar, coffee.
T: full porter like flavor. Great balance of rich flavors. Not too bitter, sour or sweet. Very smooth. 
P: medium bodied low on carbonation. Oily, creamy and sticky. Yummy.
O: remind me of the better "the molen" porter beers like tsarina esra. Its in the same ballpark of yumminess. It doesnt get much better then this. Highly recommended.

Btw, Dont get the categories at ratebeer. This is more like a porter and one of the best out there. But you will find it in Belgium strong ale :s which means nothing since 90% is catagorized like this.

Bottle from Slowbeer. Full marks. Aromas of caramel, chocolate, and vanilla. Taste is sweet, with very subtle sourness, and very long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Dark brown, with a disappearing head.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2013 Bottle 2011.
Appearance: amazing creamy light brown head that stays on for a while.
Nose: wood, a little sour, cappuccino, dark chocolate, yeast, sugar/sweet, amazing aromas.
Taste: warm feeling when swallowing, the oily texture brings a lot of dark chocolate and strong coffee. Carbonation seems low, but is very lively in the glass. Almost feels like it was aged on whiskey barrels, very balanced.
I never had a pannepot that tasted like the one before, they are always different, which makes this an absolute amazing beer!

From a bottle, 2010 vintage. Dark pour with wispy tan head. Nose of yeasty bread and caramel. High carbonation, full body, nearly oily texture.  Hints of cherries, red currants, raisins, chicory and liquerice. Lovely bitterness to the aftertaste. Exclusive brewing! 2011 bottle from trade with DrSilverworm.  Pours a very dark brown color with a big pillowy head that lingers a bit.  Leaves nice lacing, great appearance.  Interesting aroma but fainter than I expected.  Aromas are dark fruits, raisins, licorice, spices, and a hint of chocolate too.  Taste is very good.  Moderately sweet up front with lots of dark fruit, raisins, and caramel.  Finishes with lots of Belgian spices, dark chocolate, and some tart fruit.  Love the mouthfeel, slightly fizzy carbonation but still remains soft in a way.  Very sticky too and the light tartness just makes you want to keep drinking fast.  Alcohol very well hidden.  What a great Belgian Strong.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2015 July 15 btl@ latelier Brussels 
Pannepot 2007
Very dark brown, almost black.
Caramel, liquorice and still some booze
Tastes.. Like a Christmas cake, full of caramel and liquorice that slight numbs to gums like a caramel coaching this is in the seriously amazing category.!! 

2010 bottle. Pours very dark brown, against a light is a dark ruby/mahogany. Small head in large Trappist glass that settles to a milky coffee ring around glass. Smells liquorish/aniseed candy, fortified wine, sultana, dark fruits and sweet spice. Tastes are many, dark fruits, dark toffee, roasted brown sugar/caramel, sweet spice and big malts. A slight hint of coffee in there too. Really good, even better once it warms up.

330 mL bottle, 2008 vintage. Deep, dark brown with low carbonation and a thin coffee-cream head. The aroma is intoxicating: port wine, coffee, candy and spices all compete with one another. Taste is sweet like lemon hard candy, with only the faintest coffee bitterness lingering on the back of the tongue when youve swallowed. Rich, creamy, with a bit of a tang. Low alcohol burn. Liquid candy. Delicious.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2014 2011 bottle. Extremely dark brown color with a two-finger frothy head and moderate lacing. Aroma of raisins, plums, and a pungent woody spice mixture. Smooth fig, oak, caramel, and spicy tobacco on the taste with a sweet finish of chocolate, Concord grapes, and dark cherries. Very smooth body with a tart, rich, lingering finish. The 10% ABV is hardly detectable. Really well-crafted Belgian dark strong.

Bottled:Deep reddish brown; almost black. Thick head. Malty nose of toffee, brown sugar and licorice. Thick and sweet mouthfeel. Sweet taste of toffee, brown sugar and honey leading to a warming finish.
Dark brown with a thin beige head that dissipates into a ringlet. Spiced aroma, smoky. Caramel and almost toffee. Smoked, warming and filling after taste. Lovely beer.

Tastes like "love"! Sweet and lifting!
The climax of every beer drinking evening!
Will definitely have more of this. Probably right now ;)
Drunk at Herman Bar, Berlin

Bottle shared at a tasting at our place. Thanks Alma7 for bringing the bottle! Pours very dark red, opaque with tan ring. Raisins, chestnuts, slightly alcoholic in the nose, alcoholic, somewhat liquor-like and roasty in the mouth. Full body, smooth, delicate carbonation, long, roasty finish.

Dark brown colour, fizzy beige head. A quick swirl leaves some curtains. Rich aroma of dark sugar, dried fruit and caramel with hints of banana bread and cough syrup. The taste is slightly more medicinal with some liquorice but still full of dried stone fruits and muscovado sugar. Hardly any alcohol really, at least considering the high ABV, but it shines through somewhat in the finish giving it a nice warmth. Rich carbonation, full body and slightly oily yet somehow very drinkable. Great with a piece of Hirten cheese but I guess its quite all-right by itself...
Gorgeous beer! Lovely mouthfeel and beautiful flavours. A really really nice BSA!

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 The look of this one is summed up in the self-given description - old fishermans ale! Smell is orange citrus rising out of the malty morass. Taste is deeply rich malts. Beautiful dry finish ensures this one isnt sickly. But for me, too much fruitiness in the mix. The success of this beer lies in the way it is an insanely malty brew, yet in no way oddly tasting, like similar other beers ive sampled.

Bottle, 2011. Pours very dark brown with a lasting light brown head. Aroma is dark malts, caramel, dark fruits, sugarcane and cough syrup. Flavour is sweet with some roasted notes and a full body. Very nice, bottle was a bit too cold so it took a while before the aroma appeared.
