Bottle: 2006 vintage (courtesy Shrubber)
Pours deep brown with a dark, quick head.
Aroma of dark fruits and spice.
Flavour is molasses-sweet but not overbraring, plum, caramel, grape, malt.
Tingly-smooth.....beautifully masked alcohol...
An Exceptional Beer.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 Pannepot 2010.
Hazy dark brown, almost black colour, and yellow/brownish head. Rich smell of malt, chocolate and liquorice, quite complex. Spicy notes too. Sweet taste,with little hops, and some sourish finish. Full-bodied, rounded. Alcohol well hidden, perfectly balanced. A great beer, really excellent.

het uitzicht is Donkerbruin naar zwart, kleine beige kraag, praktisch geen pareling. Er is een prikkelend, anijs en pruim aroma dat niet onaardig is
De smaak is eerder een gebrande aanzet, iets wat zoetig en met een lichte  anijs en kandijsiroop smaak. De afdronk is eerder zoet met een licht drop smaakje.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 
33 cl bottle vintage 2007 @ home, BBE 08/2013
Aroma is sweetish with ripe fruits, spices, sourness, earthy notes and hints of lactic acid. Flavour has malty notes, ripe fruits, some spices, wood and sour cherries. Some sweetish, fruity notes, orange peel and chocolate do occur after the first sips. Palate is a bit too high on CO2. Rather dry and leathery finish and alcohol warms my throat after swallowing.

Either this aging has rounded the sharp corners of this or then Ive just started liking it. In 2009 I didnt find this good. (3.8->4.1)

11.2oz bottle, 2011 vintage. Dark brown color. Loud fizzing light brown-colored tall airy head. Most of it quickly fades away. Lots of particles in the body. Medium to big body, pronounced softer carbonation. Sweet taste, alcohol evident with a bit of warmth in the finish, but its not bothersome. This doesnt have the intensely smooth texture that the 2008 Pannepot reserva I had a couple months ago had. Dark fruit, wood, some chocolate, sweet candi sugar, toasty malts. Reasonably complex flavor. Raisins, some spice. Some black cherry. Cinnamon. Does get better as it warms. Flavor comes out more nicely, texture gets smoother, though a light bite remains. Interesting, complex Belgian, but I wouldnt go out of my way for it. Much preferred the vintage reserva version.

Bottle, 2007. Dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma is vinous, spicy, dark dried fruit, port wine, alcohol, brown sugar. Taste is heavy sweet with a soft mouthfeel, full body, medium carbonation. Long sweet finish with dark fruits, a little hard roasted malt and a bit of warming alcohol.

33cl 2010 bottle. Deep dark brown murky with a fizzy dark brown head that disappears pretty quick. Aroma is brown sugar, raisins, dark toffee notes, a little spicy coffee, dark fruits, nutty cherries. Taste is sweet, cherries, dark malts, raisins, ripe fruits, figs, dark sugar, liqourice, some spices. Good stuff!

Kaatuu lasiin mustana vaahdon ollessa hyvin niukkaa jättäen reunuksen. Haju on marjainen, kuivatun hedelmäinen, lakritsinen, aniksinen, rusinainen ja hieman alkoholinen. Todella makea maku on lakritsinen, marjainen, tumman hedelmäinen (luumua, rusinaa), banaania, limppua ja hieman alkoholia. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen, täyttävä ja lämmin. Kokonaisuutena Pannepot on loistava, monimuotoinen, lämmittävä ja hieman alkoholinen belgiale. Kypsyttelemällä varmasti paranee.

Bouteilles de 330 ml, édition 2010. Arômes complexes de fruits mûrs confis (raisins secs, pruneaux, cerises noires) et dalcool. Robe brune foncée aux reflets roux, effervescence moyenne et peu de mousse. En bouche, on retrouve une très belle complexité fruitée et maltée, portant surtout sur les pruneaux et les raisins secs. Le corps est relativement lourd et sucré et possède une intéressante texture soyeuse. Finale alcoolisée montrant une légère pointe métallique. Une bonne bière dhiver.

33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark dense color. Thin head. Smooth and thick texture. Low to medium carbonation. Medium to high bitterness and low to medium sweetness. Coffee, roasted, chocolate, spices, hop aroma.

Deep brown/ruby color with a thin tan head. Dark dried fruit, licorice and molasses nose. Flavors of fruitcake, candy sugar and warm alcohol. Long sweet finish with just enough drying alcohol -  like a late harvest dessert wine. Complex and evolving palate.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2014 2011 Bottle so ~1 year old drank next to a 2009 Reserva and 2005 Grand Reserva.  It pours a rich brown with a fully lasting tan head and good lace. The aroma is much more fresh and hot than the others though not off putting at all. The yeast and malt are of fresh brown bread and caramel. Theres no oxidation. The fruits are just ripe, both orchard and ripe bananas. The flavor is mostly sweet but not cloying, restrained alcohol heat and spice in the foreground, and with fruits and baking spices riding through.  The mouthfeel is incredibly full, creamy, and lively.  I feel like I should love the older reservas more but this is just so comforting on top of being only slightly less rich.  The flavors and aromas while still distinct are in harmony and perfectly expressed.  

2011 drank July 2014 - Much the same as a one year old but with less carbonation; less full, creamy mouthfeel; noticeable oxidation and moderately older fresh bread notes. It hasnt improved IMO though it is still a stunningly great beer.

Bottle of the 2010. Slight gusher. Dark cloudy brown with a beige head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is raisins, vanilla, star anise, dates, honey, brown sugar, chocolate. Slightly slick mouthfeel, complex on the palate. Taste is raisins, brown sugar, dates, spices, hint of booze.

2011. Dark red-ish brown color. Small beige head.
Aroma of chocolate, dark fruits (raisins mostly) and belgian yeast. Also some hops in there. 
Taste is more yeast and more chocolate, dark fruits.. Malty and pretty smooth. Slightly bitter.
Dense hazelnut foam, dark brown ritchness of dried fruits, spices and floral hoptones. Full bitter/sweet fruitiness in the taste. Lasting layers of goodness in the aftertaste.

Dark brown color with a nice white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of plums, caramel, candy. Well balanced sweet taste, with notes of dark fruits. Medium to fullbodied with rather lively carbonation. A world class beer, indeed.

Bottle from Belgium in a Box; dark brown pour, now you see now you dont tan head, burnt caramel and alchohol aroma, taste is demerara sugar, raisins, prunes with spice. Quite heavy alchohol taste lovely.

Extremely excited to taste this one. Great looking beer, dark with a thick white head. Flavour includes lots of caramel, dark fruits and some chocolate to boot. Alcohol hidden extremely well, this beer deserves all the accolades it gets.

Kado van Mutz.
Aroma vol koffie, caramel in lichte staat van verbrandig, kelderlucht en koek. Smaak is best heftig, koude koffie, de nasmaak is die van kwaliteitskoffie, roasty, ingemaakte rozijnen, drop(-likeur), wellicht ook wat gedroogd fruit. Schuim is meteen weg. Het is de nasmaak die het hem doet, diep zoet bittere tonen, groeit met de slok. 2010 fles.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with average, creamy beige head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is bread and caramel malt, cookies, figs, dates, light coffee, light floral hops, and chocolate. Flavor is caramel malt up front that quickly goes to more roasted notes with dark fruit esters and light bittering hops and milk chocolate throughout; dry, lightly sweet chocolate finish. Medium/full body and low carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 Draught at Rover cons 2016-09-15 Göteborg
Vintage 2012... loads of port wine - à bit to much but still pleasent, no rating.

Bottle from SB cons 2012-12-20 Göteborg
Vintage 2011 Im pretty sure that I tried this one before  -  many times!
AR: candis, wee burned caramel, pruns, coffee, 
AP: dark dark Brown, frothy creme Brown head
F: candis, wee burned caramel, pruns, coffee, sugary texture, medium low carbonation, medium lowbitterness, needs some more storage

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 Bottle from Systembolaget, 2011 version. Pours dark red with a tan head. Aroma is dark candi sugar, raisins, alcohol, coffee. Taste is sweet caramel, dried fruits . So easy to drink for being 10%.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 2010 bottle, 13C. Clear very dark brown with a coat of beige head. Aroma is brooding but still rustic, with lots of dark dried fruit and berries, licorice, chocolate, brown sugar, brine, alcohol. Oily, full-bodied, rich but not all that heavy. Taste is sweet with deep bass notes of dark fruit, figs, chocolate, cinnamon. Fruit, mild spice and licorice in the finish with creeping, but plain bitterness. Super beer. [4.1] Often no head at all. Milk chocolate on top with some bitter spices. A rumble of darker chocolate and fruit underneath. Somewhat vinous. Sympathetic spices never quite break cover - maybe cinnamon, cardamon.

Bottle (2011 vintage). Dark cola like brown pour with beige head that remains for a while.  Natural brown sugar, spice, chocolate, coffee.  So smooth like a nice cashmere scarf.  Wow.  Well balanced sweetness, bitterness, alcohol and carbonation.

Doftar söt russin råsocker som att gå på tivoli och möta en sockervadd. Med kaffe, choklad ljus brun ton. smakar mildt och mjukt tills den rinner ner och efterlämnar en het känsla. Mycket god. rekomenderar den starkt!!!
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head that leaves a bit of lacing. Sweet malty aroma with some dark fruit, sugar. Rich mouthful. Rich malt flavour, sweet alcohol, somewhat fruity.

330 ml bottle, vintage 2011. Pours very dark amber with massive orange-beige head. Aroma of dark toffee and cocoa. Most well hidden 10% abv so far. Wonderful taste of dark sweetness, toffee, coffee, cococa and dried fruits.

Enormous, dense head that sticks around a long time, leaving decent rings of lacing.  Deep aroma of cocoa, red and purple fruits (cherries, cranberries, grapes, plums, raisins), yeast, breads, and a hint of ... Dr. Pepper?  How neat.  Flavor - this is the smoothest 10% ABV beer I have ever drunk.  Holy moly - it is too easy to drink this!  Best-hidden alcohol ever.  Be careful, because its really tasty, too.  VERY well-balanced on the acid front, which is typically my foremost complaint among some otherwise great Belgian Strongs.  5 on the palate for sure.  Id like a little more aftertaste, but what is there is really scrumptious - all the aforementioned fruits, especially the red ones, lots of creamy maltiness, and a finish of bread and fruit.  Nom!  My special orders for December have gone so well.  Im such a happy beer geek!  UPDATE:  I am now tasting some spices in addition to all that other stuff.  This just gets more and more interesting.
Bottle.  Sweet, malty, alcohol bomb.  Really nice with lots of candy sugar sweetness.  The sweetness muffles other flavor profiles but I am a sucker for big Belgians.

Bottle 2011. Dark brown, little head. Nose has dark candi, malts, coffee chocolate. And caramel sweetness. Body is full, thick. A bit oily. Feels a bit like a quad, but lots heavier, thicker and sweeter. Soft though. Lots of flavour. With subtle imperial stout-like coffee/roastedness.-- bb/h

2010

Gorgeously deep brown with a light glossy magnolia head. Light prune to the nose with notes of fig, date, dark fruit and a fluttering of chocolate, coffee and spice. Full in the mouth with a sense of sap. So so civilised. Gives a luxuriously golden glow in the glass. Beautiful.

Pours a very nice deep brown syrupy color with a light coffee tan head. Rich aroma of molasses, dark dried fruit and caramel. Slight, but not uncomfortable metallic taste at first that very soon gives way to toffee, brown sugar, raisins and hints of vanilla and coffee. Very nice creamy mouthfeel with a lingering, slightly boozy finish. Very good. Have three more that I think will age quite well if cellared right.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle.  Thanks Joe!!  Pours a dark reddish brown with a nice tan head.  Fantastic aroma of caramel, dark fruit, molasses, and chocolate.  Taste is dark fruit, malt, chocolate, spice, brown sugar and coffee.  First sip is amazing and then it gets better!  Superb!!

A: Rather funny aroma, mollasses, cinnamin, spices, dark fruits, with some alcohol and oxidation. P: Dark brown with a white head. T: Dark fruits, figs, mollases, maple syrup, caramel malt. Its funny, its complex and damn good. M: light with high carbonation. O: It was a very complex brew which I would want in a quad the oxidation kind of killed it but a solid brew nonetheless. this was my second time having this and will seek again.

Deep brown, medium head, not much lacing. Rich molasses on the nose with spices. Taste is a blend of molasses, chocolate, coffee, and spice. A bit of wood and alcohol round it out. Somewhat bitter and dry aftertaste. Very nice work. Would be interesting to try an aged bottle.

Aroma: A smell of ripe oranges, raisins, figs, dates, almonds and Sherry.Appearance: A dark chestnut brown brew, a tan high head, little lacing but good curtains.Taste: Tasting of brown sugar,  dark dried fruits and ripe oranges.Palate: Medium high carbonation, soft and sticky, a good body, a light dry finish.Overall: It is really a very good beer,Note: Bottle 330 ml. (Vintage 2011) Reviewed 2012-12-05.

Bottle 33cl, Systembolaget, Sweden, Täby.

Aroma: caramel, alcohol, pretty clean otherwise.
Appearance: black/opaque, sparkling, tan foam.
Taste: medium sweetness, not bitter - absolutely, caramel, some low heat.
Palate: I was a bit surprised that the carbonation, which is fairly high, didnt make more of tingle. A bit of alcohol heat but not unpleasant.
Overall: I do like this beer. The flavors I find are absolutely something in my taste but they could also be more pronounced. I may have to let it warm up a bit more.

Re-Rate: The beer is now warmer and I can really taste the liquorice-notes. It may come from the roasted malts / hop-combination but more likely from the spices. Maybe anise.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 2011. Absolutely gorgeous beer: deep, dark brown that progressively devolves into mahogany, red, orange, and yellow as you get to the edge. Beautiful, substantive tan head and a little lacing. Sweet, seductive aromatics: figs, prunes, toffee, a suggestion of guava, caramel, black cherries. Awesome! The alcohol does prickle inside the nostrils, but the sweet bouquet of fruity esters and sweet malts is irresistible. On the tongue, its equally delicious, if less alcoholic. It starts out sweet, toys with the tart for a bit, and has a somewhat dry finish, evoking something like sweet limetta peel (or some other sweet citrus peel anyway). The mouthfeel is truly amazing, with playful carbonation and a medium-to-full body. The overall aftertaste is sweet and fruity, pretty amazing.

My mate Garrys favourite beer. Hes always going on about it. Shut it, Garry....Ill have one! Pours like a misty night over the North Sea with a spicy, black grape wiff, similar but not quite mulled wine. Firstly, dried black fruits, black pepper, liquorice, is that almond?...... alcohol and sweetness, but not too much. Hang on! Its a bloody christmas pudding! Every day must be Christmas for those old fishermen. God knows how they could keep on an even keel with this tipple! Im three sheets to the wind!

2010 vintage. Dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma has cola, chocolate, dark fruits, yeast. Nice dark aroma without being metally. Flavour has chocolate, roasted bready malt, spicy yeast, alcohol warmth and liqourice. Really oily and smooth mouthfeel. Sometimes I wonder all the hype around some beers. This really is worth of all that.
bottle. pours dark brown thin tan head. aroma mostly of fruit and sweet bread. taste reminds me of figgy pudding lots of dates and prunes
330ml Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Dried fruit, malt and leather in the aroma. Rich and fruity taste with notes of marzipan, fruitcake and nuts.
the taste is wonderfull, this is one of the best beers i ever tasted, but the Black Albert from the struisse brouwers is even better!!!

Enticing aroma and attractive dark brown appearance with a complex taste and warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011 vintage bottle poured into my Rockmill chalice. Pours a darker brown with some cloudiness. Theres a light khaki colored head of foam that dissipates to just a ring around the edges of the glass with some small clouds floating in the middle of the beer. Decent lacing. In the aroma I get some fig, raisin, cinnamon, chocolate, toffee, nutmeg. The beer opens up as it warms. Alcohol was quite noticeable while it was cold, but it blends in as the temperature rises. Upon the first sip, I get a rich coffee taste along with some alcohol, but that gives way to a wave of chocolate covered cherries, raisins, and fig newtons. The spiced notes from the aroma seem to have attached themselves to the fruity, chocolatey, coffee-y taste. Theres so much going on in this beer. It is truly a fantastic experience. Relatively thick on the tongue, with just soft carbonation, and a very long lasting, dry and fruity finish. Man, I can see why this beer gets so much love.
tap at Blue Monk. Pours lovely dark ruby/purple with a silky off white head. Nose and taste is string with raisins. Cinnamon and brown sugar kick this full big beer up a notch. Boom!

2011 bottle. Pours dark brown/black with a tan head. Pleasant but very light aroma of belgian yeast and candi sugar. Good mouthfeel. Spices are a little strong upfront. Again, Ill be honest about my distaste for belgian yeast, but I try not to let that affect my rating here. Back end of the beer has a lot more sweetness and it sits on my tongue well for a long time.

Bottled. Reddish brown with a lasting fluffy head; aroma of brown sugar, nutmeg and dried apricot; plenty of warming alcohol nicely balanced by ginger paste, vanilla cream, fig jam and pumpkin seed oil; texture a bit in the frothy side but with a pleasingly warm finish

330ml bottle - pours a deep deep deep reddy brown, nearlt black, with a thin tan head. Smells fresh, with a roasted malty nose, very rich. A lovely oily mouthfeel, a beautiful meaty rounded palate, with a creamy boozy end. I really liked this, but I was surprised it was a 10%er... it is one that could be dangerous for me, I could drink this for hours... with a messy consequence.

Quite the impressive little bottle alround, aroma is pretty top notch - dark fruit (plums, raisons, figs) caramel, toffee, alcohol and burnt brown sugar. Soft carbonation, classic smooth and slightly sticky/lusicous mouthfeel. Flavour is big - caramelised fruit, toffee and underlying alcohol warmth, teetering on the edge of going over-the-top but staying on the right side of the line. Lingering malt/toffee/fruit finish with a side dish of alcohol. Could taste it for ages afterwards, the bottle still has an enticing aroma a week later!  Very nice, thanks for sharing this NN.
Pours dark with light brown head. Caramel aroma,  caramel taste anda little bitter. I really enjoyed this beer.

Ar: Dried fruits, figs, maybe some orange peel.

Ap: Dark with thin light coppery-cream-colored head that seemed to disappear pretty rapidly.

Ta:  Sweet. Raisins, chocolate, prunes plus yeasty esters and noticeably more alcoholic warmth than I was expecting on the finish. 

Pa: Viscous and rich but smooth (possible lactose additions?). Finish was a bit hot especially as the carbonation dissipated.

Ov: A great example of a complex quad that hits all the right spots and practically gives you diabetes.  Would be ideal in a smaller 10oz portion because the carbonation seemed to dissipate quickly and 33cL / 12oz is a lot of quad for most people to handle.

Bottle from 2010, shared with my brother who brought it. Large light brown head. Body is black and flat. Lots of things going on in the aroma, in which I recognized coffee, nuts, something roasted, light alcohol and port. Body is full and sticky with average carbonation. Flavor lasts long and starts with fruits and sweetness, to be followed by malts. Also lots of things going on in the flavor. It started off good and got better every sip. Very well balanced.

Not sure if actually is a black IPA, but is the best I've had if it is.  A must have and ill always go back to it

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Somehow I have never rated this.  Bottle that started to vomit up a little bit of foam after I opened it.  Once it made it into my glass it had a deep brown color with a khaki head.  Some little flecks that look like cinnamon on a pumpkin spice coffee are resting atop the foam.  Really nice looking.  Tons of dark fruit in the aroma.  Raisins, figs, some green apple character, toffee, and caramel all present in the aroma.  Taste is rich with caramel and raisin.  Slight tart apple character still towards the finish.  Not too big and rich, as the strange tart character helps cut the big dark fruit flavors down.  I really enjoy this, and it reminds me of the Dolle Oerbier Reserva.

Fles uit 2011. Donkerbruin, tegen zwart aan met ver weg een wat rode gloed en een minimaal lichtbruine schuimlaag. Zoete geur van gedroogd donkerrood fruit, rozijnen, wat aarde en koffie. Voelt wat romig/olieachtig met een klein beetje koolzuur, precies genoeg. Smaak is wederom gedroogd fruit, bruine suiker, aarde, koffie en eindigt met pure chocola. Fantastisch!

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 ragazzi,il belgio non tradirà mai e poi mai..una birra stratosferica..scurissima,una quadrupel classica..bella schiuma densa e compatta che resiste fino alla fine lasciando dei bellissimi merletti di bruxelles..aroma complesso,unico direi..sentori di caffé,caramello,floreale,luppolo,frutta secca..gusto altrettanto complesso e complicato,carbonazione ottimale,retrogusto dolce e amaro giusto alla fine fine..10 gradi alcolici spettacolari..!! bevuta allelfo

come per la stille nacht anche questa birra è stata assaggiata in versione vintage al kulminator.. pannepot 2005 quindi 8 anni invecchiata..rispetto alla stille nacht mantiene una frizzantezza più elevata e una leggera punta di amaro,ma si avvicina inesorabilmente allessere un liquore e non più una birra!

Bottle of the 2006 thanks to Dany for me never mentioning that thing he did with the horse that time in Brugges.  Pours a rather hazy and murky brown with a thin white head.  Big plums and chewy malt on the nose, soft and sweet, lots of depth, picking up hints of cocoa and chocolate, roast and candy.  Medium to thick bodied, chewy malt and candy, soft warming alcohol and plums, light oxidization and malt.  Finishes with lingering malt and candy, warm smooth yeast and touches of plums.  Very nice stuff.

Porter-colored with a moderate tan head, decent retention.  Aroma kind of underwhelmed me.  Slight roasty and chocolate notes and some fruity notes, if a blind sniff test Id probably have guessed it belonged to a more inferior brew.  Just didnt grab me by the nose.  Flavor is much more profound, with thick and rich dried dark fruit characters, the spices come through but without throwing off the flavors, and a cocoa character that sets in as the finish grips the taste buds into a lingering resiny-hop ending.

33cl bottle: 2010 vintage. Pours deep, deep brown (near black) with thin but lasting off-white/tan head; plenty of lacing throughout. Aroma is rich overripe dark fruits, vinous notes, dark chocolate, spices, burnt brown sugar - wonderful. Taste is incredibly good: first up comes a lovely hit of dark chocolate, quickly giving way to a blast of dark fruits, berries, vinous notes, heavy brown sugar, earthy spice notes & yeast complexity. Slight boozy warmth as it goes down, but alcohol is perfectly integrated into this beaut of a beer. Lingering deep fruity aftertaste. Perfect natural carbonation and all round balance. This is an absolutely fantastic Belgian strong ale - one of the very best I've had.

#722
Schwarzes Bier mit wenig, braunem Schaum. Schönes malzwürziges Bouquet mit deutlicher Kaffeenote. Im Antrunk sehr spritig. Der Geschmack findet eigentlich nicht statt, geradezu ein Geschmacksloch! Vom alkoholdominanten Antrunk geht dieses Bier gleich über in einen langen Abgang nach Lakritze und Holz. Die Malzwürze und der Kaffee aus dem Aroma finden sich im Geschmack leider überhaupt nicht wieder. Die Flasche mit dem Segelboot ist hübsch. Die Aufschrift "Old Fishermans Ale" lässt an Fishermans Friend denken "Sind sie zu stark, bist du zu schwach!" Allerdings liegt das schlechte Abschneiden des Pannepot (Jahrgang 2009) ja nicht nur am (zu) hohen Alk.-Gehalt. Dieses Bier ist für mich schlichtweg zu grobschlächtig und unausgewogen.
	
Test vom 30.6.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,12,8,8,12,8 - 9,00

On tap. Dark pour, creamy persistent head, dense look. Initially dried fruit- mulberry, raisin aroma. Taste is some of the same fruitiness, more cherry, heavy licorice dose, some dark chocolate, hint of nuttiness, smooooooth. Hides the alcohol completely. Incredibly smooth and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, brown sugar, raisin, pruns and alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long sweet, fruity and warm finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Pours hazy Brown with a beige creamy head. Aroma of dried fruits and Sugar!!! Steel too.. Not really enjoyable

2010 bottle. Pours deep brown is a fluffy tan head that disspates to a halo of bubbles without lacing. Aroma is sweet raisins, chocolate, earthy fruit. Taste is big, oaky and boozy with an amazing splash of fresh coffee that comes out of nowhere on the tongue. Real nice and warming.

Whole Foods, Bowery 33cl ($6 or $7 or something like that): Pours a darkish brown with a light brown head that leaves swirls and stuff. Aroma is dark fruits, Belgian yeast, spices, and malty malts. Taste is rather complex. There is some spice. The hops are certainly present and give it a bite. Tastes kind of like rich, slightly chocolatey pastries. Alcohol is perfectly well covered. Mouthfeel is nice. Aftertaste is pretty dope. 2011 bottle.

Bottle marked 2007.  Dark brown/near black with good bubbly (noisy) tan head.  Aroma is deep red fruits, definite red wine character to it.  Plum, raisin, grape.  Taste shows a bit more malt character, bit of chocolate, raisin, and lots of treacle.  Syrupy mouthfeel.  Alcohol is an amplifier.  Sweetness in balance with bitterness, tartness.  A serious flavour bomb, this.  Meal in a cup.

Enjoyed at home. 2011 vintage in a tulip. Completing the Pannepot line of beers from struise. 

A - Poured a nearly black out of the bottle. Black in the glass with a 2 finger head that fades slowly. 

S - Oak, spices, bready yeast and big dominating raisin scent.

T - Starts with a sort of oaky spice. This is followed by a very big brown sugar and date sweetness. Finish is slightly bitter, fruity and mellow

M - Nice carbonation, heavy body.

O - This is fantastic!
I taste the 2007 Reserva ,nice taste, perfect beer. Pity it is not available anymore(2007) best regards Paul

Its crazy to me that a bunch of Imperial Stouts that frankly arent that good are above this beer in the rankings.  This is where beer started and what its supposed to be.  I think it shows the range of the Belgian Strong Ale style that this and Duvel are in the same category.  Amazing beer.

33 cl bottle, brewed in 2010. Deep brown colour, a little auburn shine. Small head. Aroma is sweet and spicey, brown sugar, dark fruits, sweet malts. Taste is wow. Some sweet cherries in the beginning. Sweet liquorice. Finish is the least sweet, perhaps some bitterness. Quite heavy carbonation, no alcohol flavour. Sticky, but smooth mouthfeel. Heavy body.
What a beer! So much flavour going on in there, although I think the liquorice is a bit to predominant. Cant wait to taste the speciale reserva.

My personal favorite, is has a very rich aroma, consisting of a very clear licorice that quickly makes room for a nutmeg, cinnamon and slightly chocolate aroma. The high carbonation provides a full and long lasting taste.
2010. Nice red color in the pour. Not head retention but pretty while it lasted. Deep spicy aroma with a flavor dominated by dark fruits.  Delicious.

33cl bottle from Cervezorama, Madrid. Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. Fruity aroma with malt and dark, dried fruits. A hint of alcohol is noticable, but its pretty well integrated. Sweet and fruity with a pleasant raisin flavour. Complex and well balanced and an excellent dessert beer. (2012-09-15)

Dun brun presque noir, elle est accompagnée dune mousse beige qui imprègne dune dentelle les parois du verre. Des odeurs prononcées de mélasse, de vanille, de cannelle se signalent immédiatement, ce qui nous ouvre grand les yeux. Des élans de torréfaction sont aussi senties. La bouche est entièrement occupée par la concoction. On y retrouve du caramel dans les saveurs, des épices, encore de la cannelle ici, des élans de café et dalcool. Un équilibre rare, plus que réussi. Quel produit exceptionnel.
(Brassin 2010-Lot B MA 30-02-16) (343-100912)
Good strong and well-tasting beer. Not much lasting foam, but a good long-lasting taste (2009)
Great looking dark brew. Aroma of bread, chocolate, and roasted malt. Taste is amazing. A lot of depth. Dark fruits, bakers chocolate, and a coffee bitter aftertaste to balance the sweet front.

Bottle enjoyed while watching Breaking Bad. Pours a ruby cola with beige head and good lacing.  Great nose of dark fruits and mystery.  Tastes of figs, plums, cola, currants, earth, licorice, malt, dust, and brandy.  Its creamy on the palate and finishes dry and bitter.  This is wonderful brew

I tried this beer now two times. both the 2010 . I am in love :-) I am a lover of strong black beers and this one surprised me. It has a very thick foam, Taste is strong but soft and light sweet tone.

From a bottle, 2010 vintage, into a wine glass.  Cloudy dark pour with wispy tan head.  Aroma of yeasty bread and caramel.  Pleanty of carbonation. Hints of cherries, red currants and raisins  Slight bitterness to the aftertaste.  A really lovely beer.
Rich dark fruit, some spice but too interesting to pick out. Total treat . Some sweetness. Wow!

Dark brown coloured beer with medium diminshing brownish head and no carbonation visible. Malty roasted slight alcoholic hinted aroma. Full sparkling slight creamy palate. Finish is roasted malty sweet ending bitter dry. Very nice!

Bottle, pours an amber brown color, pretty dark with random light brown lacing and medium sized head. Scents are caramel, toast, pear, plum, cherry, wood, old bay, and hops. Taste is licorice, dark pitted fruits, sugar plum, figs, and misc spice. Lightly sour and roasty bitterness in close. Always an incredible beer.

Pours dark with a brown frothy head. Odour of roasted malt and caramel. Lively mouthfeel of chocolate malt and heavy fruits including cherry. Thick and chewy, so much in there its difficult to make it all out. Probably best as a winter warmer type of thing.

Bottle at home - 24/07/12.
Pours a murky dark brown colour with a very thin tan head that doesnt hang around.
Rich dark fruits assault the nose allied to dark sugars, molasses and caramel.
Taste as nose, cherry and plum in the fore then some dried fruits such as figs and prunes at the rear. A little spice.
Full bodied and thick verging on chewy but in a good way.
Warming alcohol finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Absolutely a fantastic complex brew. Nose has all the characteristics of an old ale, dark fruit, raisins, alcohol. Flavors along similar lines with a nice spiciness to support. Carbonated wonderfully, just enough to lift the beer and clear the palate to let the next sip roll across fully. Wonderful body, an all around fantastic beer... Especially wonderful to find for 6.99 at Whole Foods

Fruit, caramel, bread, and molasses in the aroma.  Flavor starts bready and sweet, with vanilla, coffee, and chocolate.  Some roast bitterness and just a little alcohol in the finish.  Ample carbonation gives this a really creamy mouthfeel.  Yet another great Belgian beer.
Dark colour. Rich spicy aroma mixed with fruit. Complex malty taste with plums raisins and liquorice. Complex but well balanced beer.
Hugely complex, like so many great Belgian beers. Raisin, fig, brown sugar, vanilla, spices and, of course, a healthy dose of Belgian yeast. Outstanding!

Mooie aroma's, diep donkere kleur en een lange stevige bittere afdronk. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.
Dark brown with a tan head. Brown sugar, raisins, plum, vanilla, coffee, and dark chocolate.

2011 bottle from railroad.  Pours dark brown with a finger and a half of tan head, uneven bubbles, and some sticky lacing.  The aroma has dark fruits, brown sugar, and a little alcohol.  There are faint notes of banana and butterscotch.  The taste is out of this world.  Sweet brown sugar, plums, a little bitterness on the finish.

the reason i drink brown beer ! i came to know this trough pannepot special reserva ! drank it at home, hevig hoekske ( antwerp ) , struise shop, de kelk,... was a little blown away by this one. for years i didnt want brown beer, i sipped this and had a new favourite beer ! im not a fan of the smell though.. its brown with a good foam ( filthy white ) with exactley the carbonation it needs. complex taste, you can drink it and after 10 times still discover new things ! you can drink it cold, or basement temprature. deserves its good name !

Bottle from 2011. Pours clear deep ruby-brown with a creamy medium thick brown head that slowly dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is malty, with notes of raisin and a touch of coriander and Belgian yeast. Taste is medium sweet malt, molasses, raisin, coriander, yeast, fruits. Somewhat alcoholic in body and finish; almost rum-like in flavor and the way that it warms the palate in the far finish. Rich, thick and velvety in the mouth. A very high quality beer that just misses my top 10.

2010 edition. Sampled from an 11.2 oz brown bottle this beer poured a cloudy very dark brown color with a large creamy dark tan head that left decent lacing. The aroma was malty and somewhat boozy with notes of molasses, fig and tobacco. The flavor was sweet molasses, cherry, raisin, and fig with undertones of wood and tobacco. There was a moderate boozy presence throughout that was a bit distracting. The finish was long molasses, cherry, fig and raisin. Full bodied. Excellent.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2013 Bottled. Pours brown with a brown head. Smells candy, sweet malty and raisins. Tastes sweet, candy, raisins, chocolate malty with a finish.

Bottle at 3 Små Rum july 20th 2012. 2010 Edition.

Dark brown color wityh espresso top head, small sparkles emerging up the glass walls, lovely. Good carbonation
Aroma of dried fruits, toffee, spices, apples, belgian yest. Sweet and roasty complex taste of coffee, caramel, chocolate, red wine, cardamom, fruits. Good viscocity and a great bitter warm finish. A great beer!
2010 vintage. Pours dark brown, peanut butter colored head that dissipates to thin sticky lacing. Booze, vanilla, figs, plums, raisins, chocolate. Nice sticky mouthfeel.

look: 3.5  smell: 4  taste: 4  feel: 5  overall: 4.5

2010 Bottle which pours a dark murky chestnut brown with a small head that vanished quickly and left very little lacing
Aromas of dark fruits, roasted malts, cola, caramel and yeasty spices. Tastes much like the aroma, lot more of the dark fruits. Prune, date, fig, caramel, and cola still there, roasted nuts are also apparent and add a nice balance and bitterness. The mouth feel is like a broken record with the Struise --> Perfect! Overall this is a wonderful beer but I still think is benefits from a year or two ageing.

33cl bottle poured into wine glass. Vintage: 2010 (BB: 24/09/2016). Enjoyed next to Pannepot Reserva (2009) and Pannepot Grand Reserva (2005). Pours deep brown. Single (light mocha) fingernail head on medium pour. Smells of fig, raisin, vanilla, molasses, and caramel. Touch of spice - cloves and nutmeg. Inviting! Taste follows smell with acute accuracy. Dark fruit and toffee sweetness are most pronounced, but very smooth, balanced, and rounded. Of the three enjoyed side-by-side, this received the lowest score - not because it is bad, but because I enjoyed the complexity of the other versions more. This is an excellent base beer and all-around very easy to drink! Urbain knows how to rock n roll.

330 ml bottle fromWhole Foods Market, Coddingtown, Santa Rosa, CA.. 2011 Edition. Pours an opaque black color and a marvelous light brown head that never decreases. Aroma of roasted malts shows notes of dark espresso, molasses, roasted brown sugar, cocoa beans, milk, oats and vanilla. I found it similar to a highly refined Imperial Stout. Delicious sweet flavors and a spicy touch. Medium roastiness in the finish. Notes of latte, chocolate, cane sugar, vanilla and Irish Whisky Cream. Wonderful and highly drinkable. Big body but the beer is too drinkable for its ABV. Great balance. Creamy texture. Another sipper drank a day after Hair of the Dog Adam: Different but I still cant decide which one I liked better.

2011 bottle from Capones. Pours dark brown to black. nose is dried fruit, burnt sugar, star anise and black strap molasses. first sipis is roasted flavorr, yeasty strong ale flavors, sambuca, dried plums and corn sugar. finish is nice with a mild dark chocolat e flavors

On bottle at Amundsen, vintage 2008.
Dark amber, some foam.
Malty dried fruit aromas
Full body & high complexity.
Immediate sweetness, balanced by bitterness. Lingering aftertaste. 
Complexity & alcohol provides good balance to dried fruit aromas.
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the best dark beers i have had. Imperial porter? Pours a small brown head, disapears quickly. Very nice mouthfeel. Alchohol well hidden, but appears quickly after a few bottles.. Balanced, complex and quite easy to drink.

On tap at Bottleworks. Pours black with little to no head (like a big BBA beer). Smell is sweet rum and dark fruits. Taste is rich, sweet, coffee, vanilla, fig, raisin, and a roasty finish, creamy. Very complex, minimal alcohol, highly drinkable, great beer.

2010 Bottle. A dark brown to black with big tan Head that is lasting. Aroma is dark dried fruits (raisins, dates, prunes) a whiff of sea salt, big oak character, a syrupy sweetness like a dark fruit jam or something. Flavor follows with a fairly full mouthfeel and flavors of fruit, not quite sticky but syrupy certainly. If I poured it over vanilla ice cream I imagine it would be a phenomenal experience. Flavors add spiciness, peppery, but around that chocolate blackberry or plum first noticed in the nose.  Belgian yeast and candy sugars come in a dark molasses kind of way. The kind of beer Id want to drink off the beach in Nantucket on a cooler August night. Always has been one my true beer loves for many years.This beer so dark and delicate is a dessert on its own and maybe tomorrows breakfast shall be another.
brown, black, clear, tan foam, roasty, alcohol, soy sauce, cough drop, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, average carbonation,
brown, black, clear, brown foam, caramel, roasty, chocolate, coffee, medium body, oily feel, medium bitterness,

caramel, malty sweet with a load of spices. Foam is very creamy and long lasting. Sweet, spicy and very complex taste. Stout malts give it a roasty taste. Spices completes this wonderful beer into an Amazing one. Thumbs up for sure

On draft... pours a deep dark brown with a tinge of ruby, nice off white three finger head.  The aromas were a bit sublte... Roasted malts, figs and hints of earthy herbs.  On the palate this one packs a punch of flavors; raisins, dark cherries, burnt sugar, molasses and a touch of earthy woody nut flavors on the finish. Yum

2007 bottle gifted from drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

The pour is a very dark brown with a gargantuan tan head that has the appearance of whipped meringue. A nice sheet of lacing is left, coating the glass pretty well. Aromas consist of dark fruits, Belgian yeast, various spices, subtle cherries, and alcohol. This beer is quite tasty, and certainly a good example of a quad. Spices add an interesting aspect to the overall flavor. The feel is slightly sticky and sweet with a little warming alcohol kick in the finish. Good stuff.

Poured from 11.2oz bottle to tulip glass, 2011 vintage:

Pours a nice medium coffee brown with a soft mocha head that retains forever.

Complex on the nose for sure... Belgian style dark fruit character with layers of roasted malts and coffee. Some all spice, nutmeg, basic spice profile. Some fig/date/raisin. Some Belgian yeast far beneath.

Overripe dark fruits, some vanilla bits, there is still a very attractive hop profile at work, some sweet funky notes like cherry and more fig. A touch of coffee off in the distance. A wonderful, tasty beer.

Overall, a must try for most any beer lover.

2009 bottle from Jim Spahr, who sent a whole bunch of beer back from Belgium.  Nice carbonation out of the bottle.  Big tan head, slowly dissipated.   Beer is brown with garnet highlights.  Smells of alcohol; boozy.  Great flavor - some caramel, a little chocolate and a hint of roastiness.  The barrel-aging seems to work with this one well - I dont think the wood stole any of the flavor.
Bottle, pours dark brown with thin head. Aroma is dried fruits, dark fruits, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla and spices. Taste is like aroma with some alcohol and sweet malts. Very nice BSA!
Great nose and mouthfeel. Flavours were molasses, yeast, spices, earthy and bread.
170811: spicy dark Belgian ale, reminiscent of a Belgian Christmas beer. The seasoning mixture are different. dark, complex and spicy beer.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 Rated on June 4th, 2012.

This ones been aging six years now, and I thought it would grand time to revisit it, along with the Grand Reserva version. 

Pours a dark marroon red. Within the highlights one sees a certain clarity to the beer, unlike Westvleterens typical chunkiness. The frothy off-white head dissipated quickly leaving behind a soft stream of bubbles that trail to the rim of the glass.

The smell is vivid, deep but with bright notes of cherries and pipe tobacco. Dark malty undertones of bitter unsweetened chocolate and coffee beans softened with creamy vanilla. Finds itself more aligned with St. Bernardus in the nose, although even brighter perhaps. As the beer warms up, plum, caramel and some wispy alcoholic tones appear. 

The first sip is unctuous, thick, rich with smoky tobacco flavors that roll onto the tongue in a wave of syrupy sweetness. The slight carbonation tingles as a burst of cherry and caramel develops. Smoothly the Pannepot transitions off the palate and into a long and powerful finish. 

Pannepot is one of those few beers that manages to balance amazing complexity with a punchy distinctive flavor that doesnt lose its focus. Its the difference between a symphony and a cacophony. I think of this brew as a true counterpart to our favorite trappists. I wouldnt call myself a believer, but the Pannepot truly invokes a spiritual feeling.

My biggest thanks to Urbain and Carlos for an incredible experience.

--- 

Updated September 7, 2016. Ten year anniversary of my batch of Pannepot from my first trip to Struise. 

Pours a dark purplish black with a lively, frothy, lacy cream head. Smells divine. Loads of overripe prunes soaked in brandy, or maybe port? Rich and balanced. Chocolate, blackberries, black currants, rounded by a small amount of oaky vanilla. A hint of licorice. Thick molasses, dark fruits, and a wisp of smokiness coming from the roasted mocha-flavored malts. The carbonation is subtle but present, adding the perfect tingly fluffy texture to this truly magnificent brew. Im simply floored by how this beer has aged, I give it the exact same marks as 5 years ago. I have a batch of 2006 from the neighboring monks at Westvleteren that hasnt done nearly as well!

Ringrazio Elio che mi ha stappato una delle bottiglie delle ultime bottiglie che ha a disposizione alla Pecora e il Luppolo di Mosciano..birra unica dal colore nero con schiuma color nocciola. Laroma è di tostato liquirizia, caffè e cioccolato. In bocca nonostante i suoi 10° scende che è una meraviglia.Ottima

Bottle. Really dark brown, almost black, thin tan head. Incredible nose, somehow both resinous and citrus, red fruit, vanilla, strawberry, blackcurrant - fruity, in other words, but amazingly wide-ranging - with a hint of chocolate, proper black forest gateau, and a touch of roast. Amazing. 

Anyway, deep breath, new paragraph. Flavours: black forest gateau is to the fore here, really noticeable combination of the jammy and the chocolatey. Theres a good deal of plumminess but its all about that spicy characteristic, almost like very high quality chili chocolate. If I have one, worthlessly churlish criticism, its that its a touch steely up front, probably due to the youth of it. Overall, totally, gorgeous.

Bottle. Pours  mahogany with a small light tan head. Aroma of toffee, dark fruit, spicy yeast and a bit of alcohol. Flavor of raisins, a tart yeast bite, burnt sugar and not hardly any booze.  Lively carbonation that lends to tangy mouthfeel.  Great brew.

pours jet black, small head, thin micro CO2 retention. Heavy caramel malts on the nose. A rich malted caramel flavour up front, transitions into figs, dates, prunes, chocolate. Medium-high depth, medium complexity, good transitions, great depth, good drinkability. Quite a heavy beer, the malts and richness weigh you down while the ABV hits hard but stealthily.

Tasted this in the Delirium Cafe, Brussels in April 2012. 2010 vintage. 33cl bottle. Pours a dark oily black in colour with a thick tan head. Strong liquorice notes are long in the intensity. Thick oily mouthfeel and good lacing. Dark malts give a distinct flavour of black treacle and liquorice with roasted undertones. Difficult to detect any hop resins in the aftertaste as the dark malts overwhelm the flavours. Finish is strong and robust with dark malt to the fore. Sweet liquorice flavours still forever present in the dry, moreish finish. A  well crafted Belgian Strong Ale but not as good as Rochefort 10 in my opinion though.

Bottle from Struise webshop. 2010 vintage. Pours chestnut brown with a small off white head. Nose is very sweet and lightly spiced. A touch of candy sugar there with soft notes of hay. A little too sweet for me. Taste begins with milk chocolate and spices with lightly charred malts. Everything works well and transitions nicely but its not amazing. A good beer though

750ml bottle. Malty, candy, and spice aromas. Pours dak copper,with average white head, some lacing and persistance. Medium body and average carbonation. Taste is malty, herbal, candy, some berries... really complex, but very well balanced, being tasty and non saturating. Very enjoyable.

tastes a hell of a lot like rochefort 10, only less subtle. a big chewy malty and spicy ale, as brown as a beer can taste brown: gravy, chocolate, mole sauce, brown sugar, etc. rich and opulent to a degree few belgian beers attempt (perhaps why its a ratebeer sort of beer) but still dry. the thing that is really cool about it is a kind of winelike fruity sourness that winds the palate up. salty too. plenty of coriander evident, maybe something peppery too. perhaps a bit heavy where i like belgian ales to be zippy and frothy and phenolic.

Amazing ale. If you run across this ale don't pass it up!!! Delicious..............................

- via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cafe, caramelo, chocolate.... sabe a todo en la boca, pero sin cansar nada. Un cervezón.
Bottle from Belgisk Bryg. Dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, alcohol, spice, fruit and chocolate.
tulip. dark brown with small creamy head. Smell like a cherry candy, mint, caramel. Taste of dark fruits, some coffee. Moderate sweetness and lightly sour.

2010 vintage A - pours deep dark cola brown with small tan head. Strong lacing. S - complex rich aromas of abt quad. Bitter chocolate, cocoa nibs, cinnamon, dark roasted malts. Notes of dark fruit, molasses, dough. Very complex, dark aromas. Lightly bitter licorice notes.  M - rich dark abt quad style. Full and dark with an interesting tang at the end. T - roasted malts and bitter chocolate up font. doughy notes, dark fruits, oaky, cola syrup on the palate. Pinot noir and raw cacao fruit tang on the end. O - very good Belgian brew. Alcohol is well hidden. 8

Nov 2009: Brown 33cl bottle (2007 version, PNP No4) obtained from De Bierboom beershop in Brugge.

Poured into my Westmalle chalice and reviewed while eating a brown breadroll filled with Wiltshire cured ham and lettice (no pickles or anything strong).

Dark, very dark brown, ruby/black with a thin tan coloured head on top, poured the whole bottle in, so some sediment could just be seen sinking to the bottom of the glass as the beer settled down. A thick collar stayed during the review, the thin head turning into a couple of wispy islands.

A slight vingarous aroma was evident at first, then liquorice and toasted/roasted malts, coffee notes too.

Liqourice dominated the taste for me, with a spicey coffee aftertaste once the liquorice subsided a little.

Rich and warming body, the alcohol is well hidden and you would never guess 10%ABV without reading the label. A sweetness arrives in the aftertaste, not coying, but this isnt a sour Belgian.

The weather outside is cold, wet and windy, this beer is an ideal friend to watch the rain with, as it batters against the windowpain trying to get in.

Bottle. After a few years this baby got opened.  Lots of caramel flavor and dark fruits.  I like how this beer seems to be getting really complex and is hiding the 10%.  Will need to get a few more for the cellar.

750 ml bottle, vintage 2007, tasted 04/04/2012.  Pours opaque maroon, ample beige head recedes to splotchy suds.  Aroma is heavy with raisins, prunes, black cherries and other dark fruit, candi sugar, lightly roasted dark malts with ginger, cinnamon, other spices, hint of alcohol.  Taste is more prune forward, rich dark malts with cinnamon sugar glaze, touch of licorice, mild bitter finish.  Moderate palate, but excellent carbonation for a light spritzy feel which compliments the sweetness well.  A little bit of age on this is amazing, excellent and complex.

330ml bottle. Dark amber/brown with a thin cap. Aroma featuring plums, chocolate, honey and sugar, amongst other things. Mouthfeel is so smooth and balanced that you almost dont notice it. Lots of chocolate in the taste, with a booze-soaked black cherry fruitiness. Spices and alchohol heat as it finishes. I thought spices might feature more prominently to be honest. Very good beer and I look forward to sampling the Grand Reserva I picked up.

Bottle, 25cl @ De Wiering, Leuven.
Dark brown with nice tan creamy head.
Caramel, a bit alcohol, fruit, banana aroma. Makes you want to drink it!
Contains some bittersweetness (chocolate.), syrup, roasted, warm tasteful finish.
Nice mouthfeel, a bit sparkling but thick bodied.

ballz big beer! Pours "Ajid" black with a stupid wide open mouth toothy grin of roped cap. Aroma is massive raisin, licorice, cherry, toffee. Oh fudge my fuck packer. This is yummers. Taste is plum, cherry, wood, caramel, licorice, cinnamon. How this is just a Belgian Strong... this is the filipino tree midget fighter that mauls the hell outta big boy quads. The end.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2013 330ml 2010 bottle from Bierzwerg. Pours deep dark colour on Chimay chalice. Aroma is fruity. Really compex and well balanced beer. Flavour is spices, candy sugar.
2010 vintage. Pours dark, dark brown with macchiato-coloured head. Raisin, toffee aroma. Very rich, spicy caramel and coffee flavour, dried fruit, quite dry. Very good.
Une des meilleures bières bues à vie! Arôme: épices et petits fruits. Gout bien équilibré. Fort agréable en bouche.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2012 Bijna zwart van kleur met een flinke vaste kraag die lang blijft. Aroma van  mout, chocolade, hout en appeltaart. Véél body en een smaak van donkergebrande mout , pure chocolade en sokkerpaek.  Goede nasmaak.  Heavy bier.
UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 dark brown black coloured body with a off white head a spicy roasted malty aroma a spicy roasted malty sweet fruity caramel taste with a alcholic sweet bitter finish

2008 bottle, from PaulHegedus - thanks!  Pours pretty much black with thin lacing.  Aroma has burnt sugar, caramel, molasses, raisins, and dates.  The taste has pretty much everything: sweet burnt sugar, raisins, spices, chocolate, coffee, and a warm clean finish.  Nice full body with good carbonation.  An outstanding beer!

a rare find at Little Bear. Pours out a dark rich copper root beer brown. Aromas of figs brandy and plums. Tastes of plums cherries   and roasted malts. A quality  quad which finishes smooth and leaves you loning for more. You should definitely seek this one out.

2011 bottle from Julios Liquors in MA. Wonderfully appealing frothy head over a beguiling dark liquid. Aroma is outstanding, notes of currants and figs immediately, almost begging me to take a swig. Taste is a well-balanced oily mix of brandy, vanilla bean, chocolate and booze. A really top-class quad.
Bottle. Rich brown, lighter head. Candi of course, yeast, spices, fruits (not all dark - hint of banana), bubblegum. Wonderfully complex, not extreme. Nothing to change - refined.
Man, what can I say.  Simply fantastic.  Dark fruits, malt and booze.  Balanced and excellent!!

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2012 One of my favorate beers on the planet! Deep, dark and complex. Tremendous rich dark fruit flavors. Raisin. Date. Candied orange peel. Nutmeg. Lots of wonderful variation year to year. Bit thinner than the Reserva version,but still not to be missed on draft!

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2014 330 ml bottle, 2010 vintage, tried again April 2013. Pours dark brown with light, smooth, foamy head. Aromas of roasted malts, light caramel, and possibly a bit of chocolate. Thick and full, almost stout-like. Flavors are nutty, with elements of dark fruit, spices and burnt caramel.. Very complex and rich. These guys know how to brew great beer. 

Adding notes for original 2004 that was brewed at Caulier - sampled May 2014 at the Kulminator. 
Pours perfect - dark reddish brown with moderate retentive foamy head. Aromas of rich malts, nutty brownies, and cola.
Flavors of a sweet abbey Dubbel. Actually very sweet for the years, with lots of candy sugar, raisins, sweet malts and a hint of spice. Approaching a 5.
Pours an almost purple shade of brown with almost no head. Nose & taste are of dark fruit and spices. Not a game changer for me, but very solid.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 Bottle @Café FrapeWhat a pleasant surprise to find this at a bar in Maastricht! Maybe not the best rating, for I probably had too many beers before tasting this one. And unfortunately it was served too cold.Dark brown, nice beige head. Not too much aroma (probably because of the low temperature) Taste is malty caramel, spices, dried dark fruits. Full-bodied beer, nicely carbonated. It disappointed me a bit. I think I have to rerate this sometime.
Dark brown colour with thin beige head. It smells to coffe, chocolate ando some liquourice. Taste is sweet, also with coffe and chocolate notes and some alcohol in the end,

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2012 2010 bottle at North Bar, Leeds (Lowlands Festival). Pours a deep, deep brown, no head. Aroma us stunning - a bag of liquorice, drumstick lollies, malts. Taste is liquorice, coffee, malts and spices (clove, some juniper and cinnamon). Great mouthfeel, perfect low carbonation. Nice long-ish finish, too. Nothing jumps out at you other than the fact that this is an extremely well-considered whole. Like a concept album. Seriously, seriously good.

Bouteille de 33 cl. Vintage 2010. Couleur noir dencre de Chine.
Un peu comme la mer du Nord à La Panne un soir dhiver avec des 
nuages noirs dorage ... De Pannepot, the old fishermans ale, OK.
Ambiance donc pour démarrer ma seconde dégustation de cette bière,
mieux reposée que ma première absorbée trop tôt après avoir voyagé
(seulement 14 jours, un peu "just") Ici je vois tout de suite la différence 
dès la première bouche. 
Moralité : toujours laisser 3 semaines à ses bières avant dégustation
au calme chez soi ...
Arômes identiques au premier essai : grains de café (du meilleur arabica, et bien torréfié par un vrai torréfacteur), cannelle, porto tawny,
et une pointe de pain dépices.
Première bouche avec une infinité de nuances sur le café, et surtout une
impression réellement massive sur ce goût (mais un peu moins que lors de mon premier essai "remué"), de la chicorée aussi (celle dOrchies dans le Nord de la France, le jour où lusine fait la fabrication....
vous devez absolument y aller), de lorge, des prunes, des fruits secs,
un zeste dorange et du pampelemousse en rétronasal. Superbe.
Seconde bouche sur la cannelle, le pruneau, la poire, la figue, les
amandes et le blé....
Troisième bouche où le café revient mais en finesse, des grains moulus, et une pointe de cognac. Alors là, cest le pompon..., le "top of 
the game", le côté magistral de cette bière.
Une finale comme une veillée de Noël au coin du feu, en douceur et un
peu en rêve dans les yeux.
Si la bière vous apporte cela, vous pouvez dire que vous avez dans votre
verre le top du savoir-faire, lexcellence dun produit et le résultat dun art
aux bases millénaires.
Merci aux Struise, et vive le "fisherman on the old boat with the Pannepot
in his hands" , and his troat ....
Bottle at work.  Dark brown with a proud tan head. A very well balanced beer.  Candy, bubblegum and booze. Warming and quite present alcohol. Very delicious.

From bottle. Very dark brown with tight tan head. Aroma has candi, yeast esters, dark fruit, bubblegum, banana. Taste is similar, fruity yeast esters, ripe fruit, hint of chocolate or molasses, light spices. Well balanced and easy going. Decent

Birra marrone scuro con schiuma cremosa color nocciola. Laroma è di malto con note di frutti scuri e un leggero sentore legnoso. In bocca si presenta con un bel corpo con sapori di tostato, crosta di pane e un leggero sentore amaro. Veramente ottima.

Highly carbonated dark brown in color with thin beige head. Chocolate aroma with red wine and whiskey notes. Complex chewy and sweet malty palate with multiple layers of flavor: raisins, molasses, cinnamon The finish has a ginger like quality.

Rich almost purple color with raisin aroma and minimal head. Smooth, thick body, with fruity notes some spice. Stays smooth all the way through the finish with a nice tiny bit of heat at the end to bring you back.

Bottle shared with ClubGonzo, always a pleasure. Has a pretty deep and cloudy brown colour with a light brown head. The aroma is heavenly and  complex where I sence dried fruit (more than Ive ever senced in any other beer), raisins, brown sugar, milk chocolate, cherry, sweet biscuits, something burned, and some perfume like the hint of alcohol. The taste feels in a way easier with more obvious signs of dried fruit and alcohol, but also sweet malt reminiscent of roasted almonds, often usuall in the Christmas period, and some caramel. Yes, this could be well suited on Christmas Eve. A full-bodied beer with a nice medium bitterness with a nice dose of carbonation that plays on the tongue. Without doubt a quality beer that is both round and very pleasant to drink.

From notes.  First reviewed 10/9/2011.  Poured from a 330 mL bottle into a tulip.

Out of the bottle Pannepot has a very dark brown hue with cashew edges and a dollop of tan froth. The head retains nicely and leaves fluffy lace on the glass.

The aroma is actually not as powerful as I would have thought. Raisins, plums, gooey caramel, clove, and licorice are all present.

The trademark of Struise beers seems to be how well the flavors blend together, and this is no exception. It takes a good amount of concentration to pull out the flavors. Up front raisins and plums stand out from the other dark fruits and are touched with some sweet caramel and unsweetened chocolate. The spice character ranges from clove and anise to all spice and cinnamon. Toward the finish a bit of orange peel and a flourish of alcohol wind down the sip.

Although it looks thick and has a high ABV, this does not drink very heavy. The smooth and creamy feel is only interrupted by a soft alcohol prick on the tongue. Although there is some sweetness to start, it dries out a fair amount by the end of the sip. Medium carbonation and a medium body overall.

Struise make so many quality beers that I have high expectations going into each new one I try. This is nice, but I dont think it quite lives up to my lofty expectations.
Drank this one in Bruges, Belgium and enjoyed it very much. It has a nice balance, not too bitter and an overall very good taste.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours brown, with very low brown head, fully diminishing. Aroma is of sugar, spices, some alchool. Tastes spices, sugar, alchool (warming), and a good touch of caramel. Well balanced, and very warming. A very good, complex beer.

Pour is a dark brown with a small white head.  Aroma is lots of dark fruit with a huge brown/candi sugar.  Sugar coated plums? Flavor is rich, thick and very flavorful.  More dark fruit with some sugar and figs.  This is a very flavorful and heavy beer but the alcohol is no problem.  Very Abt like and more flavorful then most.

Bottle (thanks RamyG4). Pours dark hazy mahogany with a fluffy khaki colored head that slowly fades to a foamy film. Aroma is spiced bananas cinnamon figs and plums. Taste is malty spice like above with candied burnt sugar and a little tobacco and finishes smooth and warming. Palate is full sticky and finishes chalky dry and warming.

Pour very deep brown with a thick off white head. Aroma is very complex. Caramel and yeast are the primaries, but there is some butterscotch and raisin as well. Medium to full mouthfeel. Carbonation is light with fine bubbles. Flavor is warm and bready. Raisins and alcohol are followed by smooth toffee and the finish is slighty fruity.
This might be more impressive than the reserva.  Mild aroma that is still nuanced with spice and malt.  Beautiful dark caramel/black appearance.  Taste is smooth and balanced.  This is beer.

Cloudy brown pour with small tan head. Aroma of ripe fruit, caramel and belgian yeast. Taste is fruity with raisin, plum, cherry coming through and a touch of caramel. Not overly sweet though, and a perfect carbonation. Flavors intensified as it warmed also. Excellent beer, one of the best out there.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2012 "Oh! mio Dio" è questa lesclamazione dopo il prima sorso. Birra complessa. Di primo acchito si sente il malto tostato poi vengono a valanga un infinità di sapori che riempiono la bocca, tra cui caffè e caramello e perchè no anche di mela. Buon dialogo tra questa miriade di sapori. Una punta di amaro sul finale rende la birra molto persistente. La nave sulletichetta naviga nel gusto. Assolutamente da provare.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2012 Bottle 330 ml [2010]. Appereance: Pours brown with a medium brown head. Good lacing. Aroma: Bunch of spices, cinnamon (?), dry fruits, sugar.   Taste: Spices, caramel, dry fruits, plum... explosion of taste. Overall: Wow! A wonderful brew, so tasty, complex and well balanced. Just amazing.

Dark brown color and nice bubbly head. Not much of an aroma but pleasant. Very smooth and silky on the palate. Alcohol is very well hidden and kind of nutty for a Belgium beer. Nice sweet aftertaste too. Very unique for this style.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.

Bottle 2011 vintage, compliments of Stoutragious.  Appearance is exceptional with perpetual head produced by consistent carbonation from the bottom of the glass.  Understated aroma.  Flavors of cherry, dried fruit, Belgian malt and spices.  A true Belgian Strong Ale in strong showing. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011 bottle. Pours opaque brown, small tan head. Aroma of raisins, prunes, some darker coffee notes. Taste is just awesome. Sweet malts and sugars, dark fruits, yeast, a classic belgian taste. The transition from front-end to back end is so smooth, bitterness lingers long after the sweetness has subsided. Alcohol not noticeable at all (until I stood up). Great beer!

Dark ruby cola color with half inch head in Chimay glass, medium carbonation, notes of fig molasses cherry to name a few, alcohol very well hidden, world class Belgian sipper

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2009 edition, On Tap @ ACBF 2011

The beer in the glass is a deep dark brown with a nice creamy head. Smells yeasty-sourish, with lots of roasted malts. The beer starts malty-sweet, a slight alcoholic note comes through. The finish is again malty sweet, some plum, generally very long-lasting. The further course has ahint of coffee, along with some acidic fruit (plum, fermented grapes).

2010 bottle very dark brown with a large tanned head. aroma is sweet, chocolate, raisin, dark brown sugar, some wine notes. taste is smooth and sweet, very little carbonation, and hardly any alcohol warmth. finish is complex, spicy, with restrained (coffee) bitterness. cherries, chocolate and cinnamon are abundant. its fantastic.

Great brown color. Love the way strong Belgians look in the Rochefort chalice. Sweet, fruity smell. Almost strawberry. Hits the front of your tongue hard, then mellows into a very smooth, plum, raisin, spicy finish. There is good balance in the sweetness. This one might go on the shelf. Great brew.

Bottle, 2010 vintage, into Bruery tulip. About time I tick this.

A - Pours black mocha-colored head, thin ring, thin film on top.

S - Struise yeasty malty sweetness, dark fruits, plums, raisins, candies. The booze is well-hidden the by the big sugary sweetness...not sure if thats good or bad. Pretty sweet.

T - Candy, spices, sweet dark fruit, slight boozy kick. More plums, raisins, figs, etc. Again, pretty darn sweet but I do get more booze on the palate when compared to the nose, so at least theres a little more going on here. Finish is an oaky fruity sweetness.

M - Full, smooth, good carbonation, dry oak finish.

O - A little too sweet and slightly boozy right now. I think the 2010 vintage needs some more time to smooth out and loose some of the overpowering sugary sweetness. I picked out some spices, but I think its too sweet to really appreciate them at this time. Its a nice beer, but no where near world-class for me.

Bouteille de 33cl. Millésime 2010. Bière brune peu de mousse. Le nez est exubérant, lalcool transporte les effluves de raisins secs, fruits, chocolat, vanille et vin rouge. Difficile de faire mieux. La bouche est tout aussi superbe. Les saveurs chocolatées côtoient le vin. Lalcool est chaud et savoureux. Franchement difficile de faire mieux.

330 mL bottle at St. Veronus.  Brown with a big, sticky beige head.  The aroma is great, with spice and dark fruit and all of the usual stuff, but it doesnt prepare you for the wonder that is the flavour.  Wow!  Brown sugar, dried fruit, alcohol, spice, molasses.  Great body.  Outstanding beer.

2008 Bottle that I brought back home from Belgium, Chimay glass. Very dark color. Beige head, aroma of raisin, chocolate, and caramel maltiness. Very delicious roasty chocolate covered cherries. Ive never had a fresh bottle to compare it to, but this is delicious. Great after dinner treat. Yum.

Our Aussie suds expert dreamt blebs of smoked hickory and his favorite yeast extract, Vegemite. Gremlins and geraniums germinating raw barley and wheat follow the initial nose adding to the complexity. The liquor pours thick and visceral, not unlike Nigels (see above) round Smooth Churlish belly. Sour chocolate milk permeates and sticks on the palate and into the nasal cavities as the lace finely winds down the inside of the goblet. Pleasant palate of Kirsch, bubble gum and aged Gouda shows lots of secondary development in the 2007 vintage Pannepot. This has been sleeping in our governments climate controlled warehouse for the past 4 years adding to the complexity of this beer. And people said beer will never age like wine. Pfffffffff

Bottle. Deep mahogany with a small light tan head. Big aroma of toffee, dark fruit, spicy yeast and a bit of alcohol. Flavor of dark burnt sugar, raisins, a tart yeast bite with no alcohol taste. Medium body with lively carbonation that explodes in your mouth and gives a frothy mouth feel. This is a great beer, lots of sweet dark sugary malt and fruit with a nice tartness from the yeast.

Ma guardate una birra decisamente sopravalutata... A me non ha per niente entusiasmato, troppo fredda non e buona e sa di liquerizia, 
mano a mano che si arriva alla temperatura di servizio, 12 grradi centigradi, le cose migliorano, si sentono anche alri sapori di spezie ma la liquerizia e sempre e cmq troppo troppo dominante...

(33 cl, 2010)  Un liquide à la robe brune limpide.  Un petit col mousseux qui résiste quelques secondes.  Au nez, dexcellents parfums fruités avec des élans chocolatés.  Un arôme de café qui caresse les narines avec une pointe vanillée.  Des malts vraiment intéressants.  Un alcool qui transporte des fruits : on dirait une liqueur servie dans les grands salons.  Des saveurs très douces mais balancées.  Des malts qui parlent.  Un profil chocolaté avec des flaveurs délicates de café.  Du sucre candi et du caramel en doses intelligentes.  Un caractère fruité complexe.  Des saveurs réconfortées par un alcool floral.  Un côté épicé peut-être attribuable aux houblons utilisés.  Une bouche confortable, un liquide bien crémeux et habilement traversé par les bulles.  Le savoir-faire belge.  Une finale complexe, riche et longue sur un alcool fruité et vinique.  Chapeau bas à cette succulente bière.

Bottle.  2008.  Poured into a snifter.  Beautiful dark, red and brown colour.  Creamy brown head with great retention.  Fig in the aroma with brown sugar and black currant leading to toffee, black licorice, cinnamon, and freshly baked gingerbread.  Full bodied and incredibly smooth.  Dark fruits, especially raisin and more fig in the flavour, with some mild tobacco, molasses and dark cocoa.  Long malty finish.
I told Carlo from Struise to stop experimenting with Pannepot ( reserva, ...) because its already perfect! Nuff said!

Aroma of raisins, brandy soaked spice cake, molasses, dark chocolate. Appearance is black with tan head. Flavor matches the nose, but with a little waffle cone and coffee notes peaking in, especially coffee. Palate is bubbly and terminates chewy. The finest beer to yet touch my lips.

Von Beginn an bietet das Bier grasige und eine Vielzahl von Kräuteraromen, die sich um das karamellige Malzaroma versammeln. Die Komplexität ist enorm, dabei ist zu keiner Zeit auch nur annähernd der Alkoholgehalt erahnbar. Im Mittelteil wird das Malz noch vollmundiger, Schokoladennoten, ein Touch von Whiskey. Geringe Bitterkeit im Abgang, Kaffeenoten, erstmals ist ein Alkoholhauch erkennbar. Geringe Süße, das Malz im Nachgeschmack ist zunehmend schokoladiger. Super! 12/14/13/14/12/14

2010 bottle. Deep reddish brown with a modest tan head. The aroma is filled with dark fruits, tart cherries, caramel, brown sugar. The taste is very rich, malty, sweet. The finish is lightly bitter, a bit of espresso acidity. Loads of flavor yet remains clean. Alcohol hidden very well. Lively carbonation. Overall, legitimately excellent.
Wonderful Belgian style beer. strong caramel and sweet boozy aroma and flavor. Clean and complex.

Full bodied flavor. Intense aroma. Cant really place the flavor, but its heavy and sweet and has a slightly bitter aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 bottle  . pours near black with a thick tan head that lingers .sweetish aroma but not pronounced . taste - wow !  very rich syrupy fruit cake  port start moves into a more burnt toffee slightly bitter finish with the 10% abv coming through , pleasantly warming . moderate carbonation maybe could be up a touch . great sipping beer for a special occasion. in my top 5

2008 bottle.  1 finger of head.  Cola colour.  Aroma of spices, dark fruits.  Plum raisin and malt up front. A bit faded.  Lots of dried dark druit - plum, raisin fig and dried red grape.  Spices complement the dried dark fruit.  Low carbonation.  Medium body.  Sweet but not cloying.
Produces a somewhat greasy feel on the lips. A taste of liquorice remains in the mouth. Lovers of hoppy beers will less appreciate this kind of beer..

2010 Bottle.  Pours dark brown with minimal head.  Nose is super sweet and smells like ripe dark fruits.  Plums and belgian candy sugar dominate then the hops balance it out with a slightly bitter finish.  The flavor lingers on the pallet for quite some time after the sip.  This is an amazing beer.   Crisp and clean.

Very dark brown color. Very complex aroma with dark fruits, coffee, alcohol. The taste is dominated by dark fruits and roasted malts. I also sense a bit of burned wood in the background. It finish with a tartness, that I dont think fits this otherwise very nice beer.

2006 bottle. Pours a really dark mahogany red color with a beige head. Aroma is super complex with dark fruits like figs, raisins and dates, brown sugar, caramel and sweet malt, toasted malt, coffee and earthy notes. Flavor follows the nose, lots of dark fruits again raisins, figs, woody notes, caramel and sweet malt, toasted and roasted notes, brown sugar, earthy notes and a light tartness reminiscent of balsamic vinegar. The body is medium to full with a dry mouthfeel. Overall and fantastic Belgian Strong Dark Ale, this has aged so well!

2011 vintage.  Dark brown pour with a frothy beige head.  Thick.  Aroma was dark candied sugar, figs, some grape and a bit of booze.  Flavors were full of grape bubblegum, brown sugar and some dried fruit.  Mouthfeel was full with a subtle but present carbonation.  Just a touch of heat in the finish.  All in all a wonderful Belgian ale full of rich dark flavors.  Top notch stuff.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2013 Mild, big, wide taste with a touch of coffee. Malty taste with light subtle bitterness. Smell has a touch of red cabbage. Dark, black color with minimal brown head. Aftertaste lasts long and has a touch of dryness like good red wine.

Very dark brown color.  Small head, tan color.  Aroma of malt, raisin and dried fruit. Some coffee and spice.  Sweet, lots of alcohol. Sticky texture, full body.  Low carbonation.  Excellent, but I would love this beer more if the alcohol did not have such a high profile.

courtesy of  BuckeyeSammy: pours blackish brown, milk chocolate head. great lacing. oak, bourbon, grapes, musty prunes on the nose. sweet bourbon notes, woody,  roasted malts, dark fruits. this is sweet like dessert with a bit of heat of booze materializing as the beer warms. a mouthful of joy
One of my favourites. I always keep a batch in reserve. Complex, chocolate, black, brown foam, cloudy, full body, creamy, average carbonation, vanilla, coffee,

Bottle, pours dark cola with a large fluffy peaty head, aroma of brandy, stone fruit, vanilla, bready yeast, full caramel and stone fruit flavor, some rumminess on finish, finishes clean and dry, deliciou

Fra fat på Brasserie Erasmus i Brugge 4 Mai 11. Svart. Høyt luftig skum med litt farge. Skummet fester seg litt til glasset. Behagelig aroma med lakris i forgrunnen. Smaken avrundet med en syrlig bitter smak med innslag av mørk frukt & kaffe. Varer lenge. Et flott øl - men litt uvariert.

2010 bottle pours a dark brown, basically black with a foamy tan cover that lingers for quite a while.  Aroma is loads of dark fruit, plum, fig, some spicy esters, iron, dark candy sugar.  Taste is again heavy on the dark fruit, caramel, cocoa, toffee, a bit of spicy ester, high carbonation that actually doesnt work as well as I want it to.  Overall, this is an excellent beer, but there are a few little details that keep it from being stellar.

bottle 33 cl.... It pours dark brown with small long lasting tan head.....the aroma is prunes and dark fruits.... the flavor is strong coffee, plum, dark fruits,  herbal and herbal..... very nice mouthfeel with some alcohol and warm finish.....

Bottle. I have to tell a story behind this. I found this in Columbia, and was surprised the local there had it. I had been waiting to try this beer, so when I saw it at the local liquor store I picked it up. Well the dumb little girl at the story couldnt get it to ring up so she gave it to me for free. What a steal this was. Poured a dark brown, reddish color with a nice two finger tannish head. Aroma was molasses, dark fruits, candies and malts. Flavor was fig, plums, raisains, and brown sugar. Longer finsih. Very good beer, and to think my first one was on the house, made it 100 times better.

I think this is my favourite ever beer. Aroma is packed with liquorice & toffee,  heavy sweetness,  XXL body smooth coating thin and lasting texture (proper geeking out on this sorry) really bubbly, not fizzy, finish is long and exceptionally satisfied. Must try before you die

Perfection. Sweet, liquorice and red wine on the nose. Tar blackness in appearance, my only sticking point here being the lack of head (presumably due to my glass and ineffective pouring technique as it surely cant be a fault of the beer?! Either way, 4/5 for that to be fair). Sweet and syrupy, very rich with a hint of smokiness that only complements all the other flavours. Thoroughly enjoyable from first sip to after taste. Overall an amazing beer, combining various flavours, and giving a feel of drink wine and or rum/bourbon but all in a beer. BLOWN AWAY. Couldnt drink many of them though as very heavy going.

Small bottle (33cl), 2007 listed on the bottle, 

this drink had a dark brown pour with yellow-brown and coffee tan colored bubbled head that eventually lowered to a thick cover with a good billowing effervescent island (this drink was a dark ruby with brown at the edges of the glass when held up to a light), 
the bottom of the bottle was completely covered with black, caked sediment, 

the aromas were cherry, roasted malt, fruit citrus, mild spice, dark bread, caramel and faint brown sugar sweetness, 
I had to let this ale warm up a bit before the nose revealed its goodness, but even letting this drink warm up, the nose is not as strong as I thought it would be, 

there were dry, dark malt flavors, dark bread, chocolate, Bakers Chocolate (no sweetness) and chocolate cake 
with dark fruit flavors of prune and raisin, faint yeast and light spice, 
it had a small tartness on the palate, there was lots of malt flavor without the sweetness that I am used to tasting in a BSA (this ale was dry for a BSA), it had some initial sweetness but it turned dry thereafter and had some bitterness at the finish and afterwards, 
there was some alcohol warmth on the palate but was hardly noticeable (the alcohol was hidden well), pouring in the sediment of the bottle dulled the flavors a bit, 

the mouth feel was medium with generous carbonation,
