this drink was different than what I thought it would be, it had more tartness than what I was expecting, and the nose was not as big as I was expecting, I found much more flavor than what was present on the nose, again, I found this beer had lots of malt flavor with little sweetness.

Pours a five-finger+ light tan pillowy head that fades slowly leaving a good lace. Black color. Sweet spicy nose. Light-medium carbonation and very heavy bodied. Flavor is sweet, spicy and complex; high ABV is hidden. Clean finish. I dont see anything wrong with it. $5.20 for a 330ml bottle from Tullys Beer & Wine Wells, Me.

Bottle thanks to Papsoe. Thanks mate. Medium brown coloured with decent light tan coloured head. Falls away pretty quickly leaving only minimal lacing. Aromas is quite complex with lots of christmas pudding like spices, dark fruits, candii sigar sweetness and some alcohol. Nice. Flavours are not quite so complex. Very sweet initially with some spice and alcohol on the finish. Medium mouthfeel.
A bit disappointed with this one.  Nice dark appearance, but an offputting aftertaste prevents this form getting a superb rating.
From the tap poured a dark brown color with a fair amount of head.  Strong sweet malty flavor with a lingering finish.

6 oz sample from Capones. Pours a murky brown with a creamy, cask-like head. There is a great amount of sugary dark fruit and sweet bread that becomes slightly outdone by spicy Belgian esters. Taste closely follows the nose with remarkable balance and quaffability. I was done this glass much sooner then expected.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2016 33cl bottle from Beermania, Brussels. Pours a dark, almost black with a small, well tanned (coffee) head. Nose : Very lively aromas of dried fruits and coffee malts. Alcohol. Sip : Full body, almost like a milkshake. Very little carbonation. I would also add that the body makes me think of an egg yolk.  First strike is delicious mix of nose aromas going into bitter coffee domination. There are some background smoked wood notes too. Fantastic Imperial Stout like beer. Rich in aromas and flavor, hiding just enough the 10% alcohol and the body is intriguing. Its a great example of a well nourishing stout. Another "bravo" for a belgian brew.

Great bear! Especially the laurer-aftertaste is quite interesting.
Its a rare beer though. Im still looking for a place to buy more of Struise Pannepot.
2010.  dark brown slight milky head.sweet candied toffee scent slightly earthy in scent and taste, but sweet slick and complex.

2010 bottle that just showed up at my beer store. pour has a brown color with a coating of tan head. aroma has dark fermented fruit, spices, brown sugar, and some oxidation. mouth feel is medium and there is plenty of carbonation. flavor has sweet dark fruit, a mixed bag of spices, raisin, and chocolate.

Bottle - app. Vintner - 2010 vintage - pours a blackish brown with a tan head. I poured a little fast so my whole glass filled with head. Aroma is complex with notes of pumpkin pie spices, cardamon, apples, and pears. Taste is a little spicy and sweet with a dry finish. Overall, fabulous! I was surprised this is 10% alcohol!

Tryed a 2010 in a trappist glass. Very dark brown with an Orange amber rim. Completely opaque in my Westmalle glass. Vitualy no head but then I dont try and make one..The aroma is dominated by fruit esters with Pear coming through the strogest. This is pretty strange for a dark brew of this type. Medium bodied with very little carbonation.Toasted malts in the mouth but the flavour is dominated but an almost overpowering sweetnes. Overall a bit dissapointed as was expecting a more complex ale.

This beer is the 2011 version. The beer is a bit young but its ready to go. The beer was served in a goblet.

Ar- The aroma of the beer is very complex. Lots of dark fruits raisins, figs and prunes. A splash of mixed berries. A nicely spicey clove infused caramel maltyness. 

Ap- The body of the beer is dark brown almost black. Very minimal ruby opaqueness to light. The head is a cinnamon tinged brown. Nice retention noted. The lacing on the side of my glass is a road map.

T- The beer delivers a majorly caramel bready maltyness. Lots of fruit tones and notes in the beers flavor. Dark fruit raisins, figs a bit of cider notes. A bit of nutty flavors appear time to time. Floral and leathery notes combine with a nice spiceyness. Alcohol is barely present in the flavor.

P- The body of the beer is full. The carbonation is active but low and helps the beer along. No alcohol is present in the mouth. 

O- Just wow! This beer is pure beer drinking satisfaction.

Served on-tap at TJs Restaurant & Drinkery.
A - Pours murky dark brown with a one finger tall khaki colored head leaving fragmented rings of lace down the glass.
S - Smells of dark fruits; raisins, dates, and figs mostly; candied sugar sweetness, slightly funky yeast, and some light alcohol burn at the end of each sniff.
T - Starts off with lots of dark fruits, similar to the nose, that quickly give way to a mix of toffee, candied sugar, funky yeast, and even more sweetness. The booze begins to creep in after each sip, leaving the pallet dry. The finish is a mix of sweetness and dulled booze, lingering on the pallet for some time.
M - Heavy body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Big, syrupy, feel with a good amount of booze toward the end of each sip. As big as it feels it remains easy to drink.
O - Its a sipper for sure but there is no doubt that this is one of the best quads out there. I would never drink this one every day but I would have no problem drinking this one every so often.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2011 2011 batch. Overrated? Hell yes. Guess Im not huge on these big malty beers (unless its dark roasty chocolate malts). I always get surprised by how sweet these big Belgians are, I always expect something else. Tastes like a standard quad with some vinous qualities and maybe chocolate (which Ive gotten on Chimay Blue). Not worth 6 bucks. All that said, its not a bad beer. Hype is a killer. I wonder how it would age.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 33cl bottle. Pours deep brown with dark reddish haze. Nose of raisins, cinnamon, apple, Mouth: full body with smooth texture, taste of choclate, apple, coffee. Light bitterness in the finish... Great beer. After having sampled virtually every year on several ageing conditions, I have to admit that this is one of the most perfect beers around. the virtually perfect balance in the nose between forest fruits and malty and caramel/coffee/chocolaty notes makes it perfect; the palate is wonderful: round mouthfeel with that tad of sourness... and a long finish, wondering where they get it from.

33cl bottle. Dark brown with a creamy and tan head, good lacing and persistent, sediments of yeast are present. Aroma is to moderate toasted malts, dark chocolate, fruity, banana and cherries. Flavour is alcoholic, dry, vinous, sweet at the beginning but bittery at the final. Excellent balanced. Body is full. Carbonation is medium to lively. Oily feel.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2011 2010 bottle.  Dark brown with a thick light brown head.  Sweet aroma of raisins, caramel, banana, licorice, cherries.  Taste is nicely sweet, slightly bitter.  Dry, warming alcoholic finish.  Very smooth, full bodied.  Great great beer.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2012 30.10.2011 - @home - bottle 33Cl, bought at drankencentrale Hopduvel - Black as satan.  Chocolate, caramel and spices.  Tasty in the mouth, nevertheless i did expect more - bottle brewed in 2010 - will have another attempt later on with an older brewsel
One of my favorite beer. It is a unique beer... No other beer can taste the same way. It is very special and tasty with lots of different aroma.

330 ml bottle bought @ Cracked Kettle. 2009 vintage. Pours deep chestnut brown with a huge head that slowly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is very sweet and musty with prunes, raisins, alcohol, molasses, yeast and spices. Taste is sweet and malty with sweet liquorice, lots of spices like cinnamon and nutmeg, alcohol and some hints of coffee. Finish is dray, slightly sweet, slightly acidic and rather bitter with coffee and bitter chocolate.

Pour dark, deep mahogany brown, with nuthing more than a small, off-white ring of a head.
Aroma of dark fruits and spices. Lot of yeast as well.
To me, the taste is very well balanced, not too much sweetness, not too much bitterness. However, the alcohol is a bit too dominating/gives more than just heat.
Medium and sticky body, with a lot of carbonation.

330mL bottle.  Pours opaque dark brown with a thin ring of off-white foam.  Aromas of dried fruit, caramel, roasted malt, some spices, quite sweet.  Fairly sweet flavour, some chocolate and fruit, mildly acidic and bitter, some heat from the alcohol.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, very smooth body with a lingering roasted finish.

Year 2010.  Been looking for this, and it just turned up in a bottle shop.  Lovely aroma of fruit, spices, molasses, slight alcohol.  The appearance is deep brown/black, light tan head, like a stout.  The flavor is fruity, spicy (coriander, nutmeg, cinnamon, etc.), molasses.  The finsh is a booze warming, and light spicy hops, and spices.  MEdium to medium/thick in body.  Excellent.

On Tap at the hulmeville .... Clear deep amber brown pour thin off white beige head ..... aroma is of fruity yeast and dark fruits not very strong but there .... taste was very smooth and creamy and of dark fruits and a fruity yeast .... slight soft bitterness and warming abv in the finish ... better than the riserva version (had that in a bottle though) mouthfeels amazing with this brew smooth and great flavor

Botlle. Pours out brown with a rusty coloured, head that disipates quickl but leaves a little ring. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and kandi sugar. Flavour is full, bit of sweetness. Great balance and easy drinkable. Chocolate gives it a bittersweet overall taste and the coffee adds roastiness. Really good beer.

On tap at TJs. Pours dark copper with moderate foam head. Aroma of caramel, toast, earth, soy sauce, vegetables. Fairly sweet. Smooth, medium bodied. Its an expertly crafted beer, but Im just ho-hum on the flavor.

Appearance: Medium white head, quite persistant. Color is copper black, with ruby red reflections.
Aroma: Intense. Elegant. Chocolate, caramel, notes of raisins and  notes of spices in the end.
Taste: Good body, almost velevety. Well balanced. Liquorice, a hint of coffee, then a light roast bitterness. Then caramel notes and a spicy kick, partly given by a good, lively carbonation.  Long, lightly bitter finish. Good.

8-10-11 Bouteille 2010: Brune foncée, presque noire, avec peu deffervescence, quelques particules en suspension et un bon collet de mousse crémeux. Arômes prononcés de mélasse avec des notes fruités de prunes et de figues. Sucrée, avec une légère ametume. Saveurs également de mélasse et de fruits noires. Corps puissant avec une belle texture riche et crémeuse. Finale longue sucrée et alcoolisée.

11.2oz bottle. Pours dark ruby red with a pillowy off-white head. Aroma and taste of sweet dark fruits (plums, dates, & black cherries) with a touch of grape bubblegum. Delicate, smooth mouthfeel with moderate alcohol burn and a slight bitter malt aftertaste. Fantastic.

Opaque brown with lots of chocolate-colored sediment, some of it is floating on top of the tan-to-light-brown head, which is thick, but fizzy and will soon fade completely.  The aroma hits me in the face as I pour, wow, its been a while since a beer struck me like that from 18" away!  Aroma is that tart, fresh bakers yeast found in the best trappists (like st bernardus trippel or corsendonk blond in particular).  burnt spiced bread crust, light pine and coffee, yes! coffee.  cocoa.  Now for a taste.  Medium bodied with quite a bit of carbonation, fine little pricks on the palate, not creamy, but not the big prickly feeling I sometimes get, and... its tastes like I would expect based on the aroma: sweet malt with a rather spicy raisin bread and crust.  Nice banana alcohol burn, but after 5 seconds I exhale and I get those spices: I actually dont have the vocabulary for what Im tasting in that.  Is it wood, bark? combined with liquorice?  something like that perhaps.  More than likely its a spice that I simply am not used to identifying in beer, or just a new and very unique Belgian yeast strain, but wow, that aftertaste is the highlight of the beer, it lingers around for a full minute and youre still left wondering.  Old, yummy smelling mahogany.  As it warms I get more and more tart refreshing yeast and alcohol burn.  The lovely malt sweetness is more apparent in the aroma.  I actually feel bad giving this beer a rating.  On a first edit I actually had "wow" written five times in this review! Im not sure if it deserves that necessarily, but there are many striking things about this.  My new favorite beer!

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2016 Rerate121030
Pours light black with low brown head.
Aromas of liqourize, belgian yeast, dark fruits, 
Mmm, great sensation with perfect smoothness and roundness. Medium bodied almost creamy. Very nice!

On bottle at Öl&Whiskymässan. 
Muddy brown with low head. Armoas of oranges in a typical belgian strong al styple. Round and smooth taste, low carbonation and hints of chocolate
Anyada 2008. Llarga, densa, aromes fumades, dolces. Cremosa, complexa, llarga, de moment, com sempre, la millor de la nit. Impecable. Molt més rodona que la 2009. Un 10.

Pours black with small dark brown highlights and small light brown head.  Good small bubble lacing, good mouthfeel, and small bubble carbonation.  Taste is complex dark fruit (mostly raisin) and some molasses. I havent seen one in this style which was that dark (black) and the alcohol is well covered.
Pours pitch black out of the bottle with a light brown head.  Aroma is of hops and malt.  Smooth and rich on the tongue.  Great beer.  Incredible depth.

This poured a murky darker brown color with a medium sized beige head.  Aroma was lots of dark candy sugar, slightly burnt, dark fruits, some molasses too.  Flavor was very strong and bright and in your face, very sweet and sticky, lots of toast, caramel, toffee, some dark fruits and belgian spices as well. Nice.

Pours a lasting ring of tan head with a dark brown body.  Aromas of molasses and vegetal.  Flavor is molasses, toasted malt, some dark chocolate.  herbal quality.  Finish is sticky, slightly bitter and dry, cocoa and vanilla.  Alcohol is well hidden.

From the bottle. Poured a dark brown with ruby along the edges. Fingers worth of head. I get dark fruits, caramel, and spices on the nose. Taste follows up with hops, malts, chocolate and light smokiness. 10% is very well masked.

Dark brown with red hues.  Light, foamy tan head that replenishes itself to the end.  Flowers, apples, cherries, mild spice.  Initially mix of sweet and dark fruits, spice.  Middle is caramel candy, toffee.  Finishes with lightest of roasted malts, light earthy hop presence.  Some wood-like aspects.  Dry, but not overly.  Some trailing sweetness, tartness, and fruit.  All melds perfectly, completely smooth.  No alcohol hints.  No breaks in the flavor trail.  The way it should be.

2011 bottle.  finally found one.  a deep ruby brown pour with a medium sized light brown head.  aroma is dark chocolate, brown sugar, rum soaked plum and dark fruits, cola, a note of licorice and spices.  flavors of rum soaked red cherries with licorice.  some brown sugar and dark chocolate notes.  toffee begins to show as it warms.  the palate of this beer is the real secret.  its light and airy in body but full, robust, and long in finishing.  velvety yet sparkling.  abv is non-existent.  theres a good reason this beer is world class.
Bottle, pours a nice dark and a tan head, the aroma is a bit of funk, the beer has lots of dark fruits a nice yeastiness to and it was pretty good stuff. I enjoyed this one.

330ml bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours is dark brown with red tinge...dark, with tan head.  Aromas are dates, dried figs, alcohol, and toffee.  Taste is similar to the aroma, but better.  There are notes of roasted malts, dark fruits, sweetness, but not overpowering.  Some light smokiness is noted, and a mild hop note on the back end to take the edge off the sweet malts.  Alcohol not really noted on the taste.  Palate is full with average carbonation.  Nice lacing on the glass.  An excellent example of a Belgian Strong.  Well Done!

330ml bottle
Gusher
A: raisin, spice, toffee, alcohol
T: raisin, spice, chocolate, fruity alcohol notes
I really liked this beer. I found it more appealing then the Grand Reserva.

Bottle shared with northropfrye. Im pretty sure I can smell fermented plums, delicious, the taste matched the smell, a hint of chocolate, some smoke. Dark caramel colour. I greatly enjoyed this and would like another.
2007 bottle in tulip glass. Elegant fruity aroma, yeast, strawberries, straw. Dark brown with an off white head. Taste is dried fruit. Abv well masked. Awesome beer.

Geruch fruchtig, süßlich nach Rosine, Feige und Aprikose. Malzig-süßer Antrunk. Mitte schokoladig, toffeeartig und etwas fruchtig. Abgang dunkelmalzig, erdig-röstig und alkoholisch wärmend. Sehr komplex, hat Tiefe.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bottle. Oh mercy, is this good stuff! Dark cola pour with a dense yet thinner tan head. Nose is licorice, belgian yeast, nut, a bit of booze, and a hint of dark fruit. Medium but slick mouthfeel with a nice carbonation presence. Taste is very complex - sweet candy sugar, yeast, ripe fruit/banana peel, and some alcohol heat. This thing just delivers on all fronts. Tremendous beer.

btl. 33 cl. 2010:  Fine cocoa coloured head and a deep brown colour. Nose is fat and tight with some licuorice (like the Rufnuf) as well as some unevolved sugar/fruit/caramel. Intriguing and a nose that you just want to keep on sniffing to, whilst watching it evolve.  Semi full body and length. A bit dissapointing, but it may be due the the young age of the beer.  Taste is again licorice with butterscotch and  chocolate. Really pleasant, but again it seem to hide something away for the future.. I may have to find one more to hide away for a few more years.

Brilliant beer. Pours a dark reddish brown with a fairly small tan head. Smells of bitter orange, brown sugar, malt, belgian yeast and quite a lot of alcohol. That alcohol carries through and dominates the taste which is very sweet. Theres a bit of bitterness as well and the bitter orange really carries through. Theres a very a long and balanced finish carrying all of this through. Body is fairly light, with medium carbonation. All in all, a very complete beer.
Bottle vintage 2010. Poured deep, dark brown with small tan head. Very richly sweet with spices and lots of malty sweetness and alcohol.

On tap at Armsby Abbey, served in a tulip. Pours dark, reddish brown with a thin, dense tan head.  Delicious aroma of sweet caramel, toffee, dark fruits, cinnamon and brown sugar. Smells quite amazing.  Flavor is initially sweet, but boozy, then the fruit aspects kick in followed by the cinnamon. Tastes as good as it smells. Moderate palate with active carbonation. Theres a bit of heat to it. Very nice.

10 bottle.  Pours a dark, muddy brown with a thick tan head and steady carbonation.  Aroma is leather, candied sugar, raisin, date, sweet malt, cinnamon/sugar spice, and perhaps a little black pepper.  Oh wow - taste is a thick melange of dark raisin, pepper, candied sugar, sweet cinnamon spice, and a whisp of alcohol heat.  Smooth feel in the mouth.  Just an absolutely outstanding beer in every way  - I need to check back in with my local and clean out any bottles they may have remaining.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  2007 bottle purchased in 2008 drank in 2011.  Pours deep brown with a thick, lacy, light tan head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, a little chocolate and dark fruits, floral hops, and some alcohol.  Flavor and texture almost like wine.  An amazing beer that I wish I could have more of.

Great beer, one of the best Ive ever had.  Poured beautifully even straight out of the fridge.  Deep, dark brown with a nice, thick white foam.  Dense sweet, somewhat roasty malty nose.  The flavors are intense:  Loads of overripe and dried fruit, with bananas, cloves, roasted barley, and hops.  My only complaint: the finish is too bitter.  Id prefer a sweeter, rounder finish in this decadent beer.

Pours a hazy deep brown with a creamy beige head, which leaves a thin film behind.
Smell of dried fruits and alcohol.
Syrupy mouthfeeled brew with a complex, dried fruity aroma with raisins, chocolate, caramel underpainted by spices and alcohol, which is moderately biting the tongue.
It finishes long and dry escorted by alcohol, citrusses, spices and bitterchocolate, leaves at last a sweet-tart aftertaste behind.
Delicious one.

Bottle given to me by phaleslu. Thanks Peter! Pours reddish brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is sweet malts, dark fruits and a hint of chocolate. Flavor is lots of dark fruit, malts and booze. Has a pretty strong alcohol flavor in the after taste.
(Bottle 17/08-2011) Dark red color, low brown head, well balanced Belgian strong ale.

2010. Dark brown beer with a reddish shine. Tan head, not too big but good retention. Spicy yeast aroma, dark and burned malts. Some thyme, liquorice, dark fruits, coffee and chocolate. Alcohol is noticable but not overly agressive. Good complexity and balance. Slight metal note though. Flavour sweetish malts, full boddied, almost thick and oily. More coffee, milk chocolate, spices (cinnamon, vanilla, cardemom). Only slight bitterness in the background. Quite long finish. Nice and balanced. Really quite good.
(From 33cL bottle)

Very dark brown, cant see through it at all, but its just not quite "black"...dark brown will do.  Nice creamy tan head.  Wonderful strong Belgian aroma of caramelized figs, some raisins, plums, brown sugar, maybe a bit of clove or nutmeg, not sure...Very aromatic, sweet, fruity and dark.  Texture is perfect, the best combination of subtle carbonation and velvety mouthfeel.  The taste is great, but leaves a little something to be desired.  Lots of dark fruit like from the nose, like plum and raisin, with a small boozy kick at the aftertaste.  Slight caramel graininess at the middle.  Great flavor, not terribly complex though.  Good, but not shut-your-mouth good.

2007 bottle thanks to fear025 (NP10V5) 
Appearance: Dark brown with a medium sized beige head and good lacing 
Aroma: Sweet malts, toffee, ripe fruit and brown sugar 
Taste: Belgian malts, brown sugar and light spices  
Very nice and enjoyable, easy drinking

0,33 l. bottle, 2009 "vintage". Nearly opaque, chestnut-brown colour in my trappist glass with a medium, tanned head that fades quickly. Very spicy, complex aroma with notes of cinnamon, licorice, strong cough drops (something for the fishermen), dark dried fruits and bitter chocolate, lots of spices here!  Medium sweetness, full body with a oliy texture. Long lasting finish, the flavors in this beer seems to last a decade. No trace of alcohol at any time, watch out! A very complex, fullbodied Belgian beer - this one gets a very high rating.  World class!

Craft Beer Co. Pours darkest brown/black with a thin off white head. Basically looks like a porter. Nose is fruity pears, chocolate malt, brown sugar. Taste is chocolate, bitterness, prunes, pears. Like a roasted chocolate porter but with the added dimension of fruity hops. Finish is chocolate.

330mL bottle poured very dark almost black into my goblet with nice beige head and lacing.  Aromas are of caramel and chocolate.  Taste is a nutty sweet maltiness, some chocolate and a mild hoppy finish.  Mild carbonation and heavy body.

2010 bottle.  The pour is a deep, dark red color, nearly black with an average, fizzy, frothy, tan head which settles to a thin froth throughout and leaves similar lace.  The nose is young but very nice with chocolate cake, spiced cake, blueberries, red currant, figs, sliced almonds, strong wisps of alcohol, toasted caramel, light molasses, and faint herbs.  The flavor is similar with similar fruit (blueberry, red currant, fig), very toasty, still molasses and almonds, cake-like notes all over, chocolate, cinnamon, gingerbread, and slight roast.  The palate is lively, full, very coating, and a bit syrupy but clean.  The beer finishes fairly long with chocolate cake left on the tongue, blueberries, cinnamon, roast, and a faint herbal tinge.  Quite the peculiar beer, very complex, still young and showing its 10% strength, nearly full and coating mouthfeel but still rather clean and lively.  The complexity was high, the fruitiness was immense, and the malt richness was very nice.  Very abt-ish in nose and flavor but carried a lighter, less heavy body; with the stronger sense of alcohol in this one, I expected the beer to drink slower but with the clean palate and pleasant fruity accents, it drank rather quickly for a beer of 10%.  Definitely worth the wait to get this one in Colorado, something completely different from anything else I have tried.

Date: August 4, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Discount Liquor, Waukesha, WI Appearance: Opaque brown and big tan head. Aroma: Dark fruit, caramel and yeast. Flavor: Consistent with aroma, smooth, medium bodied and hint of alcohol and butter toffee at finish. Other: Very good beer, had it right after the Rochefort 10, not quite as good as that, but a nice 1-2 punch.

Dark brown beer with ok head.Aroma smoked,dust,alcohol,roasted almonds,wood,alcohol,dried fruits.Taste bitter, light swee,t roasted malts,instant coffee,dust,tobacco,raisins,alcohol,almonds,alcoho long lasting finish.

(330ml bottle, 2006 vintage).  Pours deep mahogany color with a thin whisp of a khaki head even with a vigorous pour.  Lots of sedimentation in suspension.  Aroma has caramel, raisins, fig, and some spice.  Taste is sweet, with more raisin/port shining through, and a touch of alcohol.  Full bodied with a slick/sticky texture.  Smooth finish.  What a fantastic beer!

Bottle @ home. Deep brown appearance with a creamy, foamy, brown head. Huge caramelized candy sugar, spicy, Belgian yeasty, caramel, toffee, light gingerbread nose. Toasty, toffee, dark fruits, caramel, dark candy sugar, raisin flavor. Caramel, toffee aftertaste.
Lite för söt och alkohollig för min smak. Mörkbrun öl med khakifargat skum. Bränt socker i doften. Söt med toner av russin i smaken.
Strong malty aroma, similar to a barley wine.  The flavor is of dark fruit with a hint of alcohol.  Pretty good, similar to a barley wine.

Aroma: malty sweetness, strong dark fruit, plums, dates, very rich.  Pours dark brown, almost opaque, thick tan head with very good retention, dissipates to a thin layer of foam.  Rich and fruity flavor, good malt character and some malty sweetness, figs and dates, dark sugar, alcohol is very well hidden, smooth flavor.  Medium-full body and moderately high carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2011 33 cl bottle from Brussels. Brown, hazy liquid with small tan head. Aroma of belgian yeast, dark fruits, molasses and lots more, complex. Very nice taste with bready, fruity notes and some alcohol (but expected). Pleasant, sweet taste and some bitterness. Medium bodied with ok carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2011 2007 "infected" batch. 11.2 oz bottle into a chimay goblet. Reviewed on 7/27/2011. This is my third bottle of this batch and all of them had an extremely slow gush over. Upon pouring it the head began to dissolve violently and it actually looked like it was boiling. I also usually try and pour out every drop, but when it began to come out like cold maple syrup I poured it into the bottle cap. The last few drops were milky brown and smelled kind of weird, like funky molasses. 

A - Dark brown syruppy body with some red tints. The head is mocha colored with random splotches of dark brown. Awesome lacing and it even has legs! Lots of rapid bubbling happening on the surface. Some mocha looking phloegm forming on the bottom. 3.5/5

S - Candied dark fruits, spice, malt, sweet burnt sugar, and some alcohol twang. 4.0/5

T - Very bubbly and meaty mouthfeel. Taste starts off with sweet candied figs, spices and brown sugar, then an odd bitterness comes in. It is really sweet, but the aftertaste is a bit herbal and savory. The alcohol comes out a bit as it warms up. It does have a fairly sterotypical quad taste, it just has an odd aftertaste that I can imagine some people finding "offensive" or "unenjoyable". Some sips actually taste like old cola syrup...weird. 3.5/5. Mouthfeel - 4.0/5

O - Its infected for sure, but in an odd way I quite enjoy it. This particular batch does have some redeeming qualities. The sticky sweetness and bitterness is actually somewhat enjoyable and unique. Its just something I have to be in the mood to enjoy. 3.5/5

2010 vintage. 11.2 oz bottle into a chimay goblet. Reviewed on 8/1/2011. No gush over!

A - Dark brown cola body and a light khaki head. Quick falling lace and weak retention. Due to some experience with Pannepots now, I swirled and poured the last 2 ounces into a snifter. That appeared lighter with an almost milky brown color. Yeast sits on the bottom of the snifter.

S - Dark caramelized fruits, chocolate, spices, roasted malts, and some alcohol. A touch of something herbal and medicinal towards the end.

T - Figs, bitter roasted malts, sweet candi sugar, some coffee and chocolate notes. Molasses and dark spices as well. Alcohol is presented really well but is noticeable. Velvety medium mouth feel. Quite tasty.

O - Much better than the infected batch I had. This is at the top of my quadruple list. Very delicious and rich. I would love to try some other vintages now.

Overall score is based off the 2010 vintage.

Keg at the Craft Beer Co., London. For Ians birthday. Pours black with a rich, tan head. Aroma holds plenty of dark malts, some dark, ripe fruits and roasted malts, too. Very sweet flavor, sweet chocolate, tangy fruits, some earth. Quite a bit of dry, roasty malts. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Warm finish, dried up a bit, plenty more roasted malts, touches of toast, cocoa. Delicious beer. The menagerie of flavors is amazing.

Bottle. Heavy malt aromas of cookie and roasted, moderate cooked orange for the hops, dough for the yeast, with hints of raisin, port, toffee and fruit cake. Head is small, turning wispy, light brown with a few spots of lacing and has good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is hazy dark brown. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes moderately bittersweet and lightly acidic. Palate is medium to full, between creamy and syrupy and has a soft carbonation, and a moderately alcoholic, and a dry yet sticky finish. This Belgian Strong Ale is extremely rich and full. Its a perfect "in from the cold" kind of beer.
Bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere. Originally rated on 27.8.2010. Nice, well balanced and complex Belgian strong ale.

75 cL bottle of 2007 shared with friends at De Kulminator in Antwerp.  Light taste, a little bitter but very smooth.  Rich, fruity aroma.  Very dark brown with short-lived head.  Sweet, doesnt taste strong, and its very nice.  Creamy.  Takes ages to drink though!

Bottle 33cl, dark beer with huge creamy brownish head, with good lacing. Nose is alcoholic like and spicy. What a beer, creamy body, beginning is chocolate like with caramel notes, fruit notes such as dry grapes, apricot and over riped fruit, finish is spicy with licorice and cinnamon. Amazing body, the 10° cannot even be felt in the aroma, what a pleasure, nice malty body with biscuit notes, an exceptional brew. Near to the Pannepeut but more complex.

2010 Vintage - Poured into a tulip

Appearance is dark brown with about a half inch tan head. The head fades quickly, leaving only a trace amount of lacing. Aroma is of strong dark fruit as well as notes of caramel and fig. The aroma is varied, yet well balanced. The taste is exceptional. Balanced wonderfully with dark fruit and malt present at the beginning, fading to a slight amount of alcohol and a touch of spice. Overall, a delicious quad that Im excited to try aged. Very smooth and balanced, with the distinct flavors evident with every sip.

On tap at Burger. in Santa Cruz. Pours a deep oily brown, completely opaque, with some nice khaki suds. Sorta boozy on the nose, some raisins, brown sugar and molasses. Perfumey alcohols and maybe a touch of acetone? Mild cherry yogurt. Flavor is raisiny with a light roasted malt finish, ginger, rum, assorted dried fruit. Equal parts sweet, dry, bitter, boozy. A nice round quad but I think it falls short if you compare it to the Westies and Rocheforts of the world.

One of the first beers I tasted, think it must have been 2008. One of my first favorites also. Its not a top 10 beer for me now, but its certainly a great brew. Nice dark color, average smell but a complex, full taste.

Dark-brown coloured beer with a creamy beige head. Fresh malty aroma. Flavour is perfectly balanced and complex, roasted coffee, caramel like sweetness, a bit fruity and a little bit alcoholic in the aftertaste. Great beer. (Bottle 33cl)

2007 bottle, from web shop Etre Gourmet. Time to get the last, missing link of the Pannepot-family to the table (well, except the Pannepot Wild, but thats another story) for rating. I deserve this after a long day of being productive around the house. :-) Pours a near-black deep brown body with a medium creamy caramel-hued retention, settling like a tiny carpet as the bubbles come to rest. Very nice indeed. The aroma is smooth, dense and virtually flowing from the glass as I pour: raisins, fresh (!) red plums, wood, dark candy sugars. Hints of burnt caramel, alcohol, figs and prunes. Taste is smooth as expected, with a veritable fan of tastes spreading over my palate: first, a fresh, carbonation-fueled hint of red berries and tart wooden tones (feels amazingly fresh for a 2007 vintage!), then a light spread of alcohol, near-tart plumes, sweet raisins and figs. Some oxidization comes through here as well, but that only seems to magically blend in with the brew somehow! Incredible. In the end, dark candy sugars and prunes land it all with some caramel and hints of burnt sugar. Mouthfeel is always pearly, like a good strong Belgian ale is supposed to, and the beer is very filling and subtly warming away with its 10 % ABV - which are generally extremely well hidden. So now I know for sure. A Pannepot is definitely a beer to cellar, and although I think the fresher versions are also extremely tasty this is really a gem. Buy one now, drink in 4-5 years. No sweat. Truly a masterpiece from Struise. :-)

Ah, the King of Belgians, or so the bartender tells me, perhaps to justify the high price tag. Pours medium brown with a moderate light brown head. Nose is quite interesting with fruity, sour, wine-like, bitter, and boozy notes without any of them really ruining the others. Flavor is a rich, brown-sugar and fruit based malt balanced against modest hops, all colored by a perfect level of roastiness, earthy tones, and alcohol. Finish reveals lighter fruits and coriander. Im hard to impress but this definately did it for me: excellent ale in all aspects.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2012 Opened with a bang by Craig Garvie! A brown beer with a tan head. Raspberry and some sour notes on the nose. Caramel and chewy fruit and nut chocolate flavours. A little dry in the finish. Superb! 2011 version on draught at t Antwaerps Bierhuiske. Pours a black colour with a thin tan head. The aroma of caramel, coffee, chocolate, marzipan and only the gentlest hint of sourness. Similar flavours with a chewy mouth-feel. Flavours of chocolate, caramel, marzipan and salty liquorice. Mild bitterness and carbonation with only light sourness. Alcohol hum to finish but superbly balanced overall. Nice peppery linger. Just brilliant! (9,3,10,5,18). 2010 bottle at home pours a dark brown colour with a thin, light tan head. Beautiful nutty, fruity, alcohol aroma again with just a little balsamic vinegar in there. Superbly chewy with rich plums, dried fruits and toffee. Mild carbonation. 2004 bottle with the green cap at Kulminator. This beer literally smelled so good Sev and I both had a  tear in our eye! Aroma of heaven, caramel, marzipan, toffee, figs, chocolate and plums. Quite ethereal with alcohol very well balanced. Similar flavours, quite sweet with candy sugar, marzipan, caramel, toffee, chocolate and treacle. Mild carbonation and CO2 prickle. Oh my! 2006 bottle at Craigs. Beautiful nose with lots of chocolate, liquorice, caramel and roasty malt with a chewy mouth-feel. 2008 bottle at Craigs. I much preferred this to the 2006. Alcohol is quite present with treacle, chocolate, liquorice, roasty malt and caramel. Lovely oily mouth-feel. Both the 2006 and 2008 bottles were quite heavily carbonated with moderate CO2 prickle.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2012 Bottle at cgarvieuk tasting. 2007 vintage. Very dark brown, tiny beige head. The nose is almost frambozen, with lots of raspberries and some sour funkiness. Taste is sweet & sour, with treacle but juicy sour too. Short but refined sweet finish. Hides the alcohol well. 8 4 8 4 19 = 4.3.............2010 bottle at home. Interesting to compare young and old. Bigger head, generally a bit more lively. Nose is overwhelmingly pineapple! And dried fruits and white pepper spices and some ribena fruits, strawberry perhaps, just a subtle touch of cocoa roastiness. Really bright and complex and amazing. Nice fruity front, juicy pineapple and sherbet and rich berry fruits, with a dark chocolate, black forest gateau and roast backbone. Soft sweet molasses in the linger, and a touch of Christmas spice. Amazing, different but just as good as an aged version. 9 4 8 4 18 = 4.3

15 June 2011, bottle at my last cgarvieuk tasting! 2007 vintage. dark ruby, some sediment, nose is faintly sour. reminds me of sweet tarts candy. a bit of vinegarette. med body, faintly fizzy with very drying finish. sugary, slightly tart bready water. there is a bitter finish that lingers. very smooth and interesting malt powder drink. lovely!

Very dark beer. Aroma and taste are a bit coffee-like, roasty malts, caramel.
I have the 2007 version in my fridge and will try that one soon.

33cl. bottle in a private beer tasting. It pours a deep dark brown liquid with some ruby tones and with a slow-paced tan consistent medium head that lats throughout the beer and leaves a nice lacing. The aroma is ultra-complex; there are some hints of grapes, vanilla, floral and herbal hops, along with caramel malt, spices and fennel. There is also a mild smell of dark fruits. It tastes maltier, very intense actually, with coffee and burnt caramel, and hints of herbal hops and species. Mild carbonation and full-bodied, this moderate bitter and medium sweet beer ends dry with a hoppy and roasty aftertaste. Presentation is precious (though it lacks a customized crown cap). One of the best brews out there; an original belgian ale.

Vintage 2009. Very dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, dried fruit, yeasty, dark sugar and spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and bitter finish. Smooth, soft and full bodied. 130611

Dark brown pour and almost zero head. Aromatic spices and liquorice dominate the nose. Complex, rich flavours of dates, chocolate, nutmeg, whiskey malt and a touch of caramelised balsamic seaweed. Lots of alcohol in the finish - this might also be the first time I get to pull out the "umami" tag. Soft, full mouthfeel. Delightful and utterly unique.

330 ml bottle (2009) a dark brown colored beer with a beige head aroma malts caramel dry fruits spices coffee and hops flavor malts something roasted dry fruits raisins mint spicy coffee caramel some nuts brown sugar and some hops
33cl bottle at home. This is an amazing beer. Nearly black in color, it looks like a stout, but not hardly. So very rich tasting, (raisins, chocolate, cherries, and a nutmeg like spice).

2007 bottle. Pours a deep brown with a creamy light brown head  Nice lacing. A big nose of cherries and rich dark fruits, with a woody overtone. Taste is malty with raisins and light spices rounding out the flavors. Hints of chocolate sweetness on the finish  Nice body. Delicious stuff.

2006 bottle.  Taste was rich dark fruits with a fantastically complex finish of roasted, medium sweet, crisp, and floral flavors.  This will be a beer I keep on hand in the cellar.  Highly recommended.
Bottle shared.  Dark brown pour with small head. Aroma of raisins, malt, cherry and prunes.  Same elements in flavors, with a little carbonation and caramel sweetness.  Great beer
This is an amazing beer. Nearly black in color, it looks like a stout, but not hardly. So very rich tasting, (raisons, chocolate, cherries, and a nutmeg like spice). Nice amount of alcohol

Pour dark brown/ ruby edges beige head great lace. Aroma dark fruit, spicy yeast, caramel, wood. Taste dark fruit, spicy yeast, caramel, wood,  dark cherries. MF medium body good carb. Overall a tasy well balanced sipping beer tasty stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2012 2008 bottle. Dark brown body, light brown head. Intense sweet aroma of fruits (plum, apricot), spices, brown sugar, licorice and caramel. Well carbonated, smooth and full palate. Flavour is amazing, sweet but not overly, with fruits and chocolate. Brilliant. (9/5/10/5/19)
2010 bottle. Dark brown body, small off white head. Wonderful fruity aroma with spices, caramel, chocolate, apricot, licorice. Smooth, full body. Awesome sweet flavour with chocolate, caramel, fruits. Brilliant.
The older one just has a bit more refined flavour.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest. A színe nagyon-nagyon sötétbarna egy kevés bíbor árnyalattal, habja egész terjedelmes, állagra és színre is egyaránt cappuccino-hab. Az illata először teljesen olyan, mintha egy iszonyat testes, igencsak tanninos száraz vörösborba szagolnánk bele, majd azért kiérezni egy kevés, majd egyre több kávét, aszalt szilvát, mákot és némi élesztőt, tehát igen tartalmas illata van, de nekem a vörösboros jellege annyira nem jött be. Az íze megmondom, hogy milyen: eszünk egy mákkal kérgezett nagyon finom lúdláb tortát, hozzá tejes kávét iszunk és szivarozunk, ám mégis érezni ezek mellett a komlós keserűséget, és csípős fűszerességet is, ami mégiscsak sörré kerekíti ezt az izgalmas, nagyon komplex ízvilágot. Igazi komoly, lassú folyású testes sör, ami egyszerre száraz és édes, kellemes, ihatóságot biztosító szénsavassággal. Régóta vadásztam már, és szerencsére nem is kellett csalódni benne. Kötelező darab!

2009 bottle (April 2011). Very dark brown with a creamy cappuccino head. Aroma: milk chocolate, candy, dried fruit and licorice. Taste: candy, chocolate, cacao, dried fruit, licorice, vinous. Full-bodied, soft and moussy. Great!

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2014 @home 2013 edition
raspberry pie... full of dark fruit and some dark chocolat in the back, pieish malts... sweet and sweet, thick and oily, soft carbs, long dark sweet finish

@culminator
black beer with a slightly tanned head... aroma is sweet, malty, has some liquorish... tastes is sweet, malty and has some liquorish again... it has a medium long sweet finish.... its body is a bit watery, has some nice carbonization going for it though
3.2

A richly dark reddish brown beer which pours with a thin head that disappears almost immediately. Molasses and orange peel on the nose. First taste gives a lot of sweetness and some umami with a heavy alcohol presence and quite an abrupt finish, neither malty nor hoppy. Not unlike a bourbon in that it hints at vanilla. Very easy to drink which belies its 10%ABV.
(2009 vintage 33cl)

33cl bottle, 2009 vintage, Poured dark brown with a thin brownish head Aroma is caramel, dark fruits and spices, very tempting. Flavor is malt, spices, gingerbread, sweet candy. I usually don´t like sweet beers, but here it works just fine, not too sweet, just perfectly balanced. Some alcohol warmth. Very smooth, oily mouthfeel. Coffee in the long finish. Excellent ale.

2007 Bottle. Pours dark red brown with a medium yellow/tan head. Aroma is toffee, mollasses, nutmeg, figs, and raisins. Flavor is figs, raisins, cinnamon, nutmeg, and black pepper. Medium/full mouthfeel with good heat.

Bottle @ Home 2009 vintage. Pours dark brown with a small creamy tan head, fading to leave some nice lacings on the glass. Aroma dried fruit, nuts, malts, brown sugar, port. Taste is caramel, sweet dried fruit, plums, orangepeel, sweet malts, port, alchohol very well hidden. Full body, smooth and creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation. Just yummi beer, very enjoyable. 060511

How have I had so much of this and never rated it? 2009 vintage. Dark brown, thin, with a bubbly fading white head. Nose is sweet, candied dried fruit, dried orange peel, young wood and nutmeg. Slight vinous tones. Mouth is sweet, complex, alcohol, treacle, berries, molasses, touch of sour fruit to cut through the sweetness right at the end, to give a warming, clean vanilla alcohol burn. As always, brilliant.
citrus, molasses, nutmeg, cinnamon.  dark brown color with tan head.  figs, pepper, molasses, nutmeg, dark fruits.

03/08/2010 33cl bottle @ home  2008
Aroma: sweet, heavy, dried fruits, chocolate. MF: soft, oily. Taste: sweet, chocolate, sweet dark red fruits. Aftertaste: mocha bitter and chocolate.
03/08/2010 33cl bottle @ home  2007 - Thanks to Klaas for the bottle!
Head is darker and finer in texture than the 2008. Also small chunks are present now. Aroma: much fruitier, some honey. MF: a little more carbon, more creamy than oily. Taste: sweeter, fruitier. Aftertaste: a little less mocha than the 2008.
Pours a dark sugary brown. Frothy white head. Aroma sweet caramel, sugar,dark fruits, raisins. Taste is sweet caramel. Pepper. Raisins. Full mouthfeel. Overall a good brew.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Bottle from 2007. Pours dark brown with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate, sweet dark fruits, caramel, sweet tobacco, ripe fruits and vinous port notes. Taste of dates, plums, figs, prunes, vanilla, dark chocolate, brown sugar, spice, light notes of alcohol, sweet tobacco, port and some some light woody notes. This beer is in harmony ... 
I got this one again in a blind taste along with Westy 12 and Rochefort 10. This beer by far ruled the others for me! Soo god

Pours hazy brown, very nice ruby amber against light. Small tanned head leaving nice lace. Aroma is sweet, malty, dark fruits, fidges, hoppy and alcohol; very nice. Fullbodied mouthfeel. Hoppy tart, malty, very fruity, atcohol and caramel flavor, excellent. Tart sweet fullbodied palate. Finishes fruity and tart; complex and fantastic good mix and very well balanced.

Poured black with a thin off-white head.  Aroma has lots of chocolate, wood, and alcohol.  Lots of bourbon flavors and roasted malts.  Taste is very smooth and flavorful with lots of chocolate malts.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  Vanilla flavors with some fruity notes in the finish.  Very, very, good!

Bottled.2009 vintage. Pours dark brown with a big frothy light tanned head.Aroma of brown sugars, dark malts, wood, vinous character with some liquorice as well. Taste is strong and complex, dark red berries, plums and figs, very well hidden alcohol, a very good belgian.

pours dark murky brown, creamy beige but disappearing head. aroma is woody, butterscotch, caramel malts, hint of smoke, soy sauce, molasses, raisins, dried fruits. light to medium hopped - herbal, spices, pepper, yeast. old malts, old ale feeling. ABV very well hidden - loads of sweetness helps. oily, soft carbonation.

2007 on the label. Wanted this for a while, thanks Tanger. Beer poured into a tulip. Beer is black but brown at the corners and forms an aggressive head of small brown bubbles that leaves some but not a lot of lacing on the glass.

Aroma is sweet with a caramel note. Strong with some alcohol in there. A hint of some acetic sour too, I hope that doesnt mean that this is souring.

Beer is medium to thin in the body. The carbonation is a little harsh on the palate but its OK. There is some sweetness up front and a hint of acetic sourness. Second taste, the carbonation kind of blocks the front palate notes of this beer. There is some sweetness and caramel notes in the back with a hint of roast.

Overall its a good beer but it is over carbonated. This may be due to the age on this bottle. I really enjoyed it. Its an excellent example of a quad.

Serving type: bottle

2007 bottle.  Pours a dark brown color with a soapy off-white head that settles into a creamy layer atop the beer.  Aroma of raisin, plum, apple, bread, and spice.  Complex flavor with raisins, plum, bread, spice finish.  Rather vinous.  Just exceptional.  The next beer is sure to disappoint.

33c bottle from 2007. Pours a dark hazy brown. floating sediment, with a large tan head that settles into a nice creamy layer of lacing. Aroma of yeast, bread, raisins and spices. Havent had this in a while but wow that first sip hits you like a ton of bricks. Nice and sweet, perfect carbonation, raisins, alcohol, spices with a finish that just keeps on going, ends up along the sides of the tongue with a good alcoholic bite and a fruity sweetness on the palate. Delicious.

The beer pours a light straw gold with that is cloudy. The head is white with light retention and good lacing.

The aroma is light with mostly honey hops. 

The taste is whats special here and its very unique. It is a tart vinegar at first but upon further reflection it really is similar to eatting a granny smith apple. Overall its a great taste that is very drinkable. Mouthfeel is good.
Smooth, rich, filling all without being overly sweet.  Typical Belgian Quad flavors of darker fruits and caramels.  A very well-made beer.

33cl bottle from BarleyWine. 2007-vintage, otherwise no date information. It poured a deep black colour with a medium big beige head. Some carbonation in the bottom of the glass. Aroma is a tad vinious. Notes of citrus, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and liqorice. The flavour is a bit thinner than I expected. Some vinious notes as well. Flavours of spice, apples, caramel, roasted malts, coffee and alcohol. When venturing further down in the glass notes of grapes and raisins turn up. The alcohol becomes more dominant. Long and lingering aftertaste.
Bonus points for being approved by the girlfriend.

2006 bottle.

Shared this bottle into a snifter successfully. Pours like, you know a dark red and brownish hues, as expected. Really nice aromas, nothing off here. Carbonation and mouthfeel is excellent. As for taste and such I really enjoyed this Quad, very drinkable lots of flavor not too heavy,sweet or boozy which is key. Very sufficient and pleasing.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 2008 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ ]]> */: the younger this beer is, the more I seem to like it, favourite vintage by far, amazing, lots of sweet malt in this one, almost no spices noticeable, molasses, plums & prunes, there is also an undertone of almost sour fruit, the alcohol has gotten an almost bourbon characterstic to it, favourite version by far, rated for 2010 Vintage
Outstanding dark strong ale with flavours of chocolate and licorice. Highly recommendable.

Bottiglia da 33cl acquistata al Bir&Fud Beershop (Roma) - Magnifica birra scura, marrone, quasi nera, densa e impenetrabile, con schiuma color senape. Aroma potente, caramello, banana, caffè. In bocca è di una complessità incredibile. Cioccolato, caramello, caffè e una nettissima nota di liquirizia. Finale lunghissimo, lievemente amarognolo. Oleosa, densa, corposa. Straordinaria.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 2006, aged 5 years, Amazing nose, palate is of heavy dark fruits, complex layers upon layers of malts, slight bitterness in the finish. Every sip tasted different and unique. Didnt know beer could kick this much ass

33 cl bottle. Pours dark brown almost black with a small brown head that didnt last very long. Aroma is malty with hints of caramel, bread, resin and dough. The taste is great balanced between sweet and bitter. Maybe a little bit salt and some liquor. The beer has a slightly oily mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2011 Im not quit sure how I feel about this one. I enjoy the caramel and leather aroma. The appearance is spot on with floating sediment beauties. Has a creamy texture and average carbonation and a  sharp finish. The taste is a little sour and slightly salty. I like it, but I think I was expecting a little more from this one, but I am sure the 10% alcohol will make up for any lacking qualities.
Draught @BBF 2010. You might not expect the light fruit overtones from such a dark pour, but raisins, plums, caramel and sugar dominate. Very nice.

Bottle from 2006.  Havent had this in a while, always liked it.  Pours a very dark brown with a light head.  Very little carbonation.  Light spicy aroma.  Taste is that of fruit and spice, great mouth feel, very easy to drink.  This beer has held up well for 5 years!

Bottle 2007 at home. 
Pours a dark brown colour with a dense light brown head. 
It has a lovely aroma of dates, raisins,  prunes and caramel with a hint of figs and alcohol. 
Flavour is dominated by dates and dark caramel but also raisins, spices and alcohol comes through. Very pleasant and smooth dark fruits after taste.

This was the winning Belgian I tasted during a night at Brasserie V. Full-bodied, tons of dark fruit flavors, a subtle yeastiness and a very warming alcohol finish. The alcohol flavors become stronger as it warms. Yup, Ill take another.

Rating #600.  Tasted on 2/13/11 from a 330mL bottle purchased at West Lakeview Liquors, 2006 Vintage.  Pours very dark red, almost looks like a very hazy red wine, with a massive tan head that slowly recedes, leaving lace along the inside of the glass, to thick, rocky, and spotty lace.  The nose is very intense with caramel malt, a good amount of roast, and fruitiness that ranges from dried figs and raisins, to very vinous along with some cinnamon and other baking spices, vanilla, and some candi sugar sweetness.  The flavor starts off with the sweeter candi sugar, vanilla, and dried fruits, moving to the baking spices and more roasted notes, and finishing with the vinous flavor and light bitterness, with the caramel flavor present throughout.  The body is medium with average carbonation and a super long and complex finish that although dominated by vanilla and caramel, also contains all of the other flavors mentioned in this rating at some point.  This beer is one-hundred percent worth all of the hype that it receives.

Bottle is labeled 2006 sampled 9/10/2008

Pours a cloudy dark brown with a smallish tan head that sticks around for a while. Smells of caramel malt, lots of fruits, a bit of bread and same candy sugar sweetness. Tastes of spices and some sweetness up front. Followed by a caramel malty taste fading into a bit of alcohol and Belgian yeast funk. Full body with lots of carbonation that mixes with creamy and coats your entire mouth. Great example of the style!
Draft @ double windsor. .smells of fruit, carmwl and tofee.taste is sweet with a chjerry, chocolayte backbone to it. Really good. If i could find a bottle, id buy it

2007 vintage. AMAZING beer. The pour is dark murky brown, almost black. Aroma is sweet dark fruits with plum, prune, raisin and yeasty aromas. Love the sweet, so sweet and fruity with dark roastiness. The flavour is ridiculous. Sweet raisin and plum with dark earthy esters. Low alcohol taste on the finish with a lingering sweetness. Moderate lacing (this is a vintage bottle though). Mouthfeel makes the beer. Such a light mouthfeel with mild carbonation and a sweet prickly awesomeness.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2011 2010 bottle at Het Oude Schooltje, thanks to Carlo. It pours very dark brown with almost no head. The nose is full of dark fruit (date, plum and raisin), liquorice, varnish, caramel, clove and has a medicinal quality. The taste is caramel, plum, fig, currant, prune, coffee, liquorice, crème  brûlée, clove, cinnamon, caramelised bananas, dark sour cherry, menthol and has a long lingering alcohol warmth. Its very complex, packed full of flavour and still remains very drinkable. Tastes just like Christmas pudding, awesome!

Poured into a goblet. 2007 vintage.

4.5 A: Super dark brown color, pretty much black. Two fingers of tan creamy head with good retention and lots of lacing around the entire glass.

5.0 S: Wow does this smell good! At first I was impressed with how fruity it is, but soon after layers of complexity (all good) started coming through. TONS of fruity plum with fig and some black cherry as well. Underneath, there is a sweet milk chocolate with even sweeter dark crystal malts and the slightest touch of roastiness. Alcohol is minimal at most and complements rather than interfering.

4.0 T: Very surprising. The taste isnt much like the nose at all. The fruitiness comes in the form of prunes instead of plum (similar, I know, but different enough). Lots of tobacco and raisin this time. Not really any chocolate, but the roasted character is stronger. The downfall of the taste is the alcohol. While it was barely in the nose, its probably the strongest component in the taste.

3.5 M: Lighter medium body. Good heavy carbonation that is very spritzy. Not so smooth though due to lingering sweetness and alcoholic tinge on finish.

3.5 D: Excellent smelling with a good taste, but the aftertaste doesnt do it for me. At $6, it was well worth it because the nose was phenomenal.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-21-2010 01:16:31

Purchased 2007 vintage from Sherbrooke Liquor in Edmonton. Poured a dark hazy brown with a huge tan head. Head was enlarged due to an amateur poor by myself - came  in over two fingers. The beer was darker than I anticipated but is very appealing. Head retention was surprisingly short and virtually no lacing occurred.

The aroma is incredibly complex. There are dark fruits immediately present with cherries most noticeable and plums and raisins in the background. It took numerous sniffs to identify but the other prominent aroma I can detect is brown sugar. The aroma has numerous other treasures to discover but my nose was not feeling up to the task on this day.

The taste mimics the aroma and includes a lot of dark fruit, some brown sugar, and a bit of a bready taste. I also taste roasted malts and some chocolate that were not foreshadowed by the aroma. The finish almost has a faint coffee taste and betrays the presence of the 10% ABV.

The mouthfeel is not incredibly smooth or harsh - occupying that middle ground. Carbonation is moderate as well.

Bottiglia del 2007. Aspetto fantastico, colore marrone scuro con schiuma cremosa. Aroma sublime, complesso tra cioccolato, frutta e resine. In bocca meravigliosa BSA, equilibrata tra malto luppolo e alcol. Gran bere, gran bere.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2011 Sampled the 2009 vintage. Such a good brew. Ridiculously smooth and malty. Really enjoyed the flavoring that is included in this brew. Definitely great when it has been aged. Be careful when opening. Lost half the bottle when we opened it. Didnt even have a chance of saving it as it shot right out.

Bottle. Very dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate malty and sweet aroma, very fruity  dark berries/raisins/plums, light roastiness and licorice together with light alcohol. Body is average to full, malty and sweet flavor, very fruity, light acidity together with licorice and roastiness. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, fruity with light acidity, light alcohol. Far too sweet for my taste, not so super-sweet what I expected.

Wow. Bottle sample. Pours a very dark brown more to black, with a nice beige head that fades away to nothing. No lace. The aroma from this delectable beauty is of sweet dark fruits, particularly dates, plum and raisin. Taste is of raisin, bread and the complexity goes on. Needless to say I really enjoyed this brew.
Bottle. 2008. Dark muddy brown with toffee and dark fruit aromas. Rich smooth and creamy. Brown sugars and dark fruits in the velvet smooth mouth. Delish brew.
In degustazione al locale del Polli a Milano, mi è piaciuta ma non esageratamente, pensavo fosse una imperial stout, forse aveva dei problemi? boh la riproverò

11.2 oz bottle. Pours a deep ruby brown with a small light tan reddish hued froth. Aroma is very sharp and fruity, lots of big dark fruits, plum, some sweet cherry, raisin, a bit funky and a touch cheesy. Flavor starts with a Very nice sharp cherry Note. Picks up some woody earthy funky characteristics along with a toasty sweetness. Finishes a bit more on the tart side, biting yet still nicely complex and vinous. The sweet and sour notes linger with a touch of booziness. Medium body and a sharper carbonation. Excellent beer

Big thanks to my buddy djrn for sending me this bottle. This has been on my wants for a long time. I wanted my first beer of 2011 to be a good one and I think this should do the job nicely. 2007 vintage. 

The beer pours a hazy dark brown color with a huge tan head. A great looking beer. The aroma is crazy complex. I get a lot of brown sugar, cherries, chocolate and a sourdough bread component. All of the components meld very well together and make this beer a joy to smell. Hopefully the beer will taste as good as it smells. 

The flavor doesnt disappoint. I get a lot of roasted malt and chocolate flavors in the beer. I also get a lot of dark fruit - mainly cherries - along with some sweet brown sugar notes. Some of the sips reveal some coffee notes in the flavor. The coffee is unexpected but compliments the other flavors very, very well. There is a little bit of alcohol in the flavor but it is fairly well hidden. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. 

A truly exceptional beer and one that I am going to love to try again. Luckily Ross send me another bottle which I plan on aging for several more years.
Bottle at Craigs house. Dark brown or black colour. Small head although tends to overflow. Was almost a while colour head. Fairly heavy taste.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2011 De strusse
Pannepot
2007 bottle we have been sitting on for a while. Pours dark brown with a murky appearance. Medium head and retention for a mile. Strong smooth aroma of buttered toffee, dark fruits and a little alcohol. Smells lovely. Flavor is boozy buttered toffee and chocolate fudge with a nice spice note. Very good. One of the better beers I have had in a while. Finishes with a mild Belgian funk. The age has done this wonders.

Very very nice. Dark, roasted malt, espresso, chocolate and fruits even maybe a rum back taste.  Its complex and yet subtle and smooth. Rich, creamy but still docile.  Well balanced, good smell, taste, and for a black beer the palate isnt assaulted. Really nice, my wife even liked it, who isnt a fan of really dark beer. Overall, I love it. I have liked the other Struisse beers Ive had, I would recommend it. Try one

2008 bottle. Appearance: Quite black, cola like, with a small brown head. Aroma: lots of raisins, quite malty, vanilla, leather, cocoa, lots of spices, slight hint of alcohol. Very nice. Flavour: Big dark fruit hit at first, then nuts, spice, leather, malt, quite a thick mouthfeel, rich alcoholic finish. Very nice indeed. Enjoyed whilst sitting in a cabin on Christmas night in front of a log fire.

On tap at the local option. Pour is a dark brown with a creamy beige head. Nice retention and lacing on this one. As expected, a spicy fruity nose. Nice creamy head; leather, dark fruits, Belgian sugars, mild bitterness, and simple maltiness. This brew is of course fantastic,  and it just meshes perfectly from one element to another

330ml bottle. Dark mahogany with a minimal tan head and a quick ring of lace. Roasted barnyard, hickory smoke and licorice on the nose. Everything but the barnyard follows over with some sugar pie and a long warming finish. Retarded good.
2008 bottle.  Aromas of raisin, plum, and caramel malt.  Flavor is very similar with dark fruits, spices, and sweet malt flavors.  This bottle was super carbonated, and I would like to revisit it.

Thanks to Dan for this.  Pours a very dark brown with a thinning off white fizzy head.  Aroma is raisin, plum, malt and alcohol.  Taste is just a gluttony of flavours.  Purple fruits, plums, raisins.  Sweet spices and dark malts with a hint of chocolate.  Nice carbonation tickles your palate.  What a glorious drink.

Wow, what an incredible beer.  Pours a deep, dark reddish brown with amazing aromas of fresh fruit.  This beer is very active and fruity, sweet, tangy, malty, spicy with some yeast.  The 10 plus percent alcohol is completely masked by complexity and deliciousness of this ale.  Wonderful.  Ive had Wild Pannepot, and I am one of only 68 raters.  Had it on draft at Ebenezers in Maine, and somehow this one is better.  Definitely one of the top 50 beers!

2007 brew. big dark brew, but very murky, kinda composted tea in colour. this brew demands attention. big complex farmhand notes. roasted, hickory smoke, licorice, super complex, i can smell this all this all night long and get something different. brown sugar. on the palate it is super complex, very sugar pie (yes I am french canadian but not from quebec), complex brew! very appealing. Im amazed. slightly boozy finish but im surprised by the balance of this brew. again, it is slightly different on each sip. Wonderful! light out top beer ever.

2007 Vintage

G: Poured into a Mikasa chalice.

A: Very dark mahogany with hints of ruby and a large, slightly-reddened head with lots of lacing. Some sediment present.

S: Yeast character as well as some sweetness-perhaps cherries. 

T: Very strong flavors from the outset. Taste hits hard with plenty of dark fruits, spices, and cherries. Also, hints of chocolate. 

M: Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. The 10% abv is hardly present. 

D: Quite complex and very drinkable. As of yet, by far the best quad that Ive had.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-11-2009

Bottle. Brown color, beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, roasted, biscuit, chocolate yeast. Taste is very complex, it has has a soft mouthfeel, very creamy, and has dried fruit and biscuit flavor. Excellent winter warmer.

33 cl bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a small off-white head. I have a sniff and smell mostly chocolate. As I have a few sips the aroma turns out to be much broader - theres vanilla, raisin, dried fruit, some booziness, and walnut. Very nice palate, not too oily and a soft carbonation. I had expected something different, but Im certainly not complaining. Great beer!

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2010 0.33l Bottle.  Pours a dark molasses.  Aroma is rich and complex with predominantly dried fruit and caramel.  Taste is a good balance of malts with very prevalent raisin and caramel flavors - I would call it almost rummy.  But, this is balanced with a nice subtle hop flavor as the base.  The other stand out of this beer is the soft and smooth carbonation.  It provides the flavor of the beer with a soft pillow.
Dark and murky with a fluffy head. Gorgeous sweet nose. Good bubblesbut a bit on the sweet side. Very grapey. and overly spiced.

Bought at Drankenhandel Geers.
Complex, nearly black strong ale with a solid brown head. Very potent brew, less sweet that I would have expected. Great combination of malts and slight bitterness of the hops, all very well balanced. Im not surprised to see that the list of ingredients confirms its complexity, even if its deceptively easy to drink for a 10% ABV brew...

2006 - 11.2 oz bottle from the cellar.  Damn, did I really pay $5.99 for this bottle?  

Nose is big, sweet fruits with raisins and dates dominating. Pours a dense black with a fine head dissipating quickly. 

It was five minutes after popping the top before I poured it, but it was slowly effervescing and dribbling foam and beer out the top of the bottle. As soon as I poured it, the carbonation quickly finished, though.

There is a quick bitterness in the taste of this one that nicely balances the ripe fruits promised in the nose. 

Palate, for me, is the strongest suite for this one. There is a creamy texture just slightly buzzed by the light carbonation. The bitterness rides lightly on the delicate carbonation and the sweetness helps make this one just smooth enough. 

Finish is just dry enough. 

Im liking this bottle a lot more than I remember liking the first bottle that I drank the evening I came home from the store with the pair. I remember the first bottle being a disappointment, but this one is is just fine. I guess it needed a few years to grow up.

11.2 oz vintage 2006 bottle sent from Dany / Glouglouburp, pours dark brown with a medium beige / tan head. Very complex aroma of black currants, raisins, plum, molasses and caramel. Dark roasty malt flavour upfront, with the complex dried fruits coming in immediately after, also with burnt caramel and molasses. Wonderful.

One of the best balanced beers I know. Raisiny aroma, some caramel, some alcohol. Very complex and herbal taste. Wonderfully creamy and nutty. Very delicate mouthfeel suited by soft carbonation. Very good balance between the malts and the hops. Its a beer without mistakes, which almost leads you to think that its somehow not special. But it is.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2011 Bottle. Very dark brown with a little head thats off-white. Aroma is soft alcohol, dried fruits and caramelized malts. Taste has something creamy, like butterscotch. Also caramel hints. Its very soft and easy on the tongue; delicate finish as well, where some sipcyness emerges. Excellent finish and palate, but somehow still expected a tad more. (old rating; 747517)

New rating.

The more I drink it the more I like it.

Hazy deep brown colored with light brown head. Aroma is very intense and complex: chocolate, prunes, cherries, strawberries, liquor, spicy. Taste is also complex, with a intense malty  sweetness and sherry aftertaste, light bitterness, long mouthfeel. Full body. Rather near to perfection for my mouth.
More drinkable than most of his counteparts in this style.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2012 Dark cocacolaish with little head. Aroma roasted malt, coffee, chocolate dark fruits, molasses. Taste sweet roasted malt,  dark fruits, brown sugar and molasses, bitter coffee, chocolate. Full body. Text creamy. Finish long bitter. Almost a porter.

Brown pour with creamy off white head and lace. Aroma is dried fruit, molasses, and dates. Dates, prunes, raisins, pic your poison, molasses, and honey flavor as well. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Damn nice beer.

Pours brown, tan head. Yeastie, leathery aroma laced with cinnamon and a bit of Brett. Flavour gives a great blend of Belgian yeast character married well with the added spices. Seems like the Brett is slowly taking over the flavor. A nice and unique beer.

Bottle. 2007 vintage. Pours a deep reddish brown color with a very big fluffy, fizzy 3 finger tan head that slowly settles. This has a slightly sour smelling dark fruit aroma. Some booze notes evident as well in the smell. Very light mouthfeel with some carbonation. Dark fruit, spice, and a slight sourness fills your mouth as you take a drink. Slight bitterness along with the sweetness. Lingering warmth from the booze. Overall, not bad but just as I remember having this beer before, the light mouthfeel and overcarbonation I feel really distracts from the wonderful flavors this beer has.

2007. Leaps out of the bottle. Molasses, brown sugar, date aroma. Medium, lively head that dissipates rather quickly. Thick, syrupy, deep dark brown appearance with a sedimenty bottom. Mid-level sweetness with an almost bitter finish; pretty fizzy.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 A strangely complex beer with all kinds of spices and half of the medicine cabinet in it. Licorice, plums, caramel, coffee, banana.... something like phenols that some whiskies have. Also its like someone is mowing the lawn in your mouth. Relatively sweet. 

EDIT: Tämä Old Fishermans Ale on erittäin musta, vaalean ruskealla vaahdolla varustettu olut. Tuoksussa on karamellia, paahtunutta mallasta, lakritsia, banaania, rusinaa, mausteita, luumuja ja vain vähän alkoholia. Maku on alkoholiin vivahtava, kevyesti hiivainen, luumuinen, banaaninen, lakritsinen ja kypsän hedelmäinen. Kai tähän on puoli lääkekaappiakin uponnut. Suutuntuma on rikas ja kohtalaisen hiilihappoinen.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2010 33 cl bottle, aged for three years in room temperature. Murky reddsih-brown beer with a huge beige head. Aroma is very complex: earthy Brettanomyces, herbal/medicinal and slightly peppery spices, rhum-like dark sugars, ripe berries, a hint of licorice and salt. Tastes drier than one might expect. Well aged flavor, a hint of milk acidic sourness and brett character. Dryfruit sweetness and balancing saltiness of dark malts. Some sour chocolate in the finish. Strong without being alcoholic at all. Medium bodied, low carbonated palate. Very complex, rich beer to sit down with. One of the greatest beer experiences that I´ve had.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014 A beautiful, very dark-brown beer with a great, big and beige head. The nose is very delicious and quite sweet, fleshy, dark fruits, plums, strawberries, some port wine and roastiness. Taste is very complex, strawberries, dark fruits with lot of sweetness, however, it is balanced due to herbal spicyness that dries the mouth. Nice and slippery to drink with some warming alcohol. Very complex and tastefull beer, every moutful tastes slightly different; the great, quite sweet beer.

Bottle:
Big off white foamy head, disappears slow.
A nice brown colored beer.
Smell dark fruits, sweets, some darker ingredients and spices.
Taste is thicker and (imo) better than the other special Pannepots I had.
Cough syrup/old mans ale like with hints of dried dark fruits, brown sugars, toasted ingredients, yeast and hint of liquorice and hops.
A well balanced (no direct alcohol taste) and fine full sweet/light bitter tasty beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Vintage 2007, thanks SpenceDB
Appearance:  Pours a red tinted dark brown with large bubbly head, that quickly dissipates to a micro stripe of white.

Aroma:  Warm, flat coke, wild cherry, ginger and a medicine cabinet, perhaps some funky yeast..

Taste: A sweet and sour cherry tart twang, noticeable roasted malt, nutmeg and ginger spice finishing slightly funky ,dry and bitter..

Mouthfeel: Sticky with medium carbonation..

Overall:  A treat, and good chilled all the way up to room temperature. This would pair well with cheese or chocolate.
Sweet and smooth. Pours a dark color with a brown head. 10% and 2007 version. Alcohol is very well hidden by the delicious flavor of the ale.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (2007) Pours clear dark brown, with big caffee latte colored dissapearing head. Aroma is ginger, prunes, , typically belgian sour yeast, raisins and malt. All in all, wery rich and complex. Taste is also wita a lot of impressions, like mature dark fruits, dark malt, yeast, sourness and a nice warming mouthfeel from the 10% of alcohol. The carbonation is average - yummie.

330 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated @ 27.8.2010.
Pours a dark brown colour with a small, beige and thick head. Rich aroma of dark fruits, Belgian yeast, chocolate and light hoppiness. Medium sweet flavour of chocolate, fruits and loads of different kinds of spices. Medium/full bodied, oily texture and decent carbonation. Long and dry finish. Excellent brew.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2011 2006 330ml bottle. A fizzy pour brought me a mahogany and opaque headless brew. Big malt and caramel aromas with plumbs and dried fruits. A subtle hint of anise and cocoa are noticed. Body is full and creamy and a lightly dry finish. Carbonation is present yet softened. The flavor here is beeter than I hoped for and a fine example of what aging a good ale can do. Rich and complex showing notes of berries, plumbs, caramel, licorice, cocoa and malt. It really is quite a nice blend. Thanks to Sloth (Bert) for the bottle! 2010 release, 330ml bottleA dark mahogany cloudy concoction. Nice fluffy beige head. Looks even more impressive than the Rochefort 10 I just finished. Cocoa powder in the nose along with some dried fruit, figs impressive as it is young. Creamy body, fair carbonation. Lightly bitter, lightly dry. A beer you want to talk about even at this young stage. Roasted coffee flvor melds with dried fruits, really has some depth and I cant help but put the rest of the bottles away for a few years. Get this while you can.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: 330ml bottle from a kw private order. 2008 vintage. pours deep hazy brownish red with a lasting tan head. aroma of toffee, caramel, coffee, dark berry, and spice. the flavours is much bigger and massively complex. rich aged roasty malt flavour upfront with dark berry and spices after. long complex and balanced. world class stuff.

07 bottle. Not sure this deserves the hype or rating. I may have gotten a bad bottle. dont know. smells like sour apples and dark fruit. pours a deep brown with a HUGE head. flavor is mild of dark fruit and molasses. Much like a Rochefort 10, but not as good. Alcohol is well hidden. Good beer, but not great.

Bottle. very dark red colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is  reminiscent of a strong red wine, with some dark berries and a lot of dark berries. Raisins and rum-essence as well. Generally very sweet and thick. Taste has a large fruity sweetness as well, coupled with the dark berries and some subtle yeast-characteristics. A little hops in the finish. A fairly substantial alcohol-burn, providing the thickness. Big body, long duration, low carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2012 33 cl bottle, pours dark with a minimal creamy head, aroma of chocolate, dark fruits and licorice with a hint of coffee, taste is fairly sweet consisting of chocolate, dark fruits and malt caramel, nicely balanced, very smooth and pleasant mouthfeel, overall a great beer.

Pannepot 2006 (bottle)
A: snifter. Pours a deep and rich mahogany color, impenetrable by light, with a creamed coffee colored head. Good retention level and nice ring-like lacing.

S: big aromas of sweet dark malts, raisins, figs, plums, big spices, tones of clove.

T: wonderful Belgian Quad. Some light sour berries, big fig, plum and strawberry notes. Light blueberry. Huge spices but they have mellowed some.

M: full bodied. Mild carbonation level. Extremely smooth.

D: very nice brew and well worth getting, I will be looking to get this again and again. Extremely drinkable.

8/20/10.  Big thanks to jtclockwork for this one!  2007 bottle.  The pour is a nice solid brown with red on the edges when held to the light, and a nice fizzy but tight brown head that fades to a ring and sticks.  A nice light and fruity aroma with a dash of sour and a nice hinted backing of roasted/dark/caramel malts.
